11.content: What age range should your fella be?
11.title: Male

111.content:
Frankie: 500 pounds, 13 years old. Frankie is just starting high school and slightly worried about being so massive at such an early age. But he does love his huge body...

Jay: 600 pounds, 15 years old. Already a sophomore, Jay hasn't made many friends due to his size. He has a few close ones and is questioning his sexuality.

1111.content:
Frankie was already awake when his alarm clock began to beep. Today marked his first day of high school, and like any normal thirteen year old he was extremely anxious. Unlike any normal thirteen year old, however, Frankie had just recently crested five hundred pounds.

He'd always been a large boy, just a little on the chubby side, but after his father divorced his mother when he was five, his mom had babied the entire family, feeding them extra sweets and comfort food. Things really started getting out of hand as Frankie approached his teen years. Kids had always made fun of him- due to his massive size he couldn't take part in sports or other ply activities. Recently, however, the teasing had ramped up, and when the teasing ramped up so did his eating, sending the young teen spiraling into morbid obesity.

While Frankie would never admit it (not even to himself) he did love his huge body. He loved the warmth of the thick layer of fat that coated his entire body, he loved how his body jiggled and sloshed with even the slightest movement, and he even loved touching and pinching his thick rolls.

He sighed and rolled out of bed. Frankie had long given up on trying to sit up, his massive belly made it nearly impossible and his long buried abs were unable to support the weight. He stood up, steadying himself on his bed side table. Once his body stopped jiggling, he began the slow waddle to his mirror.

Though it was only a few steps away, Frankie was already starting to get winded. When he finally reached the mirror he stopped to study himself. The teen usually slept in the buff, but modesty had long ceased to be a problem for him. His heavy belly covered his privates (now painfully swollen but irritatingly inaccessible) and hung down to his mid thighs. At this point, his belly was so big that he could barely wrap his arms around it. The rest if him wasn't so little either. His hips and ass were wide rolling expanses of milky fat that were forever knocking into things. His love handles were thick, almost two inches of overhanging flab. His thighs were enormous flabby tree trunks. With every step, they rub together, and against his crotch and underbelly. Even his chest was soft and doughy. His moobs were saggy and a long time ago had expanded into the area underneath his arms. A large double chin was neighbors to his man boobs, and was slowly but steadily becoming a triple chin. Every part of his body was covered in a thick layer of lard, even his fingers looked like tightly packed sausages.

Once again, Frankie sighed, grabbing his love handles and shaking them slightly, sending ripples through his body. Well, maybe it wasn't so bad. He cocked his head, before shuffling to the side and wincing. He large belly pushed out into the space before him, almost like it was a completely different entity. Worse, he couldn't even see the entirety of his corpulent form in the mirror. Either his ass or his belly was cut out depending on whether he shuffled forward or backwards.

Looking down (a view composed entirely of his saggy tits and belly), Frankie tried to push it from his mind. Who knew? Maybe this year would be different! Maybe this year he'd get friends, and the bullies would find someone new to pick on. Hell, maybe he'd even find a girlfriend (or perhaps, a boyfriend). It was a brand new year after all, and anything could happen!

Or potentially get a whole lot worse.

Resigning himself to his fate, Frankie decided to start getting ready.
1111.title: Frankie

choices: Digg in anyway (he is starving after all)
Better not (these jeans are tight enough)
11111.content:
Well, first things first. Grabbing a mostly clean pair of boxers, Frankie flopped down on his creaking bed. Now the easy part: easily he pulled his boxers up around his calves. Now for the harder part: his thighs and underbelly. This was a bit trickier. While difficult he was able to scoot his boxers up his thighs and around his expanded belly. At the expense of his breathe, however.

For a moment, he sat panting at the slight exertion. Then he hefted himself up again, once again sending his belly sloshing. Frankie grimaced and fiddled with the elastic band of his boxers. The band was pulled as tight as it could, and cut deeply into his belly.

Once standing, he grabbed a pair of jeans. They were new, bought a few weeks ago by his mother for his first day of school. After trying them on once to make sure they fit, he hadn't touched them again, preferring the comfort of his boxers and sweatpants.

Once again, Frankie sat down in his bed and began the arduous task. When he reached his thighs, he encountered a problem. Despite his best efforts, Frankie was unable to pull the pants up over his thunder thighs.

"Crap."

Sweat dripping down his brow, Frankie leaned back. With a grunt, he was able to up the jeans up. Panting, Frankie wiped the sweat off his brow. Now for the hardest part, getting it around his belly.

It was already apparently, that the jeans weren't getting around his belly apron. With another grunt, he pushed it to the side and tried to button his pants. After a few moments of struggling, he stopped to catch his breathe. This was the most exercise the obese teen and gotten all summer. Still panting, Frankie sucked in his tummy and tried again.

After a few minutes of trying to pull the fabric closed, he stopped and flopped down on his bed. Now that he was lying down he decided to give it one last go. With one last herculean effort, he managed to get the pants putting and zippered.

Frankie winced again, and fidgeted with the waistband. If his boxers had been tight before, his jeans were painfully tight. He rolled over again, to check himself in the mirror.

His belly apron lolled over the hem of his jeans and he was rocking a rather large muffin top. He looked as though he was ready to burst out of the jeans. Frankie sighed. Five hundred pounds of fat stuffed into a four hundred fifty wide jeans.

Frankie looked away, and grabbed on of his shirts. That went on a bit easier. When he caught side of himself in the mirror, however, he sighed in frustration again. The shirt was just a bit too small, and revealed a good inch of belly fat. That was a easy fix though. Frankie grabbed one of his hoodies and through that on, zipping it up. There! That solved that problem.

Hard work done, Frankie wiped sweat from his brow. The boy was still quite out of breathe, but he'd over come the greatest hurtle. Quickly, the boy threw on his socks and shoes and brushed his teeth. When he was done, he headed downstairs for breakfast.

His mother, sister and younger brother were already down there.

"Morning, Frankie."

"Good morning, Mom."

Though it was early, his mother was already cooking up a storm. The plumb woman had already put out a spread: large stacks of pancakes, crunchy bacon and sausage, greasy eggs and toast smothered in butter.

Frankie's younger brother Jake had already tucked in. While younger by three years, he was by no means a small boy. Frankie was larger by a good hundred pounds, but the ten year old had already crested into morbid obesity. In fact, he was already larger than Frankie had been at his age, despite being a few inches shorter. As the baby of the family, Jake'd been babied all his life-spoiled even- and had almost no memories of his fitness obsessed father. So it made sense that he was larger- he had a three year head start.

On the other hand, Frankie's elder sister, Jenna, was biting into an apple. While Jake had no problems tucking into his super-sized meal and his expanding waistline, Jenna was just the opposite. The fifteen year old had grown self-conscious of her size -a modest three hundred twenty pounds compared to her younger brothers. She'd been on her way to morbid obesity once too, but subjected to the same teasing as Frankie, she'd grown health conscious and started working out and dieting. A lifetime of overeating however was hard to remedy however. Jenna was quite stylish however, and usually wore clothing designed to slim down her body.

"Here's your breakfast hon." Frankie's mother set down a plate in front of him, filled to the brim with food-a six stack of large pancakes, eight pieces of bacon, three sausages, four eggs and a stack of buttered toast. She kisses his chubby cheek, "Eat up, baby, you need your strength for school."

Frankie looked down at the spread and fiddled with his waistband. His pants were painfully tight, and about ready to burst. It probably wasn't a good idea to eat all the greasy food(and probably get bloated). However... His stomach let out a long, painful gurgle. Despite having a rather large midnight snack last night, he was famished, probably from his previous battle of the bulge.

His mother patted his hungry belly, "Sounds like someone's hungry!"

Frankie loomed down at his belly, pinching a roll of fat with one hand, trying to decide what to do.
11111.title: Getting dressed

choices: Skinny, handome guy would talk to him
Another super fat (though not as large as Frankie) went to the school
111111.content:
In the end, hunger won out. Frankie cleared his plate, plus and extra three pancakes and sausages, leaving him overly full and terribly bloated. Now the pain around his middle was excruciating. Resisting the urge to belch (his mother's one rule), the teen massaged his swollen belly with both hands.

His mother glanced up at the clock. "Oh goodness, we're going to be late!" Grabbing her car keys, Frankie's mom ushered her waddling brood out into her car.

Their first stop was the middle school. If mobility was a problem for Frankie, it was a major issue for Jake. After a moment, of struggling (and Frankie's hands on his ass pushing him up) the obese ten year old finally made it out of the doors, panting and already exhausted. Frankie watch as he made his slow way up to the school's entrance, pausing every step to catch his breathe, belly sloshing around and popping out if his shirt. Not that Jake minded- or could even see it.

He had always considered his younger brother a cute kid. His baby fat and chubby cheeks made him look adorable, and his curly blonde hair only cemented his cherubic resemblance. However, if something was not done, Jake would probably be immobile by the time he was Frankie's age. Maybe earlier at the rate he was going. Though Frankie thought he looked cute, he weren't sure how he felt about that. Maybe Jenna's attitude was rubbing off on him.

The high school was only a few blocks down from the middle school, but Frankie's mother drove the two, knowing that Frankie wouldn't make it.

"Have fun you two!" His mother called, as they left. Jenna rolled her eyes at her brother, and Frankie returned the gesture.

As soon as Frankie entered the halls, he knew that this year would be no different from the rest. As he passed people, they would point and stare at his obese body, a few even openly gawking. The high school was a regional school, meaning that for most of the students, this was their first time seeing the five hundred pound freshman. No one made any comments yet- they were probably too shocked.

Despite running late, Frankie managed to make it to homeroom on time. Sweat dribbling down his brown and onto his cheeks, Frankie crammed himself into a desk in the back. The fit was almost as tight as his pants, but that was to be expected and something the big teen was used to.

He leaned back in his chair panting.

"Um... Hi."

Frankie looked up, mildly surprised that someone was talking to him. Standing before him was a smiling boy, with on hand extended. The boy seemed friendly enough, judging by his smile, and looked Asian- Korean or Japanese, Frankie would have guessed by the types of restaurants in the areas.

"I'm Lewis."

Frankie took the boy's hand in his sweaty one and give it a shake, "Frankie." You say slightly bewildered that a...
111111.title: Digg in anyway (he is starving after all)

1111111.content:
Frankie took the boy's hand in his sweaty one and give it a shake, "Frankie." He said slightly bewildered that a extremely good looking teen would come up and talk to him.

Lewis looked exactly like one of the popular kids at his old school. Thin, with small wiry muscles, an even tan and effortlessly cool. His short dark hair was spiked, making it look like he'd just rolled out of bed. On his shirt was the logo of a band Frankie had never heard of (but was probably super cool) and his plaid shirt was unbuttoned and rolled up to his elbows. He wore glasses, black and the only thing chunky about him.Even his jeans were cool- baggy and ripped (something that the never made in Frankie's size).

Frankie couldn't help but stare at him.. Well that and wonder if Lewis might need a stronger prescription.

"Nice to meet you." Still grinning, Lewis slid into the seat next to yours.

"Ah, nice to meet you too." Suddenly, suspicious he look around the room, watching for anyone laughing. No way someone this cool, would sit next to him if it wasn't for some overly elaborate joke. However, besides the stares Frankie usually garnered, no one was giggling in his direction. In fact, most of the students looked more anxious about their rapidly approaching first day of high school.

"Jesus christ."

Frankie's head whips back around when he heard Lewis begin to speak again. The other boy however was still smiling. Frankie did note that he looked a little worried too.

"I feel like I'm about to have a heart attack." He continued, "I mean- lets stop dickin' around and start this already."

Despite the fact that Frankie wanted nothing more than to prolong the wait for the eminent school year, he nodded. "Yeah, if we don't start soon, I'm gonna die of anticipation.

In spite of their apparent differences, Frankie found Lewis extremely easy to talk with and soon struck up a fast friendship with the boy. Apparently, his parents ran the Korean BBQ and he'd seen Frankie and his family come in a few times. Frankie also learned that Lewis was an honor student (mostly due to his parents breathing down his neck than any personal commitment) and that they were both currently obsessed with the same MMORPG.

With less than five minutes on the clock to homeroom starting, Lewis asked to see Frankie's class schedule. After studying it for a few minutes, his face broke out into a big smile, "Awesome! We have social studies and gym together."

Involuntarily, Frankie groaned at the mention of gym- though things might be better if he had a friend in class. When Lewis passed the papers back, Frankie also noticed they had the same lunch period. Awesome, so he had his favorite and least favorite periods with his new friend.

"You should sit with me." Lewis added, Frankie nodded but the conversation was ended by the bell, signaling that homeroom had begun.

When the teacher turned her back on the class to write something on the board, Lewis shot the obese teen a thumbs up.

Frankie grinned back, finally happy.

Since the classes he had with Lewis were in the afternoon, that meant that Frankie would have to slug through most of the day alone. No one bothered him, but he could hear people giggling when he walked by and had even caught a few people pointing at his enormous rear or jiggling belly. By the time his first class with Lewis, Frankie was practically jogging to it.
1111111.title: Skinny, handome guy would talk to him

11111111.content: Lunch time had finally come and Frankie was starving. Even the constant snacking in between classes wasn't as much food as he was used to at home and as a result he was ready to stuff his face silly. And so Frankie bounded down the halls as fast as his fat body would let him towards the lunch room, jiggling the whole way. When he opened the door to the lunch room however, Frankie remembered that he was supposed to sit with Lewis and his friends. He could see the whole situation about to play out in front of him. They'd probably all be jerks and make fun of him for his weight... but then again, Lewis didn't. So Frankie filled his tray with half the usual amount as to look less like a pig (although it was still quite a lot) and headed over to the table where Lewis was sitting.
11111111.title: The next period was Lunch

choices: Conner went up to get seconds as well.
111111111.content:
Frankie took a look at Lewis' friends. They all looked relatively cool, but at least they weren't the cookie cutter type who wore all the same style of everything. Sucking in his gut, Frankie managed to slip in next to Lewis. The other kids looked at him for a bit and Frankie's face reddened, but then Lewis remembered to introduce him. "Hey guys, this is my friend Frankie. We're in homeroom together!"

"Oh boy, here it comes," Frankie thought to himself, bracing for a barrage of insults. Instead, he was met with warm smiles. A short Portuguese girl with dark red hair (probably died) stuck her hand out at him.

"Hi, I'm Gabby" she said kindly. Frankie bashfully shook her hand, mentally twitching when his arm jiggled from the simple motion.

"Nice to meet you, Frankie. We were just talking about some of the latest scumbags running for office these days," Said a tall, lanky blond boy with a crooked nose.

"No, that was mostly you, Nick." Said a shorter, chubby black haired boy. Then he turned to Frankie. "Sorry, Nick likes to rant about politics. I'm Matt. I like drawing and being a cynical asshole, but at least I find myself funny." he said with a straight face, and Frankie laughed. Frankie looked at what Matt was doodling at the time, and had to say that it was honestly pretty impressive.

Lewis gestured towards another boy at the table who was busily chowing down into his lunch. He was tall with short, almost shaved blond hair and had a strong muscular build, but enough soft chub to cover it all and give him a nice belly without being "fat". Seeing another boy who appreciates food made Frankie feel a little better. "That's Conner." Lewis pointed out. "He's the resident redneck, or at least as close as you can get at this school." Lewis explained that Conner also played that MMORPG they played.

"That's not the only thing they have in common!" A taller girl with multiple colorful bracelets sitting next to Gabby chimed in, wriggling her eyebrows suggestively. Lewis glared at her and threw a muffin wrapper at her, hitting her in her rainbow dyed hair. She responded by punching a bottle in his direction, bouncing off his head, then off Frankie's belly then back in front of her. "WHOO!" She shouted in celebration of her conquest over adversity. Clearly this girl was rather enthusiastic.

Lunch proceeded calmly for the most part, and Frankie was surprised that nobody brought up his weight (which was pressing against the table the whole time) until out of all of them, Lewis mentioned something. Frankie had more food than most of them (except maybe Conner), but to his dismay his stomach let out a fierce growl. The table giggled, and Lewis said "You should probably go fill up that tank with seconds, man."

"No, no... I'm good," Frankie said, still shy around these new potential friends.

"Dude, I've seen you eat at my parent's restaurant before. I know you can put away more than that! Now go get some more. We don't want you passing out on us." He said this in a way that poked fun at him, but there was no hatred. It was a warmer way of saying it, unlike what he was used to.

Frankie waddled up towards the food to fill his tray for real this time. When he was up there, he looked back and noticed an interaction. Lydia, the girl with the rainbow bangs, punched Lewis in the arm and winked. Lewis then shoved her back, laughing. Lydia turned to whisper something to Gabby while Lewis turned to Conner, clearly saying something to him. Conner nodded and smiled, then gave Lewis a pat on the back. Matt was lost in his sketches and Nick was browsing for what was probably the latest memes or news articles regarding national policies or something Frankie didn't understand. Then...
111111111.title: Lewis' friends are nice!

1111111111.content:
As Frankie waddled about filling his for real, Conner came up to get seconds as well.

"Nice to have another big guy in the gang," Conner said casually as he and Frankie both stopped in front of the pasta station. "Hate being the only one to take seconds, but it takes a lot of fuel to run this tank, not to mention getting bigger."

"Do you want to get bigger?" Frankie asked, surprised. Up close, Conner had to be closer to 300 pounds than 200 pounds, and 'tank' seemed a good description of him in general.

"Well, yeah," Conner replied, heaping his plate, "of course I do. Don't you? Well, I suppose you're already big..."

"Yeah, I am, and I like it," Frankie admitted (for the first time to someone his own age).

"Large and in charge, that's what I want to be," Conner went on. "So, do you lift?"

"You mean like in a gym?"

"Yeah."

"No."

"Man, you should, you've got the size for it. I bet you'd make a great....
1111111111.title: Conner a friend as well?

11111111113.content:
"Large and in charge, that's what I want to be," Conner went on. "So, do you lift?"

"You mean, like in a gym?" Frankie replied.

"Yeah."

"No."

"Man, you should, you've got the size for it. I bet you'd make a great Tug-of-War anchor."

"Tug-of-War? Is that a sport? And isn't there a size limit?"

"Of course it's a sport - and the school has two teams, one in the regular league where there is, yeah, a weight limit, and a new one in the new 'weight unlimited' category! It's just MADE for guys like you and me!"

"Well, I'll have to ... ask.... have to think about it."

"Don't think about it, just do it! Sign-up and trials is tomorrow right after school, and two practices a week starting next week. You'll be great! You're probably bigger than most of the Grade 12s. And I'll be there too!"
11111111113.title: Sports for the large!

choices: a few other boys, all large
111111111131.content:
The next day, Frankie tells his mother that he's going to stay after school for a couple of hours.

"Will you need a ride home? I'll ask your father to pick you up."

"Thanks mum."

He takes his gym clothes, for the practice, and arrives at the fieldhouse to find Conner and...
111111111131.title: Frankie tries out for  Tug of War

1111111112.content:
Then... he looked at all the goodies that he could get. Frankie was very pleased that his school cafeteria was ala cart, he could get as much as he liked. He piled on his favorites. Considering he hadn't taken what he normally would have the first time around, he grabbed enough to compensate, plus a little extra. Frankie wasn't feeling embarrassed about his appetite anymore, now that Lewis and his friends had accepted him. After grabbing seconds, he grabbed some desserts while he was up at the line, he didn't want to do too much walking. After paying for his food, he went back to Lewis and his friends and sat back down. Lewis looked at Frankie, he then said "That's more like it, Frankie,". with a smile on his face.

Conner then chimed in. "Dude, that's a lot of food, mind if I have some?" Frankie didn't really want to share. It's not that Frankie was selfish, but he usually didn't like to share his food. However, he was trying to make friends and he didn't want to botch it up.

"Sure. Here, take a couple of brownies." Frankie then handed them over to Conner.

"Thanks dude." Conner said with a smile. Frankie then proceeded to eat the remainder of his lunch. After about 10 minutes, Frankie had devoured his seconds and desserts and he was now quite full and was bloated again. He unconsciously rubbed his very massive belly to help soothe it. Despite the pain, he really enjoyed the sensation of being overly full. As he rubbed his belly he noticed Lewis looking down at it, with a wanting look in his eyes. He meet Lewis' eyes and Lewis cheeks turned scarlet instantly and looked away. Frankie wasn't quite sure what to make of it. He couldn't imagine that a gorgeous male specimen like Lewis would find him, a mountain of blubber, at all attractive. Frankie, Lewis and all the rest of the gang carried on until a the lunch bell rang and they all went to their respective classes. Frankie looked down at his schedule to make sure he knew where he was going next. It was..
1111111112.title: Frankie returned with his meal.

choices: "Choir? I didn't take you for a singer."
11111111122.content:
Frankie was sort of relieved that he had algebra next. Math wasn't his worst subject, and of course anything was better than gym. As he waddled down the halls kids murmured, glancing his way but looking away before they thought he could tell they were talking about him. Of course, when you take up a third of the hall and jiggle with every slow step as Frankie does, you come to expect this kind of treatment. Better than being ignored, Frankie figured.

Frankie collapsed into a chair as soon as he got into the classroom. A blonde girl behind him made a disgusted face, but he didn't notice and if he did he probably wouldn't care. Frankie rested his doughy arms on his belly, feeling the mound of lard rise and fall as he took in air. Once the world came back to him and his breath steadied, he looked around his class. It wasn't a huge class. There were at least 20 kids including himself. Matt and Lydia, Lewis' friends from lunch, had sat next to him but he hadn't noticed while he was catching his breath. They were studying each others' complex notebook doodles and Lydia was showing off a set of new sketching pens she got over the summer, prime and ready for NOT math.

The teacher rose from his desk. He ran a hand through his thinning, graying hair and approached the board. As he rambled on about expectations for the year in a dreary tone, masked with an earnest but weak attempt at hopefulness, Matt prodded Frankie's arm with a pencil. Frankie turned around, his second chin contorting around his neck.

"Hey Frankie," Matt whispered. "Are you any good at math?"

"Yeah, sort of." The obese teen replied.

"Great, 'cause I'll need someone to copy off of this year," He chuckled, but Frankie got the feeling that he was serious. Lydia nodded in agreement with Matt. Frankie turned back to face the board. As he zoned off, his hands gently squeezed the soft surface of his stomach. Frankie had a habit of playing with his belly when he got bored. The squishiness soothed his mind and before he knew it math class was over. Frankie looked at his schedule as Lydia leaned over him.

"Looks like you next class is..." She ran a finger over his schedule.
11111111122.title: A Very Uneventful Class

choices: Frankie isn't that good. He's put in the baritone section.
Frankie is very good and is placed in the tenor section.
111111111221.content:
"Choir? I didn't take you for a singer."

"Huh? Choir?" Frankie picked up his schedule. "Why do I have choir on my schedule? It wasn't even in my top three options."

"They like to do that kinda crap here," said Matt. "I asked for art in my freshman year and they gave me chorus for a semester. They like to make people take that class, otherwise nobody would."

"Well, Karl would," said Lydia.

"Karl? Frankie tried to remember which classmate that was.

"Yeah, he usually sits with us at lunch. He was off at some GSA meeting today."

"What's a GSA?"

"You know, gay-straight alliance? Basically people talk about issues with bullying and gay stuff. Not that we really have a problem with that in our school, but Karl's always complaining there aren't enough gay guys."

"So he seems..."

"Yeah, pretty much," said Lydia. "Well, you'll find out next period!"

"Oh, and while you're there, can you do something for us?" Matt looked as if he had just remembered something. "Lydia and I have this theory that Karl's into... bigger guys."

"Oh...?" Frankie blushed a little and subconsciously sucked in his gut, not that it did anything.

"Yeah, so see if you can catch him staring at you or anything. Karl's pretty bad at hiding when he's into a guy."

"Hold on, what even makes you think he'd like a guy like me?"

"Well... I don't really know if it's my place to say..." Matt said.

"Connor." Lydia giggled. Matt rolled his eyes.

"Connor?"

"Yeah, those two have an on and off thing going. They hate each other though so it's fun to watch. And if you've ever seen them go at "it", well... Oh, and Karl never gives a clear answer to what his "type" is so we figure it's guys like Connor, otherwise he'd be chasing after Lewis."

"S-seriously?" Frankie's head was spinning with all this gossip. He never figured Connor would be that type of guy... "Well, I guess I'll keep an eye out."

"Sweet!" Lydia got up and grabbed her bag. "Well, I've got to get going to science..." She pouted.

Matt got up casually. "And remember, you did NOT hear that from us. Or at least you didn't hear it from me."

Frankie got up too, although not as easily of course, and headed through the halls to his next class. Chorus class took place in a basic classroom, fitted with risers, stands for sheet music that half the students couldn't read, and a piano in the corner. Frankie grabbed a seat off to the side. The cheap plastic groaned under his weight. Other students filed in, guys moving to one side, girls moving to the other. A tall, thin boy with freckles and neat, short hair, skipped merrily into the room. The moment his gaze shifted to the side of the room with Frankie, however, he paused mid-step and blinked a few times, facing away. The boy took a deep breath and casually strolled over and too the seat next to Frankie.

"Hi! You must be the new guy. I'm Karl!" He said in an upbeat tone. "So, are you tenor, baritone or bass?"

"Uh, am I what?"

"Oh." Karl's face sunk a little, as if Frankie told him he had never heard of Gandhi. "Tenor is higher voices, baritone is middle and bass is low."

"Well, I guess I'm a baritone I think? I don't really sing, I just got this class 'cause they needed more guys."

"Well don't worry. Choir is my favorite class! I'm a tenor by the way." Karl rambled on for a bit about the finer points of singing, and how if Frankie's good he should try out for the school musical. All the while he was smiling in a way Frankie found both genuine and intentional.

"Uh, Karl..." Frankie cut him off. "You sound like you know what you're saying but I really don't know anything about this stuff..."

"Well maybe I could teach you some time!"

Frankie decided now would be a good time to test Lydia and Matt's theory. "Yeah, that would be cool." He stretched back in his chair, his belly poking out from the bottom of his shirt. Karl's eyes fixated on the soft fat for a brief moment before Frankie pulled his shirt back down. "Oh, sorry about that."

"N-no, it's fine... haha..." Karl laughed it off, but something in his voice wavered from his previous confidence.

The teacher came in and began warming up the class. Frankie wasn't quite used to the scales and fumbled every now and then, but Karl was on point. In fact, it seemed like Karl was making a competition out of it almost. Then the teacher announced that he needed to hear from all the new students to assign their part, bass baritone or tenor. When Frankie was called up, Karl smiled at him and said "You'll do fine!" but Frankie wasn't so sure...
111111111221.title: "Choir? I didn't take you for a singer....

choices: Karl offers Frankie a snack at the end of choir class.
Frankie leaves choir to see Matt and Lydia outside in the hall.
1111111112212.content:
Then the choir teacher called all the new students up, one by one, for a voice test.

"It's not really a 'test'," he tried to reassure them, "it's just a way to place you in the correct part of the choir so it's easy for you to sing and you won't strain your voice. For the boys, some of you have voices that are changing, too, so the part you sang last year may not be correct now."

The 'test' was just a set of scales, copying the teacher, then singing along with a song, then singing the National Anthem solo. When Frankie was called up, Karl smiled at him and said "You'll do fine!" but Frankie wasn't so sure.

The first part was easy.

The second part was not quite so easy, but the song was one Frankie knew a little, and so he got into it a bit, and even finished quite a bit louder than he'd expected.

The National Anthem, though, something he'd heard every day at school, seemed really easy, except for one tricky bit.

"Well, Frankie," said the teacher smiling, "you are definitely a tenor. A nice voice. Have you sung much before?"

"No, not really," Frankie admitted.

"That's fine, we get lots of newbies here. Singing can be a lot of fun, and I'm sure some of the other guys in the choir will help out."

"Thanks."

choices: A pond witb a nice stream.
12113.content:
Claire was sitting on the couch, doodling a bit-and getting fairly tired as a result. She rested her arms a bit, leaving her notebook sitting on top of her belly, when she noticed what a fine day it was outside. The birds were singing, the sin was shining, she could even feel a slight breeze through the window. These were Claire's favorite days. If only she could get herself outside...

She tried, she really did. She lurched forward as hard as she could, sifting chip crumbs and cookie bits that had been sitting up against her for a few days. She wiggled from side to side, but all she succeeded in doing was jiggling her whole massive belly and tiring herself out. "Mom!" she called. Her mother, a slightly chubby woman in her 30s, rushed out of the kitchen where she was making Claire a snack. "What is it dear?" "It's such a nice day, I really want to go outside!" Her mother thought for a minute. "Of course, dear, but I think you've put on a bit since you last went out. Do you think you'll still be able to?" Claire paused, then said, "I have no idea, but I'd really like to try!" "Alright, sweety, let me just call your father and we'll get right to it."

As she waited for her parents to be ready, Claire chowed down on several bags of chips and a bottle of Fanta, her favorite soda. "Mom, why's it taking so long?" she shouted, spraying chip crumbs all over her belly. "Just a minute, dear, we have to find everything!" Since Claire's old room had far to small of a door for their cute chubby daughter, all of her old things were stored in there. But, as she was also a perpetually hungry little girl, it had also been given over to food storage, which meant that most of her going-out supplies were stuck in the back. Finally, after Claire had plowed through three of her six chip bags, her parents returned, with her sundress, her sunscreen, a hat, and her plus-sized wheelchair.

Since Claire rarely needed to do anything, she only wore the bare minimum of required clothes, i.e. a T-shirt that just covered her burgeoning eight-year-old boobs and a pair of far overstressed panties. Since she was also so often inside, she was quite pale and just a touch of sun could give her a serious sunburn. Hence the sunscreen and dress.

However much Claire loved to be outside, there was one thing she genuinely despised about the whole experience. That thing was that, despite her inability to take a single step or even slightly move her legs, she was forced to stand for the several agonizing seconds it took for her parents to slather her with sunscreen and put on her dress and hat. More so this time, as Claire had grown (as growing girls do) and now the dress only went down to her waist, leaving the large portion of hanging flab that went down to her knees uncovered and jiggling. It would have to do, however, until they could get an XXXXL model custom-made. Finally, after nearly two minutes spent on her weak and muscleless legs, she was able to ease back into her double-wide wheelchair and head out.

Where will she go?

Normally she spend most of her day inside, eating, watching T.V, drawing, reading and making up stories (to be honest she liked the drawing, reading and made up stories), but it was good if Claire went outside a bit more. Perhaps also meet some others. Since Claire did't went to school she had't much friends. Maybe they would meet some people.

12113111.title: Not those people

choices: The forest gets lighter and more welcoming- Claire is convinced of fairies afoot
The forest gets darker and more foreboding- Claire is scared...
121131111.content:
"Well, thanks in part to my lobbying, the town's park department has just finished building a new path that leads very deep into the forest!" said Mr. Leaf triumphantly, clearly immensely proud of himself. Claire's eyes widened.

"R-Really? Does this mean..."

Mr. Leaf smiled kindly. "Indeed it does, Claire! Your wheelchair will most certainly fit."

Claire would have clapped her hands for joy, if she could have lifted her arms high enough to do so. As it was, she just smiled broadly.

"Yay! Thank you so much, Mr. Leaf! Oh, I'm so excited! Can we, Daddy?"

Her dad chuckled. "Of course, dear! We'll head there right now!" Privately, to Mr. Leaf, he said, "Thank you so much, sir. You have no idea how much this means to Claire."

Mr. Leaf smiled rather oddly and replied, "Oh, it was no trouble at all." And, with a doff of his cap, he was on his way.

_________________________

As Claire's chair moved deeper into the forest, her mind wandered much faster than her body ever could. She had long suspected Mr. Leaf to be a fairy: he spoke oddly, dressed entirely in green, and his last name was Leaf, to boot. But this just confirmed it. A new path, something she had always wanted, to take her where she always wanted to go, on the exact day she could use it. It was simply wonderful.

Claire's parents were not so convinced. They had heard nothing of any new project, and certainly not one involving the park. However, their minds did not turn to magic; being adults, and far too old for that sort of thing, they instead thought it was some sort of trap, designed to ensnare their daughter in some fiendish scheme. This was made all the more potent by the fact that, when Claire's dad turned around (something Claire could not do) Mr. Leaf had entirely disappeared. To Claire, this would have appeared magical; to the adults, it just seemed more suspicious.

Despite all that, they went onward, wheels and feet crunching on the leaves. Onward, into the unknown...

1211311111.title: Deep in the forest

choices: Claire waddles over to meet the other fairies!
Something emerges from that dark gap in the bushes...
12113111111.content:
Claire swore she saw something ducking into the rustling bushes. Something small and bright.

Her eyes widened, and her heart began to race. Could it be...?

"Mom, dad," she muttered, "did you see that? In the bushes?"
Her mother answered. "See what, honey?"
"Something just went in the bushes over there," she said, pointed a pudgy finger to where she'd seen the rustling, "I think it might be a fairy!"
"A fairy?" Her father repeated, sounding incredulous, "I don't know Claire, it might have just been a squirrel or something."
"But it was glowing!"
"It was probably just the light catching off it."

Claire quietly huffed, and her parents went back to reminiscing. If she had the energy to lift her arms, she would cross them in a pout.

Fairies are real, she thought defiantly, and one day, I'll prove it! I'll show them!

And then she gasped, and blinked her eyes a few times as she became convinced she wasn't just seeing things.

Out of the bushes, floated a small winged creature, an illuminating glow on its bright skin and flowing silver hair. It looked just like a thin, very tiny woman in a blue leaf-like dress!
Claire could only watch in awe as she approached her, fixing the obese dreamer with her warm green eyes and a soft smile.

"Hello, Claire," she cooed, her voice smooth and soft as silk, "my name is Lily. Welcome to the Glade of Fairies."
A wide smile crossed the girl's plump face, squishing up her cheeks. "I-I knew it! I knew fairies were real!" She froze and then blinked, looking quizzical. "How did you know my name?"
"Why, our friend told us," Lily smiled, "I believe you met him on the way down the path."

Claire's eyes widened in realisation. Mr. Leaf! I knew there was something weird about him!

"He told us a believer was in the forest today," the fairy went on, "and he sent you to us to reward you for your faith! And such a pretty young believer too." She fluttered toward Claire's head and used a tiny hand to pet the large girl's hair. More of the small glowing creatures were appearing around the pond.

Claire beamed from Lily's words, and slowly craned her neck as much as she could to look at her parents. "Mom, dad, look! I told you they were real!"

Her mom stayed motionless in the corner of her eye, and seemed to be facing away.

"Mom?" She muttered. "Dad? Why aren't you looking?"
"Oh, don't worry," Lily assured the large girl, stroking her puffy cheek, "they're just frozen. Time has gone completely still here, including them. None of you are aging either."
Claire, feeling soothed by Lily's tiny hand, calmed herself. "Oh...but why're they frozen?"
"Because I want to see how well you can keep a secret," the fairy said, a bit more seriousness in her tone, "a lot of bad people have come close to finding us, you see. So when you choose to go home, you can't tell anyone where we are. Do you understand, Claire?"

The flabby girl was horrified by the idea of someone trying to hurt these poor little creatures. How could they do that? Plus, Lily said it was her own belief in fairies that led her here, so she had to agree.
"I promise."

Lily's warm smile returned, and she rubbed the blob of a girl's thick double-chin, making her almost purr.
"Good girl," she said, then looked around herself before whispering into Claire's ear, "and one more thing; watch out for pixies."
Claire blinked, and tilted her head slightly. "Pixies?"
"Oh yes," the fairy nodded, "they look like fairies, but with pointy ears and they don't glow as much. They won't hurt you, but they'll probably want to squish your cheeks and bounce on this belly of yours."
Claire bit her lip softly. "That doesn't sound so bad...?"
"And if they like you enough," she went on, "they'll want to keep you in their lair, forever!" She pointed to a gap in the bushes, pitch black inside. "They'll try to tempt you with candy and sweets, but you mustn't give in, okay?"

Claire gulped, and nodded. The first time she'd have to refuse food...that would be tricky.

Lily nodded, her smile coming back again, and hopped off Claire to float in front of her. "Come, take a look around!"
Out of instinct, Claire went to hoist herself off of her wheelchair, and to her surprise and delight, she had the strength to stand up! Something her muscles had denied her for years.

"O-oh my gosh!" She squeaked, "I'm standing!"
"Thanks to our magic," Lily giggled, and patted the large girl's head, "we'll be over at the lake if you want to meet the others. Have fun!"

And with that Lily zipped off to meet with the other fairies, leaving Claire to have a look around...
12113111111.title: The Power of Belief!
