1211311111111.content:
"...and then the fairies took the flower to the-" Claire's story had been interrupted by a familiar sound and feeling; her belly was grumbling with hunger!

Some of the fairies fluttered into the air, the growls sounding much louder in their little ears.
"What was that?!" One of them cried.
"It sounded like a monster!" Another squeaked. Almost all of the little creatures had broken into small mutters of panic, all except for Lily who was sat on the large girl's shoulder.

Claire giggled at the fairies' silliness and rubbed her plump hands over her plush middle.
"It's not a monster," she said, "it's just my tummy!"

The fairies began to relax, assured there was no danger.
"Wow, your tummy's really loud!" One of them giggled and patted it with her tiny hand, making it wobble.
Claire giggled and blushed. "Hehe, I guess it's lunchtime."

Lily smiled and hovered in front of Claire's larger, rounder face. "If it's food you want, we have plenty of fruits and berries in the glade. Great big ones too! Why don't you go have a look around on your own, see what you can find? And please, eat to your heart's content. There's plenty for all."

"Wow, really?" Claire grinned. She wasn't a big fan of fruits (the only ones she ever did eat were the ingredients of desserts and snacks) but these were special fairy fruits! She'd happily take some of those any day. "Thanks, Lily!"

With some help from the fairies, the heavy girl got to her feet and began waddling around the space, looking for these fruits she was told about.
She eyed up the dark gap in the bushes as she passed them, thinking she had seen something before waddling ahead.

Though she didn't get far, stopping just a few steps away after hearing a new voice from behind her. "Hello, little girl."
Claire slowly turned in place, and blinked as a new creature was before her. It was another girl, the same size as a fairy but rougher looking and not as illuminated. She had big pointy ears, a short dark red dress and black hair. She had a smirk on her face and her hands behind her back in a coy pose.

Claire recognised the features from Lily's warning. It was a pixie!

"Who are you?" The obese girl asked.
"My name is Gale," the pixie smiled, bowing your head, "and you're Claire, yes? I overheard your talk with the fairies."
Claire nodded. "They told me all about pixies..."
"Did they now?" Gale giggled, and slowly floated around Claire's head. She tried to follow, but her neck just couldn't turn enough. "I suppose they told you how we like to take greedy children and keep them to use as our playthings?"

Claire gulped and nodded, her heart beating a little faster. Gale suddenly rushed over to her face and grabbed her plump cheeks in her tiny hands, squishing them up as she rubbed them in a circular motion. It felt...soothing somehow. Claire could feel her alertness start to fade...

"We're nothing like that," Gale assured her, "we love believers just as much as the fairies do, but they want to keep them all to themselves and not let us meet them."
Claire slowly blinked, her eyes squinting from having her cheeks squished. "Really...?"
"Really," the pixie nodded, and let go of her, "but we're nothing like that. We're just as nice as those fairies!"

Claire was almost sure that Gale was lying, but...she couldn't be fully sure. Her voice sounded so honest.

"And to prove it, I have a little gift for you," Gale purred, and put her hands behind her back again. She held them back out and revealed a plump slice of cake, white and red with frosting and fruit. "Some special pixie cake! It's far better for you than those silly fruits those fairies probably had you going for."

Claire's eyes widened as she stared at the cake, and her tummy let out another loud rumble. She knew all the warnings Lily had given her about pixies, but Gale seemed very nice, and that cake looked so yummy...

The longer she stared at the dessert in the pixie's tiny hands, the more her resolve faded...
1211311111111.title: Claire VS. Temptation

choices: Go back to the other pixies
Claire thinks it's time to go home
12113111111112.content:
Claire was about to grab the cake and take bite but suddenly she thought about something. Claire loved fairy tales and many times in stories somebody was warned to don't do something. But they always did and came in trouble. Like little red riding hood. She was told to stay on the path, but she did't. And she got eaten by the wolf. Good the hunter rescued her and her grandmother but that was't thanks to red. That was just dumb luck.
She suddenly remembered a movie she once saw. Pan's labyrinth. She wanted to see it because there were fairies in the movie. However the movie was sometimes pretty scary and she had two weeks of nightmares after wards. However, in the movie a girl need to go to a room to get a dagger. Three fairies helped her. However there was a monster there with eyes in his hands, and a table filled with food. She was warned to don't take any food. But she did and the monster woke up and devoured two of her fairies. Never give in to temptations.

"No thanks. It's very nice of you but really. I rather don't take it." Claire said.

"What? Why not?" Gale asked.

Suddenly Claire felt something. Like a spiderweb around her broke. Just a few seconds ago the voice of Gale sounded so honest and everything seemed to be fine, but now suddenly it did't. Claire realized it had been a trick.

"I heard that pixie's like it to squish in cheeks and bounce of big bellies and keep people in their lair forever." Claire said.

"I told you that's not true." Gale said like explaining to a child one plus one is two.

"Perhaps. But you did like it to squish my cheeks so probably the rest is also true. I have no reason to trust you. It's better to be safe then sorry so no. I don't take that cake."

Suddenly Gale seemed a lot less friendly. Her hair seemed to wave upwards and her eyes had a scary glow.

"Just wait Claire. This is't over. Our master has his eyes on you, and he is used to get what he wants. Just wait."

With a loud bang like a gun shot Gale was gone. Claire lifted her shoulders and walked further a the saw the glade full with fruit. Also forest fruits that she used on deserts. She stuffed some them in her mouth and must admit they did't taste that bad. But the she saw some fruit she did't knew. It seemed to glow. They also seemed delicious. She took one bite and was sold. This was without a doubt the best thing she ever tasted. She wolfed the fruit down. She saw some other fruits that seemed to glow. She ate them one by one and each of them tasted fantastic. They were better than candy, cookies or junk food. Claire could't describe it other then more then fantastic.
The she saw Lily. Lily put her hand in her side and looked at her with a smile.

"Of course. I should have know you would eat some fairy fruit."

"What's fairy fruit?" Claire asked.

"Fruit that glows. Just like us. Tell me now Claire how do you feel?" Lily asked. "I mean physical."

"I feel... very good." Claire said. "Fantastic. A lot better I felt in a long time. Like some weight is of my shoulders."

"I'm not surprised. That fruit keeps us healthy. You're a big girl Claire, but I believe in the human world they don't see you like healthy do they?"

"No not really." Claire said with a weak smile.

"Well... after eating that fruit you don't have to worry about that. The fruit makes you healthy. I guess it made your organ's stronger. So you don't have to worry about hart diseases ans stuff no matter how much bigger you become." Lily said.

"You mean fatter." Claire said with a smile. "Don't worry. It's no problem. Say it. I know I'm fat. But I like being fat."

"Well if you are fat you can get diseases. That's why you have all those diets. But since you ate that fruit you will be healthy no matter how fat you become."

Claire smiled wide. She must admit that she was always a bit scared that her weight could become a problem for her health. But now it sounded like she did't have to worry about that.

"Oh by the way, I did saw a pixie." Claire said. "She said her name was Gale. She offered me a cake. But I did't take it."

With the name Gale Lily froze. She almost seemed to choke in anger.

"Gale? Her name was Gale. Black hair, red dress?"

"Yeah. That's her. Do you know her?"

"Yeah. She's my sister." Lily said sounded defeated.

"But how? I mean you're a fairy and she's a... do fairies turn into pixies?" Claire asked surprised.

"No. Not really. But fairies can turn into pixies. But it's kind of rare. But my sister is one of those fairies that became a pixie. I can't stand her. Lucky you did't eat that cake. You would have been in her power."

"She said her master got his eyes on me? Should I be worried?"

"Don't worry too much. We will protect you. But it would be better if you don't walk around here on your own."

"No problem. I can't walk without your magic." Claire said and laughed.
12113111111112.title: Healthy fruit

choices: Fairies visit while Claire eats dinner.
Nobody comes- Claire feels somewhat slighted.
121131111111122.content:
And, with that, the unpleasant pall the pixie had cast over their day was gone, blown away like pollen in the wind. The forest was, once again, a place of joy. Lily smiled and clapped her tiny hands together.

"What would you like to do now, Claire?"

Claire thought for a moment, touching one fat finger to her second chin. "Well, I know about fairies already, but what about other magical creatures? Do you have anything else?"

Lilly giggled. "Of course we do, but if I told you about all of them we'd be here forever!"

Claire's face lit up with joy, but, as she thought over that remark some more, the brightness left her somewhat. Lily took notice and flew in closer, looking into Claire's eyes with some concern. "Is everything okay?"

Claire nodded. "Yes, it's all so wonderful, but..." She paused for a moment, unsure of herself, then burst out, "...I don't want to stay here forever!"

Lily recoiled in surprise, then flew in much closer, hugging the sniffling girl's neck fat tightly. "Oh, Claire, that isn't what I meant! I just meant that there are a lot of creatures here, that's all..."

But Claire was not to be consoled. "I know that, I just...I want to stay here and learn about all these creatures, but I also like my parents, and I'm afraid..." She paused for breath, and started crying. "...I'm afraid if I leave, I'll never be able to come back!"

Lily looked up at her. "Don't be silly, Claire! We would never force you to stay away! You can come back whenever you like."

Claire smiled too, her tears lessening somewhat. "R-Really?"

Lily smiled. "Yes, of course. You can be certain of that."

"Yay!" Claire cheered, but another troubling thought crossed her mind. "But it may not be for a long time...it's very hard for me to leave the house, and..." She trailed off, unwilling to finish her sentence: soon I probably won't be able to.

"Don't worry about that, either!" Lily's voice broke through her troubled thoughts. "I'll come and visit you as often as I can! I'll bring some friends, too, so don't be afraid! Soon enough you'll have met everybody in the forest!"

Claire looked at her fairy friend, eyes wider than dinner plates. Lily laughed.

"Come along now, let's get you home, before-"

BLAM.

Claire looked up, startled. Lily swore in fairy-speak.

"I knew this would happen- Gale's sent a storm after us! Come quickly, now, we'd best get you back to your parents."

And, through a torrential rain, fairy and fatty headed back to the trail, back to the world of humanity. The rain soaked Claire's inadequate dress and seeped between her many folds. Lily flitted around her, dodging raindrops. Finally, they made it back to Claire's still frozen parents, and Claire resettled her huge body in her chair.

"Thanks for everything, Lily! I hope I'll see you soon."

"And I you, my dear. Now, I must go- this storm requires my attention."

The new friends smiled at each other one last time, then Lily flew off, vanishing into the trees. As she left, so, too, did her magic, and the forest lost its color. Gravity once again resumed its inexorable effect on the fat Claire. The ever-present heaviness of her many layers of fat once again washed over her, burying her in its great weight. Her breathing became labored, her motions sluggish and impossible. Claire wheezed sadly.

Behind her, her parents were recovering from the effects of time stoppage. Her father shook his head.

"Whew! I feel like I've just slept for ages. Lauren, what time is it?"

Claire's mother checked her watch. "It's only just turned 2, Max- but I know what you mean. I feel the same way."

Claire's belly growled. Her parents looked at her, then at the rain above them.

"My goodness, where in the world did this storm come from?" her father asked, looking into the sky. "Well, no matter- we've got to get out of this storm. Come along, Claire."

Claire smiled softly as her chair set into motion. "Daddy, I saw fairies!"

"Did you really?" her father asked, not really listening. "That's nice."

Claire's belly burbled again. "They're coming to visit me soon, they said."

"Uh-huh...here, eat this," her dad said, fishing a bag of popcorn out of a pocket on the chair and tossing it to her. "Don't you worry, we'll be eating soon. Call that Chinese place, Lauren, and get plenty. I bet she's pretty hungry."

That night...
121131111111122.title: Claire thinks it's time to go home

choices: That night, while Claire sleeps, the pixies sneak into her room...
The next day, Claire wants to visit the fairies again!
1211311111111221.content:
That evening, Claire was comfortably nestled back into the sofa, helping herself to a feast of Chinese food set out in front of her. She ate with a newfound energy, still happy from the events of today. Meeting Lily and the fairies, trying their delicious fruit, even Gale and the pixie storm was an exciting memory.

"My my," her mom chuckled, "someone's hungry."
Claire nodded, her cheeks filled up with chicken and noodles. "Mm-hmm!"

Her mind was racing, wondering when she would see Lily and the other fairies again. She really hoped it would be soon; in fact, she really wanted to go tomorrow!
She swallowed the mouthful of food, and decided to ask.

"Mom, dad?" She looked at them, "Can we go back to the forest tomorrow?"
But her parents didn't answer. In fact, they weren't even looking at her.
"...mom? Dad?" She muttered, a little confused as to why they weren't paying attention.

But then, she realised. Wait a minute...!

Through the open window, a familiar little creature fluttered into the living room, followed by at least half a dozen more. "Hello, Claire!"
"Hi Lily!" Claire grinned ear to ear, causing her eyes to nearly vanish from her cheek fat squishing against them.
"We thought since you came to our home, we could come and see where you live," she smiled, "We hope you don't mind."
"Of course not!" the obese girl squeaked, and happily watched as the fairies looked around her home.

"What's this stuff?" One asked, lifting a noodle from Claire's plate.
"Chinese food," she giggled and had another mouthful. The fairy tried it and scowled, deciding it wasn't sweet enough.
"There's loads of food in this room!" One called from the kitchen. "And a lot of it is sweet!"

"Hey, Claire," Lily smiled at her large friend, "do you have any more stories about fairies to tell us?" The others seemed to light up at the idea, and flocked around the colossal girl. Some settled on the couch, others sat on her head or her shoulders.

She giggled and nodded. "Okay! Well, there's one I thought of a while ago..." she began, and took a mouthful of her dinner before continuing.
1211311111111221.title: Dinner Guests

choices: Favoring stealth, the pixies invade Claire's dreams- can they win her over?
A full assault! The pixies attempt to carry Claire away- but is she too fat?
12113111111112211.content:
Though Claire's evening was filled with magic and wonder, the night went on much like any other. The fairies bid her farewell at roughly dusk, leaving Claire to her own devices. However, being normally immobile, Claire's own devices were very simple- a bit of TV, then faling asleep gently on the couch where she spent all her days, wheezing her way into dreamland. Really, the night was entirely normal. Save, of course, for the fact that she was being watched.

Outside, in the street, a green-suited man gazed carefully around. He was not looking to harm the girl- no, far from it. Mr. Leaf was watching for pixies. He knew of their desires for Claire, and he knew, also, how to deal with them. Mr. Leaf, as one would expect, knew many things.

He was no fairy, though some would think him so. Rather, he was a mere human, though one with close ties to the magical world. He had found the fairies at a young age, and through knowing them had survived both the Great War and many, many onslaughts from pixies of all shapes, sizes, colors, and powers. The pixies wanted whatever the fairies had- and this large, friendly girl was no exeption. So, to keep her safe, the fairies had designated him, their envoy into the human world, to be her protector. And protect her he would. He kept watch, set a few simple charms around the house, and smiled.

The other set of eyes made no such friendly gesture.

Across the street, from the topmost window of a highish building, leered a man in a well-cut black suit. He was not there to protect Claire, far from it. No, Mr. Grief was to help acquire Claire, by any means necessary. As the pixie's spy among the humans, he was the absolute antithesis of Mr. Leaf. Where the former was wizened, old, and jolly, Mr. Grief was young, cold, and calculating. He had stumbled upon the pixies some summers back and willingly enlisted himself to their employ. And he was not about to be outdone by some old green-suited fool.

As soon as Mr. Leaf turned a corner, Mr. Grief broke the protective charms- Such weak things! What a fool that Leaf is!- and the pixies, feeling the coaat clear, flew inside, Gale leading the charge. Soon, they would have Claire- and there was nothing the obese girl could do about it.

Or so they hoped.
12113111111112211.title: That night, while Claire sleeps, the pixies sne...

choices: Claire takes the cake, and wakes up to go with the pixies. What's the harm...?
Claire stands strong and says no! But do the pixies back off?
121131111111122111.content:
The pixies slipped into Claire's home through any way possible. Windows, keyholes, doorway cracks, anything they could slip inside.
But they all sneaked throughout the house to the same meeting place - Claire's bedroom.

The tiny creatures giggled and whispered to one another as they surrounded the obese girl, peacefully snoring away in dreamland.
"Look how big she is!" One snickered, giving one of Claire's round cheeks a prod.
"Oh, she'll be much fun to keep around!" Another agreed, landing on her dome-like tummy and lightly bouncing to test it, sending waves of ripples along her expanse.
"But how do we get her to come?" Asked a third, "Gale didn't help when she lost her temper and made that storm."

Mr Grief stood forward, looming over the oblivious girl, and smirked. "Don't worry your little heads, I'll deal with this. Just follow my lead."

Much like Mr Leaf had knowledge in magic, Mr Grief was granted his own magical powers by the Pixie King to do his bidding. One of those powers being the pixies' ability to enter and manipulate dreams.
Which was their plan; to enter Claire's dreams and convince her the pixies were not as bad as they seemed to be.

"Okay all of you," Mr Grief whispered, and the pixies nodded and prepared themselves, "one...two...three!"

All at once, he and the pixies turned themselves into streams of black dust, and slipped in through Claire's ears to enter her dreams...

-

Claire, meanwhile, was happily wandering through a forest deep in her dreams. Birds sang their cheerful songs above her, and the chitters and calls of woodland creatures sounded all around her.
With her dreams having no limits in terms of reality, Claire needed no wheelchair to get around, and didn't feel a single pound of weight on her enormous frame as it bounced along the path.

The smile on her round face turned into a curious frown as her plump nose twitched. She smelled something. Something...sweet!
"Hello, Claire," a young man's voice greeted from behind her, "it's nice to finally meet you."

A little surprised, Claire slowly turned herself around to find an older man, though not nearly as old as Mr Leaf, dressed in a black suit. He wore a smile on his narrow face.
"Um, hello," she muttered warily, "who are you?"
"My name is Mr Grief," he introduced himself, and chuckled, "I know, a bit of an unfortunate name, but don't let that put you off. I'm anything but sad."

Claire tilted her plump head. "How do you know my name?"
"I represent the pixies," Mr Grief said, then held up his hands, "but before you worry, I'm not a bad man. Not at all."
"But, I met one of you," Claire argued, "she was really nasty!"
"Ah, that must have been Gale," the young man shook his head, "she's always been a bit of a hothead. Trust me, we aren't all like that." As he said that, the pixies began to reveal themselves behind him, wearing mischievous smirks.

He clicked his fingers, and a slice of cake, similar to the one Gale had offered her before, appeared in his hand.
"I'd like you to come with us and get to know us properly," he said, "and see for yourself what the pixies are like, instead of what you've heard from the fairies. You'll meet our King, and be treated like a princess! Of course, we'll have you back home before your parents realise anything has happened."

Claire blinked, staring at the cake and mulling over Mr Grief's words. The cake looked just as delicious and tempting as before, and she liked the idea of being treated like a princess. She could get everything she wanted, like in the stories...

"All you have to do is eat up this cake here," Mr Grief explained, "and we'll happily let you visit our land. What do you say, Claire...?"
121131111111122111.title: Saturated Sabotage

choices: Claire thinks about everything that had happened
1211311111111221112.content:
Claire looked at the man and the pixies. The cake looked delicious but she did't trust them. What did Gale say again. That this was't over and that her leader wanted her and would get her. After that a huge storm. That was't exactly something that made her trust pixies.
Another point was that people in stories were many times told to don't do something and they always did for some stupid reason. Mostly they became in trouble because of it. She was't planning to be stupid.
But at the other hand this was a dream. Else she would't be able to get around without a wheelchair. Except with the magic of the fairies. Did pixies also were able to do that? Since fairies were able to turn into pixies they probably had still some of the magic. But could it hurt if this was a dream. The slice of cake did smelled delicious.

"Well Gale did't seemed to nice. Making a storm just because I did't want a slice of cake. Besides when I said No her hair started to move and her eyes started to glow."

"Yeah. That's Gale. She has just a bit of a short temper. But she can be pretty nice when you get to meet her. I'm sure she did't want to be mean. If you come with us you can ask her."

" No thanks. Gale said something about I would come with you anyway because of her master or something. That did't sound like I should trust you."

"Come on. You can't think that every pixie is evil just because Gale is such a hothead. Take you for example, you have a huge belly. Do all people have that?"

"Well... no."

"Some people believe in Christ. The son of God. But do other people also believe in that god?"

"Well...some of them do. But not all I guess. I once heard about Allah. Some religions had more then one god. But what does that have to..."

"You believe in fairies, but does every human believe in fairies?"

"No." Claire said. "Most people don't. But I know they do excised. I saw them."

"Just like pixies. Now what I mean is just because you are fat does't mean all people are fat. Just because some people believe in Christ does't wanna say all people believe in Christ. Because you believe fairies does't wanna say all people believe in fairies. If Gale was perhaps a bit mean, that does't wanna say all pixies are mean."

Claire did need to think about that. Not every human is the same. Why would all pixies be the same. But still... She would have to ask Lily about it. But if this was a dream what harm could it do do just take a bite of that cake, But was it save. In Pan's labyrinth that girl was also in a strange world when she met that monster that devoured two of her fairies.

"Come on. Take a bite."

Claire reached towards the cake. She looked at mr. Grief and the pixies. But then she saw something. But just for one second. Something like when a lightning bolt puts everything in a light for one second. In that one second she saw mr. Grief and the pixies look at her with a wicked smile. She rubbed her eyes. They looked the same. But then again for one second they got that wicked smile. Claire got scared. The seemed very scary with that wicked smile.

"No!!! I don't want your cake."

Mr Grief and the pixies suddenly looked very angry. Angry and scary.

"She's waking up. Time to go." M.r Grief said.

Claire woke up from her own screams. Her parents suddenly ran inside.

"Claire. Is everything okay with you?"

"I... I had a nightmare. It...it seemed so real. I was very scared."

"Oh you poor girl. Are you fine now. Or do you want to sleep with mommy and daddy tonight?"

"Yeah... I... I would like that." Claire mumbled.

Claire's father took the wheelchair.
Mr. Grief and the pixies appeared back on the roof. Gale looked at them with a big mean grin.

"And? How did it go without me? Were you able to give that girl the cake?"

"No. That's party thanks to you. How you acted because she refused to eat your cake. Or the storm you made after wards, Kind of childish if you ask me." A pixie said.

Gale shove some hair over her face so it covered one eye.

"Don't say it's my fault just because you could't do it. That girl had more Will power then I thought."

"Yeah. The fairies Will surely protect her now even better. We need to act fast. But not tonight. We need to think of a new plan." Mr. Grief said
1211311111111221112.title: A wicked smile

choices: Off to the park once again.
Unfortunately, they can't today- Claire has to stay home...
12113111111112211121.content:
Despite her interrupted sleep and her sleeping in a bed, rather than the couch, for the first time in many months, the rest of the night passed uneventfully for the enormous young girl. The pixies did not trouble her dreams again, and the comforting presence of her parents pressing into her fat sides kept all other dream-monsters at bay. Before too long, it was morning, and with a bit of energetic pushing and shoving Claire was soon returned to her normal position on the couch.

But, for the first time in her life, Claire wasn't entirely happy to be there.

Claire had always loved her life. She was never called upon to do anything but eat and sit, and despite the massive size this lifestlye granted her she considered it well worth it. She had been granted a free pass to do nearly whatever she pleased (unless that whatever included moving under her own power) and she had used it well. Never had she thought something could bring her out of it.

Now, though, something had. Something magical, unbelievable, and unquantifiable had happened to her. She had discovered fairies, and they had just as well discovered her. She could be frolicing with them off in the forest right now, if only...

...if only I wasn't so fat, she thought, ruefully eying her blanket of belly as it flopped over the front of the couch. Maybe I should lose some weight?

A moment later, she stuffed a handful of Cheez-Its in her mouth and declared that thought ridiculous.

She realized, though, as she chewed away, that she needed to go back. She needed to see the fairies again, and for that she would need help- and lots of it, for she was getting fatter by the day. Maybe I can go back again today?

Thus resolved, she called for her parents.

And, as an afterthought, for breakfast. Extra today.
12113111111112211121.title: Awake at last

choices: She meets with Lily and the fairies again!
Those pixies are persistent - they try again to lure Claire to them!
121131111111122111211.content:
To Claire's relief, her call hadn't gone unheard - her parents arrived, with quite the delicious breakfast of greasy sausages, fried eggs and chocolate cereal on a tray.
Only one thing was stopping the gluttonous girl from digging in. She needed her mouth empty so she could ask.

"Mom, dad," she began, "can we go back to the park today? Please?"

Her parents were surprised; normally Claire would never want to go back out so soon, and happily stay on her spot on the couch and watch TV. But who were they to say no to their 'little' angel?
"Of course we can," her mom smiled warmly, "we've got the day off work, so we can do whatever you like, honey."
"In fact," her dad added, "we can go after you finish your breakfa-"

Claire needed no more motivation. Her gluttony combined with the promise of leaving as soon as she was done, sent her on a little mission to make her plates and bowls spotless.

-

After about an hour and a half, Claire was back in her wheelchair, and back on the forest trail again. She hadn't noticed that she was moving just a little slower than usual, thanks to her ever-increasing weight. Her parents, of course, knew it full well.

If Claire could muster any form of energy that could move that great bulk of hers under her own will, she would be bouncing in her seat in excitement. She had begged to go back to that clearing they had gone to yesterday; the one where she had met Lily and the fairies.

Though, the thought reminded her of Gale the pixy, and that strange man who had visited her dreams last night. She knew how dangerous they could be, but Claire couldn't help but be curious. Just what did the pixies plan to do with her if they got to her...?
121131111111122111211.title: Back to the Glade

1211311111111221112111.content:
"Well Claire. Look who's here." Her mother said.

Claire saw Mr. Leaf sitting on a bench. He smiled and waved at them. Her parents raised their hands and waved back but suddenly they froze Claire tried to turn her head but was't able too.

"Mom? Dad?" She asked but got no response.

Carefully she put her feet down and was able to stand up. She waddled over to Mr. Leaf with a bouncing belly, rubbing thighs and bouncing butt. Mr Leaf smiled at her and opened his arms and hugged her.

"Claire. It's nice to see you again. But it's especially nice to see you here. With a body like you it's harder to get here. Are you here to meet your friends again?"

"You know fairies life here?"

"Of course I knew. I knew them for years. I found them at a very young age. I spend a lot of time with them and learned things from them. I told you about them. Because from the first time I saw you, I knew you were a believer. But you need to watch out for the pixies. The can talk nice and sweet like if they are good but they're not. Believe me."

Suddenly Claire saw Lily and a few seconds later all fairies appeared. Claire and Mr. Leaf got surrounded by the color full little creatures. Claire saw a few of them flying over to her wheelchair. Looking what it exactly was.

"I dreamed about pixies last night. It was so strange. It seemed almost real. I have had dreams many times but when I woke up I mostly could't remind them. But when I do remind them there are things... that does't make any sense! But this one almost seemed real. They offered me a cake and..."

"You did't eat it." Lily asked worried.

"No I did't. But does that matter? I mean... it was just a dream. Not real."

"Pixies can visit people in their dreams!" Lily said. "If you had eaten the cake in your dream it would be just as terrible if you had eaten it in the real world. Those pixies are really interested in you. I thought you would protect her."

"Well... I did some protection spells. I don't know how they were able to get past them." Mr. Leaf said.

"They were't alone. There was a man with them." Claire suddenly reminded. "Perhaps that has something to do with it."

"Yeah perhaps. Wait here for a second." Lily said and flew away but returned a few moments later with a twig with leafs. "Eat one of those leafs each night before you go to bed. They make you sleepy, cause nice dreams, and block your dreams for pixies. This way they can't invade your dreams anymore."

Suddenly a few fairies came back with a chocolate bar.

"What is this?" A tiny fairy asked.

"Oh That's chocolate. I tastes very good. Taste it." Claire said.

The fairy took a bite and got a sign of disgust on her face.

"This tastes awful."

"That's because you're eating the wrapper and silver paper. Don't eat that. That's not good for you. You only need to eat the brown stuff." Claire warned her.

She spit out what she had in her mouth and looked with a suspicious look at Claire but took a bit of the chocolate and her face cleared up.

"This is delicious. It's very sweet. You should try it."

Like a wave all fairies flew over to the chocolate bar. Started nibbling and chewing enjoying the taste. In a few minutes there was't a tiniest piece of chocolate left. It all disappeared in the bellies of the fairies. However most had a lot of chocolate left around their mouth. All were smiling in a satisfied way.

"You can always come by if you have more of that stuff." Said the tiny fairy that took the first bite. "What was it again? Shokat?"

"Chocolate." Claire corrected her. "Milk chocolate to be exact. You also have pure but that tastes a bit bitter. You also have white chocolate that tastes also really good, and you have chocolate filled with nuts. And after that they filled chocolate with hundred of different things."

"Well we don't like bitter things." Lily said but the other stuff. We would love to try that."

"Do you have any more stories?" The other fairies asked.

"Sure. This one is very exciting."

All fairies gathered around her and listened to Claire's story. But several eyes looked at them from the bushes.
1211311111111221112111.title: Chocolate

choices: Gale gets wind of the plan, and does not like it.
12113111111112211121112.content:
As Claire launched into yet another one of her mildly-fictional fairy stories, filling the glade with light and laughter, across the river, in a dark cave, a rather different scene was taking place. Mr. Grief paced angrily back and forth while pixies flitted here and there around him.

"What are we to tell the Pixie King?" he asked, half-rhetorically. "How are we to explain that a girl with so little willpower she ate herself to immobility refused us not once, but twice?"

"We could tell him it was your fault!" suggested a pixie near his nose.

"Hey, that's not a bad-" His eyes widened and he shook his head. "Wait, no! That's ridiculous!"

"It was worth a try," said the pixie before melting into the shadows.

"Come now!" Mr. Grief shouted, waving his bowler hat around. "There must be something we could do!"

"Take her by force?" suggested another pixie, this one floating on the ceiling.

"No, no," muttered Mr. Grief angrily, "she's far too fat for that. We'll have to have her come here voluntarily. But if we can't get to her, who can we-"

He stopped short, let the thought percolate, then smiled a smile of such malevolence some of the pixies shrieked and flew away.

"Lily."

As the pixies streaked away, Mr. Grief prepared to face the King alone. The success of the plan was now all but guaranteed.
12113111111112211121112.title: Switch to the pixies

choices: Time for Claire to go home
121131111111122111211121.content:
The fairies were all to occupied with Claire's story. She had told stories before but this was one of her best. A great adventure. The fairies listened with open mouths. Sometimes squeezing each other in the excitement wondering if the heroïne would survive. Even Mr. Leaf must admit this was a good story. Most stories of Claire were good but this one was especially good. He really needed to write this one down.
She was at a point that was very exciting when Claire suddenly asked: "Do perhaps have something to eat and to drink. My throat is getting a bit dry from talking."

A few of them were a bit grumpy she asked something like that at such a moment in the story. But most understand that Claire throat was dry and she had been a long time without food for a girl of her size.

"Come on." Lily said. "Squeeze that fruit and be careful the catch the juice in a cup."

Some fairies grabbed some of the fruit and cut it in pieces and other squeezed the juice out of it.

"Why did she do that at such a moment like this? I really wanna know what's gonna happen next." One fairy said.

"Well that's the best way to be sure we give her something to eat and something to drink so she can continue. Besides she deserved this for telling that story, and the chocolate.

"I guess so. But we also need to protect her from the pixies."

"So. She's a nice girl. I don't want that the pixies take her. Do you?"

"Well... no... but keep in mind I rarely saw pixies put so much effort for capturing one human girl. He must be really interested in her. Why?"

"Hm I don't know." Lily said. "Perhaps there's something special about her."

"Yeah she believes in us. Century's ago every human knew we existed but those times are over."

"Well Claire is the fattest girl I ever saw." Lily said.

Lily had seen many people in the forest. Skinny, normal, chubby fat but no one near as fat if Claire. and most fat people were teenagers or adults. But the pixies wanted fat people. Was he only be interested at Claire because of her weight. She wondered.

"Are you coming Lily. You don't wanna miss the rest of the story."

"No way!" Lily said and followed the others.

After a few sips of juice and some fruit Claire continued her story. However she took a bit and a sip every now and then. At those moment the fairies were waiting in excitement to hear what would happen. But finally Claire ended the story with a happy ending. When she was done all fairies and Mr. leaf cheered and clapped.

"That was the best story I ever heard." A fairy screamed.

"I agree!" Another said.

All fairies were praising her for the terrific story.

"Thank you all." Claire said. "But now it's going to be difficult to think of a story that's just as good or better then this one."

"Oh don't worry Claire. I'm sure you can do it." Lily said and smiled.

Claire smiled thankfully at her and ate some more of her fruit.
121131111111122111211121.title: Best story ever

choices: The pixies manage to freeze the fairies! Claire is alone with them...
1211311111111221112111212.content:
Over in the darker side of the glade, Mr Grief and Gale watched Claire and the fairies in the shadows, along with some other pixies.

"If you hadn't lost your temper," the man mumbled, "maybe she'd be in our hands right now."
"If you hadn't scared her in her dreams," Gale argued, "maybe she wouldn't be so wary of us."
"Maybe if you both were more careful, you wouldn't need to have this conversation!" A pixie hissed next to them.

Mr Grief shook his head. "Everyone be quiet...this time, I've got a good plan."
"For all our sakes, I hope so," Gale muttered, "the king won't be happy to hear we keep failing to get this girl."
"Actually, I just spoke to the king," the young man smirked, "and the fairies aren't the only ones who can freeze time."
Gale's eyes widened. "So we freeze the fairies, and have the girl all to ourselves!"
"Exactly," Mr Grief snickered, "and it works the exact same way as they do it. We all know the spell words, right?"

The pixies nodded.

"Excellent," he chuckled, and glared at Claire as she continued her story to the fairies, "that little blob of greed will be all ours."

"This fruit really tastes delicious." Claire said with full mouth.

"Yeah we make the best..."

Lily's voice suddenly stopped. Almost cut of. Like someone pulled the plug out. She did't heard a thing. She saw fairies flying, but their wings did't moved. No body moved. nothing. Like they were all frozen. Claire had seen this before. It happened to her parents. She wondered if she was frozen too but found out she could still move. What was going on?

"Did't we had an agreement with the fairies about not freezing the others or something." Gale asked.

"Right. But we found a loophole. We were't allowed to freeze them to do something against them. But that girl is a human. She is't a fairy. So we're not allowed to do anything to the fairies while they're frozen but we can do what we want to that girl." Mr Grief said. "But be careful. This spell is fragile. We need to stay calm. Especially you Gale. Too much excitement can break it like a soap bubble. understood?"

"Hello Claire remember me?" Gale said a flew over to Claire.

"You're Gale," Said Claire and gulped.

"I know. I was't very nice to you during our first meeting. And yes I unleashed a storm. I have a bit of a temper. But I'm very nice once you get to know me."

Suddenly Mr. Grief and the other pixies walked over to her. Claire looked around for help. But every fairy was frozen. Also Mr. Leaf. She looked around if the're might be anyone who could help."

"We won't harm you Claire. Honest. We're not so bad as you think. Those fairies just say mean things about us. But we're very friendly Really."

"Yeah. Come with us." A pixie said and jumped at her and bounced of her belly.

Two others could help them selves and started to pinch in Claire's bowl pink cheeks. The others looked at her.

"Help." Claire squeaked. "Please somebody. Anybody."

choices: The pixies show her around, while making sure she has a lot to eat...
She's first taken to the pixie king...
121131111111122111211121212.content:
"Oh, hush now," smirked Mr Grief, taking the pixies off Claire's body before patting her head, "you've never even gotten to know us. Once you've seen what our life is like, you can think whatever you want."

He reached behind his back and, like before, revealed a small chocolate cake, covered in frosting and sprinkles. It looked even more delicious than before, and Claire's food-addled mind was already telling her to eat it.

"All you have to do is take one bite," the man purred, "and you'll be able to come to our land."

Of course, that wasn't true - the cake was indeed enchanted, but with a spell designed to ensnare her senses and make her want more, and more, and more! And ever since they first laid eyes on her, the pixies had created delicious food enchanted to not only make her want more, but to also make her lazier and more carefree the more she ate them. She would be the pixies' plaything forever, and she'd be too lazy and relaxed to even think once about it!

But Claire had no idea of this - all she saw was a yummy cake, and after already being tempted before, she had always wondered what that cake tasted like. And if the pixies were truly as bad as the fairies said.

Only one way to find out.

She took the cake in a flabby hand, and took an experimental nibble. Her eyes shot wide open as delicious sweet chocolate exploded on her taste buds, and she crammed the rest into her mouth.

Gale and Mr Grief could only smirk, as Claire stared up at them with drooped eyelids and a very wide smile, almost looking drunk.

The man led the pixies toward the darker side of the glade. "Now then, follow us..."

Claire giggled and obediently waddled along after them.
121131111111122111211121212.title: The pixies take her

choices: Switch to Claire and the pixies
1211311111111221112111212121.content:
They went in a great hole Mr. Grief need to bend to get in. They went through a long tunnel. The walls were made of dirt. She saw every now and then roots hanging from the ceiling. Claire must say this did not look like a nice place to spend the rest of her life. No matter how good the food was. But the she saw some small doors. But they were way too small for her. They were big enough for the pixies but way too small for a human. They took Claire to a normal sized (for a human) door.
Behind that was a nice room. The wands, floor and Ceiling were made from wood. There were a few crystals that each gave just as much light if a light bulb The was a strange couch. It was kind of square. only two sides had a back. A very soft one so you could easily lean back. There was a nice fire place were a nice fire was burning. Also a small table and a kitchen full with pixies who were busy preparing food.

"You can sit here,." Mr. grief said, and pointed to the square couch.

Claire went sitting in the corner of the couch with her legs spread so her belly could rest between them. The small table was suddenly put next to her with two plates full of food. Claire licked her lips.

"Go ahead girl. Eat. Don't worry about others, or your manners, or why. Just eat!" Mr. Grief said.

Claire was already busy stuffing her face before he was done talking.
She did't even mind the pixies who were bouncing of her belly and were squeezing her cheeks.

Outside the spell that kept the fairies frozen suddenly stopped.

"Huh. Were did Claire go?" Lily asked. "She just disappeared. Humans can't do that. Or can they?"

"Not that I know." Mr. Leaf said.

"Hee I found something.' A small dark haired fairy boy said. "Footprints!"

Everybody went over too him. There were a few clear footprints. Some were defiantly from Claire. Obvious because of her small feet and the prints were very deep. Bit those other were from Mr. Grief and a few were from... pixies. The followed the footprints till the opening of the hole.

"Oh no! The pixies took Claire!" Lily said

"But how. When? Did they perhaps froze the time?" A brunette fairy asked.

"They can't do that to us. It's a law that pixies and fairies are not allowed to freeze the other to harm or hurt them in any way." A fairy with short blond hair said.

"True... but there's a loophole in the law." Mr. Leaf said. "Claire is't a fairy."

"But what do we do now?" Lily asked. "We got to save her."

"She has probably eaten from their food and is under their spell. So she would't even want to leave." A sad fairy said.

"But every spell is able to break, right. We'll find a way. I swear it."

"I will look through some books at home!" Mr. Leaf said.

"But what do we do with her parents in the meantime. We can't keep them frozen for... how long it takes to get Claire away?"

"Put them in a enchanted sleep and put them in a cave." Lily said. "That will work out fine. Now how do we get Claire back?"

Meanwhile, in the pixies' lair, Claire was undoubtedly enjoying herself. The pixies continued to provide food for her, and she continued to eat without a care. Though it was all thanks to the pixies' curse. Their food was enchanted so she'd just be concerned about eating and relaxing.

Not that she was aware of any of this, of course. On the outside, she seemed to act just like she always did.

"Make yourself at home," Mr Grief chuckled, "you're our guest, after all."

And that was what Claire did. She slouched back in the chair, her dome-like tummy sticking up in the air, and continued to stuff handfuls of food into her mouth. Crumbs and stains got over her fingers, mouth and shirt, but she didn't seem to care. Even when pixies came to play on her tummy or squish and poke at her cheeks, she just ate and ate!

She had no idea why, but she felt oddly comfortable around these pixies. Maybe they weren't so bad after all...?

"We need to get her back. We owe it to her. We allowed her to see us. By that way she'was able to see pixies too." Lily said.

"I know!" Another elf with mustard brown hair with wild spikes and glasses said. "But first we need a way to break that spell or else she don't even want to come with us. We can't move her. She's too fat for that."

"How do we do that? How do we break the spell?"

"What do you think I'm doing? I'm looking through old scrolls seeing if I can find something!"

"Well we need to do something fast." A young fairy with white hair in tails said. "They probably fatten her even more. That;s dangerous for people. If people are too fat they can die from a stroke or heart attack or some other diseases that come with being morbidly obese."

"Well we don't have to worry about that." Lilly said. "The pixies will feed her with food that will be enchanted that she just wants to eat and relax and never leave... but it will also be enchanted so that Claire is save from getting a stroke or heart disease or anything. The pixies want her fat. Not dead. She is't for any use of them if she's dead. No they make sure that Claire will be well fed. But they will also use magic that keeps her healthy."

"Will that magic go away if we break the spell and take her back?" The young fairy with white hair asked.

"I don't think so." The fairy with glasses said. "I don't see why it would go away. Why do you ask?"

"Well... since she was so overweight I was afraid she would die at a young age. But if the food of the pixies will keep her healthy, that a good thing about this."

"I admit that's true. It might really save Claire's life."

"She won't have a life if we don't get her away from those pixies!" Lilly screamed.

"No she won't. We barely talked to each other since she became a pixie." Lilly said almost spitting the words out. "And we hate each other!"

"I hope Mr. Leaf will find a way to break that spell." The white haired fairy said.

"There must be a way. There always is. Every spell can be broken. I promise you I will break that spell and take Claire back!" Lilly said.

A fairy sneaks in to spy on the pixie lair...

Meanwhile, in the pixies' lair, Claire was making herself right at home. Her eyes were lazily half-opened and a carefree grin squished up her chubby cheeks, which were stained with crumbs and sauce with her eating like a pig.
The pixies who weren't bring her food used her large tummy as a place to play and sleep on, or gave her pink dome-like cheeks some squishes and prods. And she didn't seem to care. Or even notice. She just laid back on the couch, smacking her lips and sprawling. Enjoying her time.

The enchantment placed in the pixies' food was working wonderfully. All Claire felt like doing was eating, relaxing, then eating some more. Any other cares, worries or responsibilities she might have had were pushed right to the back of her mind. They didn't matter right now, because they weren't important.

These nice pixies and their absolutely delicious food and wonderful hospitality? That was what she deemed important.

A giggle escaped her as she carelessly crammed some more cake into her waiting mouth. "This is the life..."

These pixies really did seem nicer than she thought...of course, she was totally oblivious to the menacing smirks and giggles she was getting from them.

She's a sweet girl and all, but very, very fat. Else I don't think the pixies would have put so much interest in them."

"Well I admit that's true. But I don't care about that. I wish I could do something. Knowing what's going on in there... That's it... Shadow!"

Shadow was the name of a thin, pale and very limber fairy. With long black shiny hair and black clothes. She had a talent to be almost invisible in the shadows. She could move without making a sound and was hard to notice in the dark.

"Shadow! She can go in to spy on them! At least that something we can do. It's better then doing nothing! Where is she?"

"Hard to tell. Let's go look."

It took some time but finally the found shadow in little cave between the roots of the tree.

"Shadow is that you? Listen I want your help."

"I know. You only come to me when you need something from me. But fine tell me."

Lilly and a few other fairies looked from a distance how Shadow entered the pixie lair.
12113111111112211121112121212222.title: The spy

choices: The corrupted Claire enjoys her new carefree lifestyle...
121131111111122111211121212122221.content:
Shadow slipped into the pixie lair with expert stealth, absolutely no one aware of her breaking in. She kept to the shadows, hence her name, and looked around for Claire.

How could you not find someone that size, she thought wryly.

Her ears pricked up as she heard the distant sounds of chewing and giggling...very similar to Claire's, in fact. She followed the sounds, keeping silent and out of sight.
It didn't take long to find Claire...and Shadow was almost in awe at what she found.

Claire was indeed there, but she didn't exactly look imprisoned, or even uncomfortable. In fact, her eyes were drooped half-open and she had a lazy grin on her face. She was slouched back on a square couch, one tree trunk-like leg resting lazily on the seat while the other dangled off the edge. One meaty arm was draped over the armrest, the other across the back of the couch. Her shirt was covered in stains from her snacks provided by the pixies, some of which were still relaxing on her soft flabby frame or playing with her copious amounts of wobbly blubber.
And what was strange to Shadow was, Claire didn't seem to realise they were doing it. Or if she did, she didn't care one bit.

Shadow took note of everything she could before rushing back to the fairies with her report.

Kids and adults believed in them and saw them. Took pictures of them and wrote stories about them. Some other fairy like creatures did some jobs for humans if you gave them food.
