And make bank it did, as nearly everything she produced made these days. She was becoming a superstar among feedist communities and especially the more morbid corners of them. She had anonymous patrons helping to pay off any medical bills, pay for more food - towards the end of october, an anonymous patron even paid for a remodel of her apartment for wider doors. This was especially a help as the year ground on - as Claire learned literally nothing from the hypertensive episode, winding her way up to 688 by her next weigh-in. Her size was becoming absolutely stunning - the largest object in nearly any room. Denise got no smaller either, and if anything her own feeding began to plump her up by proxy. Her second chin, previously just barely peeking over her chin, began to droop lower as her arms and belly took more of the gains. She began weighing herself - and she was surprised to see 262, the last she had seen, she was 233. On one hand, she was aroused by this exact kind of thing - but then, she looked at Claire. Claire's literal whole-hog embracement of the morbidity of fat fetishism had left little of her independence.

The woman now had oxygen hooked up to her, barely able to breathe through the ever-increasing weight on her frame, and everything had to be industrial-strengthened to sustain her crippling weight. She required daily washing by Denise, something that helped stem further growth on the other fat woman's part. During one such bath, she spoke up, "Thank you, Denise - thank you for all of this." She took a gasp after the sentence, as her oxygen tank had to be off for washing. "Oh, no problem. I love helping cuties like you get bigger." Claire sighed and spoke, "Uh, I don't know how much bigger i'll be getting - not that you're not feeding me enough, but I think it's just time." Denise was shocked, "Time for what?" Claire panted and spoke, "I don't know how much longer I can just take the pain. Joint pain every day, my back is killing me just for being alive, my health is in the toilet, and every other second my heart's threatening to quit. I might sign a DNR." Denise was saddened. It was like being with a blue whale - a creature of massive size and such rarity, but its mortality saddened her - she still could not quite grasp Claire's sexual attraction to such morbid measures. A Do Not Resuscitate was a concrete order - the next time anything goes wrong, that would be Claire's time. Denise spoke up, "Claire, no, you've got so much bigger to go." Claire shook her head, and spoke. "I don't know about that." She took another gasp, "It's just getting to be so much, to be alive and be this fat, and this unhealthy. I'm still sound of mind, so I could sign it myself - I've just got the one favor to ask of you." Denise sighed and asked, "What is it?" Claire spoke with solemn finality, "Keep the camera on me. I've got it in my will that any future income from my clips goes to you, and it's probably really fucked up, but the dudes that are into morbid stuff will buy the shit out of that clip, me finally dying from my obesity."

Denise pondered, then spoke. Whether Claire's eventual passing scared her out of obesity or further into it, the extra money wouldn't hurt. "Of course." After the bath, the two performed a surreal task- fitting Claire for her coffin. With all measurements taken, she perused a few choices. "Ooh, I like the marbled look on that one - it's unique, and it's got that brass trim to it." Denise nodded, "Yeah - that looks great. You'll look beautiful in it." Eventually the time came - the doctor sadly sat across from Claire in her apartment as he watched the great hulking mass of fat sign the document guaranteeing her own death.

It was now a question of when Claire would die, and whether Denise would follow her footsteps, or whether Denise would end the cycle and prevent her own death, which Claire could not do.
125331121111111.title: The Inertia of obesity.

choices: Denise and Hannah get to know each other - and put on the pounds in the meantime
Hannah REALLY dives into emotional eating - her weight balloons.
1253311211111111.content:
It was, of course, only a matter of time until the butterball that was Claire Spittz died.

She had eaten away the prime of her youth, and eaten herself into a state of horrid health that usually only comes from years of gradual abuse of one's health. Denise sat and admired the glorious fatness of her partner as she ate through a buffet tray of fried chicken. She rubbed at her chest like normal, and continued eating for the camera.

A pause. A tenseness of her face, she rubbed her chest again, the rub turned to a clutch. She moaned in pain, her eyes shutting tightly, her teeth clenched in anguish. "Ouhhnnngh.... God~..." She tried to draw breath to ease the obvious pain, but the sharp hissing breaths did nothing to follow up on it.

"Oh.. This is it... Denise, this is it.. I ate myself to death," said Claire, hoarsely. Denise rubbed her massive, meaty shank of a shoulder as the ocean of fat that was Claire Spittz leaned back into the couch, clasping at her heart with both hands now, the arms laden with fat to the point that they looked like two pillows that now clutched at her chest. Her head swam in an invisible body of water, as if she tried to keep herself afloat in such, rubbing back against the couch as her chest rose and fell, rose and fell. "Fuck...Fuck... Fuck.."

In one of the most characteristic ways of coping with imminent death, Claire Spittz defiantly bit into a chicken breast. Suddenly her eyes went as wide as beach balls, and she fell forward, off the couch, and onto the floor.

Denise came about to her - her last few breaths came about - and then the huge, obese form of Claire Spittz was no longer inhabited.

The ambulance came - as usual, they had to use the widened door to get Claire out, even on her double-wide gurney. This time, the paramedics looked somberly at the body of the massive, obese woman. "Damn it, she's so young, too," said a paramedic of near-eastern origin. A fairly hefty co-worker nodded and spoke up, "Yeah... Damn shame. Sorry for your loss."

Denise was saddened - but also deeply aroused by this occurrance - an arousal that continued on to Claire's funeral. The fact that this living hog was able to eat herself to death before thirty was satisfying to her morbid desires - that she needed help with every little thing. Denise was more than happy to provide this help - as well as help finishing anything Claire had passed out while eating, and could not finish herself - a more common occurrance towards the end of the fat woman's life.

Claire barely fit in her coffin. The weight she had gained in the last month of her life meant that the morticians literally had to cram her into her coffin, and she filled every inch of the nearly piano-case sized thing. A forklift beeped along, sticking its forks under the casket. Hannah and Denise were some of the only two in attendance - no one else was willing to come. Her family had long since abandoned her due to her rampant gluttony, and these two were the only friends Claire had left. Hannah was sobbing deeply, leaning into Denise, whose heft now easily surapassed 300 pounds in her black dress, packed to bursting - just like Claire's coffin.

The beautiful, massive item was lowered into the pit dug for it, and then the forklift backed away. The headstone read - "Claire Spittz - 1990-2019 - A happy woman who lived life on her terms."

The arousal was mixed with the sadness of the passing of such a kind woman - the death of one so young - but to a cause so sexual for Denise, so deeply arousing that she had to hold herself back from masturbation by the graveside. How every inch of Claire's rolling fat had to be nearly vaccuum-packed into her huge coffin, the size of the thing and the weight of that contained which left her without the honor of pallbearers - the sheer sexual energy of this moment was real for Denise.

For Hannah, however, this moment was an utmost tragedy. She had done everything in her power to help Claire live - to help her survive her own desire to eat to self-destruction. But her works were for nothing.

Most fittingly, the funeral concluded at a buffet. Both Denise and Hannah ate like hogs - plate after plate of chinese food which packed their plates to bursting. "This feels wrong," said Hannah, finishing her fifteenth crab rangoon. "Why," asked Denise through a mouth of eggroll which she promptly swallowed, "It's what she would have wanted. Plus, I'm starving." Hannah refused to question it further. She meekly accepted it - food did, after all, find a way of making her feel better.

The inheritance money was a godsend to the two women. Hannah was already doing fairly well for herself thanks to her work ethic, but the money gave the two the ability to outright purchase a townhouse in the center of town. They rented the upper floors out, and lived in the bottom two floors. The facade of the building was a classic Victorian thing, and its spiral-capped towers that formed its fourth story were perfect for studying, reading, looking around.

But with both women being driven towards eating more, Hannah trying to "save" Denise was out of the question. The only question was if they could avoid Claire's fate.
1253311211111111.title: Funeral of a fat woman. *Warning - Very Morbid*

choices: Denise leans full on into feeding Hannah while trying to lose some weight.
The two gain equally - Denise really eats into it.
12533112111111111.content:
"So, where do you work?" asked Denise. "Uh, hardware store," replied Hannah. "It's kind of small, it's the one next to the propane place."

The two talked over dinner at Gentrelle's bistro. It was a favored pastime of theirs - going to the little French restaurants and coming back, wine-drunk. It helped them get over the untimely yet all-too-expected death of the super-obese Claire. "Oh, yeah, that one next to the little pizza place. They have a beautiful meat lovers' there." Hannah's mind still tried to tell her, "Slow down." But the eating helped take her mind off of Claire, off of the death of her friend. She accepted it as a mechanism. I'm still thin, she told herself.

Of course, in the months since Claire's death, that was becoming less and less true. Just as Denise continued glutting herself as a social and sexual maneuver, Hannah continued glutting herself as a coping mechanism and a way to know Denise better. Hannah's weight had increased from an average build to a blubbery one - her breasts enlarged as did her thighs, and her middle, always slightly puffy, began to expand more permanently.

"How about you? What's your job?" Denise sheepishly spoke, "Uh, daytime, I work at the Big B station on 17. But between you and me, I sell smut videos online to make the rent." Hannah had to lecture herself internally, and spoke the words she knew she should say rather than what she thought, "Hey, good on you for making some extra money."

Denise's figure had been ballooning beside Hannah's. She didn't quite eat as much as she did when Claire was still alive, finishing whole levels of buffet trays by herself, but she still ate enough to pile on pounds. She was going from the low 300's to above 330 these days as she ate out - and in - with Hannah. Her second chin began to grow into a neckload of fat that dangled increasingly out. She wasn't blind to her own gain, but she was increasingly aware of Hannah's. And it aroused her fairly well. She carried it well, for now, but what would she look like beyond 150? What would she look like beyond 200?

Denise, however, became a bit more scared as the days went by and her weight soared. Beyond the usual breathlessness that life over 250 pounds brings, she began to feel her heart palpitate at any minor exertion. She could barely move without being scared she was going to have a heart attack. She was sexually attracted to the morbidity of others, but when reminded that her own fat put her at risk, she began to falter. At the same time, it was still so sexy to her! She was such a butterball that her 2X shirts that had fit her fine a while before Claire's funeral were now unforgivably tight. Her 3X's were an immensely sexual reminder of her size, and she took just as much pleasure in hearing Hannah's offhand complaints about her size.

"Ugh, damnit, these pants fit me last week. Did you wash these on cold?" No, babe, these didn't shrink in the laundry, she thought to herself, you're just a greedy little piggy. "Uh, no, I think I put them on hot." Of course, Hannah remained wonderfully unaware of her gains.
12533112111111111.title: Mourning through Munching.

choices: Claire keeps walking, but she continues sabotaging herself with food.
Claire struggles, but manages to cut down on her food intake.
12533112111112.content:
For a twenty-year-old, having death laid out in front of you is a drastic experience.

A twenty-year-old should not be in fear of her life in a normal environment. In a normal environment, it ought to be a time to lay foundations, to lay down roots - to get going with your life. It ought not be a time to guard it.

For Claire Spittz, at that moment, it was like staring into an abyss. As she breathlessly waddled out of the doctor's office, the little insidous voice of her darkest desires faded away as her eyes watered. All she could do was look at her vast body.

Each inch of fat was no longer cute padding or an indifferent companion. Tears began to roll down her fat-laden face as she was helped into her wheelchair, Hannah wheeling her out. She was helped into the truck bed, but all she could do was stare at her vast body. A normal woman's body was somewhere below the ocean of fat that seemed to stretch out in every direction, from every part of her body. She felt her heart thudding against her chest from the non-exertion that was getting into a truck bed. Not even thirty, and she was staring death in the face, all because of her obesity.

"I'm fuckin' dying, Steph," she moaned as she plopped on the couch, "I'm fuckin' twenty-five and I'm fuckin' dying..." Hannah cuddled the seemingly endless rolls of fat. "Girl.. Girl... Shhh. You got this. We can fix it." Claire wept into Hannah's thinner shoulder, "How, fuckin' how? I'm huge, I'm a whale, I'm a blob of fat, I can't even step on a fucking treadmill or I'll fucking break it!" Hannah let her weep, "I got you, I got you... We'll just follow the doctor's meal plan, and I swear, you'll fix it in no time..."

For Claire, the crying was theraputic - and even more healing was the reassurance by Hannah. She had recieved excoriating criticism for her soaring weight throughout her life - but never the kind of hope and confidence that Hannah was providing her. She was feeling genuinely inspired, and she spoke through a sniffle, "Y-You really think I can l-l-lose this weight?" Hannah nodded and spoke with fierce confidence, "Hell yes! You can do anything if you put your mind to it - and I'll be right there with you!" Claire hugged Hannah tightly - she felt like she was being smothered by the mass that was Claire Spittz, but after what she had just been told by her doctor, she didn't want to say anything.

She kept holding on - mortal fear began to set in, and she spoke hoarsely, "Claire.. Uh... Can't breathe.." Claire let off and chuckled, "Well, guess that's another reason to lose weight."

The question of how to exercise was a daunting one for a woman as huge as Claire. A lot of aerobic exercise was dangerous for a woman who was a house away from heart disease, who already lived with high blood pressure - but somewhere had to be a starting point. Claire checked her purse for her insulin pen - it was odd for her, carrying this around. Hannah called from the foyer, "You ready Claire?" Claire turned about, "Yep, got my Insulin and my pocketbook." They pulled towards the great glass edifice of the local mall - with all its signs and corporate logos, cohorts of teenagers milling around the parking lot, who all seemed to gawk at the ball of lard rumbling across the parking lot on her two legs. The short jaunt from the truck had already begun to tax Claire's lungs, Hannah kept her by the arm - "Come on, girl, you can do it. You can do it. Keep walkin'."

It felt like an eternity. Her fat legs could only stride so far, her heart was pounding towards her ribs, and it was getting painful. Her lungs burnt with the exertion. But it was so close. She had to keep going. Oh, god, her heart was pounding so hard - the last time it pounded this hard was the last time she tried to run - an exertion which literally caused her to collapse. But she was almost there. Come on, she could almost see it!

The air conditioning cooled her sweat-laden forehead, giving her a rush of comfort, a rush of delight. She had done it. She had walked out of the parking lot. But sweet jesus, her lungs still burned, and her heart was still pounding like a jackhammer - she was staying alert for the tell-tale signs - no pain in her left arm. "Han, please, I gotta stop.." Hannah turned and nodded, taking her to a nearby bench. The pair sat down - Claire took deep, gasping breaths. Slowly her lungs seemed to burn less - her heart slowed to a somewhat normal pace. She could suddenly hear something over the din of the crowd, said at a tone where it was seemingly assumed that she couldn't hear them - "Damn, did she walk through the parking lot? She's that tired just from that?" She lowered her head in shame as she heard the reply, "Yeah - that ain't healthy, she's gotta watch out or she's gonna keel over and die." Hannah could tell and she shot daggerlike gazes over Claire's shoulder at a man and a woman - a somewhat chubby man and a trim, lean woman. "Don't listen to them, girl - let's go get some workout gear."

There were so many choices. Tight, constricting clothes that fit her with drum tightness. There were stylish ones that Hannah was looking at - they flattered her as she stepped out in a flattering pair of black leggings that accentuated her large ass and her round, shapely thighs and a green, skintight tank with a pink sports bra underneath that peeked out at her shoulders slightly. Claire hyped her up, "Dayuum, girl, you are a fucking snack!" Hannah chuckled and spoke up - "You'll look like one too here once we find something for you."

Then they looked for something for Claire. But all the stylish options were gone in Claire's size. 3X, 4X - nothing higher than a 4X. Claire was feeling both worn-down and beat-down, mentally and physically from the exertion of walking around the store for minutes on end and finding nothing. She picked out a 4X - pair of leggings and a full shirt - maybe she could wear it when she had gotten smaller? She waddled awkwardly into the dressing room and pulled off her vast, tent-like 5XL shirt and her pants. Here she was, in full blubbery obesity. Her form disgusted her now - its irregular bumps, her rolls, her seemingly endless fat that took up the entire mirror - some of her love handles were missing from the picture.

It was a mixed thing in the back of her mind though - part of her old residual sexual attachment stuck to the idea that she was still sexy in this form - but another, planted by Hannah, imagining the fat stripped away - imagining a future self, free of high blood pressure, liberated from the fat that was robbing her of her mobility. She felt some determination as she pulled on the drum-tight shirt. She pulled and tugged, and barely got the leggings up her ass, but there was no way they were going to go over her giant gut. It seemed to also repel the shirt at first - turning it into a glorified crop top, her huge gut sticking out. Claire pulled it down, but it looked even worse - every roll was on display, every inch of her globular torso was still visible through the form-fitting cloth that felt choking at the breasts.

She waddled out and Hannah spoke up, smiling broadly, "Dammmn, girl, that's a whole look!" Claire felt a rush of happiness and slapped her own ass - a resounding, meaty SMACK sounded through the store - eyes turned to Claire. The pair changed back into their normal clothes in a rush - as rushed as Claire Spittz could be - and bought them. The pricetag was in the hundreds - but it wasn't even necessarily a pair of clothes - it was a promise to herself, a promise that she could rescue herself.

Then there came the bane of this promise -the growl of her belly. "Can we grab some food," asked the fat woman. "Sure thing," said Hannah, "I was feeling peckish myself." The two split up to their various establishment. Claire stood in thought. She thought about following Hannah to the health food restaurant - but that wouldn't be enough food! She still needed some food, her appetite wouldn't go away! She waddled over to the pizza restaurant. How much did she want? A slice? Two slices?

The man came up and asked her, "Yeah, hun, what can I get?" Without thinking, Claire said, "Yeah, can I get a pepperoni pizza?" The man nodded and grabbed a ready-to-bake pizza, seemingly prepared for this. She didn't think about this until she carried it back and Hannah looked at her, puzzled. "Uh - girl, is that on your diet?" Claire sighed and sat down. "Well, I've already got it." Hannah sighed and spoke, "Girl, you gotta watch out. You can't just get a whole pizza anymore." Claire ate into her Pizza, her eyes cast sadly into the greasy food. She felt the food entering her - almost felt it go to her arteries. She recognized and spoke up, "Damn it, why can't I eat normally?" Hannah rubbed her back and spoke up, "You'll be fine - just get back on the wagon next time."

The pizza incident proved to be a harbinger of difficulties to come. While Hannah stressed that she could come back from a binge like this, she still felt like a failure after the affair.
12533112111112.title: Reason prevails - but damn, is it struggling!

choices: Circumstances start going against Claire - the weight starts coming back on.
It's smooth sailing - the weight starts falling off at record pace!
125331121111121.content:
For all the sweatiness it induced in her, her exercise regimen had brought Claire out of the apartment more.

She had begun to see the world again - and she had to admit, some days she had missed it. The beauty of the trees in bloom in late spring, the birds chirping, the pleasant warmth without being an oppressive heat that summer brought. It was worth her walks around the neighborhood. She had started small - first, down the road and back - that was an endeavor equal to the Mall. But she kept doing it, and her aerobic capacity increased. She felt like she could survive a brief walk from a middle-row park, an affair that would have nearly killed her before.

However, her walks gave her access to Billy Dee's Gas Station. She had stopped at Billy Dee's before for food, and it was, in fact, a favorite haunt of hers. The best part was the in-house kitchen, where the most unhealthy treats possible were fried up - especially her favored Chicken Strips with a large order of Loaded French Fries - replete with sour cream, cheese and bacon. It was always her favorite part of going on a walk - and a part that, strictly speaking, she wasn't supposed to do, seeing as her walks came an hour after lunch.

Hannah had set it up to where she cooked a good mix of food she was comfortable with eating and foods that were good for her - macaroni and cheese plus a grilled pork-chop, a salad with some light dressing and some pan-fried chicken. She was, in theory, supposed to be at a deficit of 1,000 calories a day, accounting for her exercise. Hannah even accounted for some of Claire's favorite snacks in the diet - her salty gaming fuel. What she didn't count on was Claire abusing her ability to walk to set back her dieting progress. Her added mobility, thankfully, was keeping her at a stalemate in her weight.

But it still frustrated her. She would try to stop herself from stopping at Billy Dee's - and one day she had decided to walk the other way, towards Genemont street. Her joints ached, and her belly grumbled. Son of a bitch, she thought, can I just ignore you for one damn afternoon? She paced up, past the house with no fence - the corner was coming up. She was starting to feel beat by the struggle that was walking at above 500 pounds, even with some added lung capacity - but she had begun to crest the corner.

The insidious smell of pizza drifted into her nose - from just to her right. She trodded on - her mind trying to get her to stop, but she just couldn't. She found herself wandering, sweaty and exhausted, into the wooden interior of Maggiano's. A bald italian man waved at her from behind the kitchen counter, "Hello! Sit anywhere, be with you." Damn it!

She ordered a meat lover's stromboli and an order of garlic knots. The Italian man chuckled heartily, "Good, good! We love to make sure you' not hungry when you leave, have that out for you." Claire internally griped with herself - Seriously? There just so happens to be more food this way? What the fuck?
The stromboli came - it was a huge thing, and the garlic knots were deliciously covered in parmesan. Each bite was juicy, meaty goodness - cheese flowing in her mouth, the marinara dip heaven...

She had finished the stuff, took her insulin shot, paid for it and was on her way back out. She'd find her way back in to the point where Maggiano would have her order ready for her by the time she got there - sometimes he threw in some extras. And this increased calorie payload tipped the scales a bit further against Claire.

"Claire, you've gained three pounds." Claire sighed and slouched her shoulders. She had begun to lose her ardor in the fight against her obesity. " Babe, please be honest with me. Where do you go on your walks?" Claire shook her head, "I don't know, I just go around the block a bit and then I come back." Hannah sighed. She was doing everything she could to help Claire lose weight and save her life. She couldn't afford to use the kid-gloves - it was time for some brutal honesty, "Babe, I calculate your calories and everything. You should be at a 1000 calorie deficit, even with your snacks. 1000 calories don't just come out of nowhere. You're killing yourself, girl - you can't keep doing this shit."

Claire broke out in a sob and moaned out in self-directed agony, "I knowww~! I just can't fucking ignore it! My stomach keeps growling, every time I'm on one of those walks! I can't just stay away, and it's everywhere! Everywhere I go, there's j'st s'ch....gh...." She paused, taking gasping breaths through her tears. Hannah comforted her. "Look, girl, I know, it's hard. But it's your life we're talking about. I care about you, and it's not like it's far away, if you just give up..." She placed a hand on Claire's eternally-racing heart, "If you give up, your fat's going to kill you. You can't stop - it's going to be hard, but you can push through it."

Claire knew Hannah was right. And she began doing just that - at first she tried to ignore her stomach, then she just kept her mouth occupied - gum, mints - anything that kept her from stopping and eating at Maggiano's and Billy Dee's.

If nothing got in the way, she was on the right track.
125331121111121.title: One step forward, two steps back.

choices: Four more months pass, and Claire's ankle is healed. How fat has she gotten?
1253311211111211.content:
It had been a week since she had been able to stop eating at Maggiano's and Billy Dee's.

The weight had been falling off at record speed - some 23 pounds in a week. Granted, most of that was water weight, but it felt great to Claire! She was on her way back to taking back her life. In this stage, she was becoming that much more happy that Hannah was not forcing her onto some ultra-strict diet where her old favorites were off limits. She still had pizza, mac and cheese, cookies, and chips - but they factored into her calorie count, she was simply on a budget of calories. She was thankful that these foods were not off-limits - behind some metaphorical set of bars. It made her feel human.

In fact, some nights, she felt more adventurous than ever - asking specifically for some peas instead of mac and cheese, a salad with more vegetables in it - she was probing her boundaries, exploring new foods. She was increasingly happy and satisfied with life. In addition, she grew more adventurous with her exercise - helped along by her increasing aerobic capabilities. That Tuesday, she determined to round the whole block, some two miles of walking.

Her stride was improved as the fat had come off and her lungs improved - carrying her further with each step. She had her earbuds in - listening through the thin cord to the fast-paced music that set her on her rapid stride, proud step after proud step. Onward, past the corner and past Maggiano's, into more alien territory. There were somewhat unfamiliar houses - unfamiliar stretches of sidewalk she had not walked before.

Though she had improved her capabilities, she was still getting tired - sweaty, distracted by her music, and not paying attention to the concrete, she missed a sudden, uneven break in the concrete that she had not yet trod - a one inch tall crack one could not simply push their foot past - but Claire still could not see her feet, let alone look ahead of her in such a manner.

So when she tried to take the next step, her left foot tried to press rapidly against the crack she could not see past the vastness of fat that had not yet burned in her determination. However, instead of standing pressing her foot against the crack, her torso was already leading into the expected next step - she felt herself falling. She had tried to steady herself against it, but her 500 pounds of heft had too much momentum. She fell for what felt like ages, screaming in terror at the unexpected tumble. She fell to the right - thankfully towards the grass - but the stiffness of her right leg in trying to steady her sideways fall played against it.

The next thing Claire knew, she was on the ground, on the grass, and there was an intense, constant, horrible pain in her right ankle. She heard herself screaming in pain before she could even consciously make the sound. She grasped at the ankle and cradled it - she saw there was some blood and a break in the skin - something white was sticking out of her ankle, and she couldn't feel her hands on her own ankle. Neighbors came pouring out, and in no time, an ambulance had arrived - a whole team of paramedics rushed out of the ambulance. She could almost hear one say - "Help me pick her up, there's no way I can do that alone." One, Two, Three - the four hefted her onto a gurney.

The ambulance ride wasn't the worst part - the constant worrying, feeling her heart race worryingly at the pain and anxiety of the fracture. The EKG was beeping off the charts. "Watch that HR - keep the defib ready, she might go into arrest," spoke the red-haired paramedic man tending her broken ankle. Surely enough, she felt a tingle in her right arm - She spoke up, "Oh, god... Ahh.. " Her heart pounded hard against her chest, feeling more and more restricted. "That's it, that's it, correct it," spoke the man. Before his sentence was finished, the paddles were over Claire's chest - hovered over - "Clear," a hard and electrifying zap. "Corrected." She felt her heart calm after the intense pain of the defibrillator. A genuine heart attack had just happened to her - granted, as part of a bone fracture - but it was still the kind of deathly danger that she had incurred against herself by her gluttony.

She was told as much by her doctors in the hospital as the bone was splinted and nursed - "Miss Spitz, if you were thinner, I am certain you would not have had that heart attack on the way here - and at worst this would be a sprain." Eventually, however, she was allowed home. Her right foot below the knee was in a great, black cast and she was instructed to not move it.

Hannah lovingly helped her in on her wheelchair - "Girl, I am so sorry! I'm gonna make sure you get better from this," caressing Claire's shoulder. Claire couldn't help but feel that she had fucked herself up - she had let herself get so fat that she couldn't even lose the weight if she had tried. Hannah, out of pity, asked, "What do you want for supper? Nothing's off limits." Claire thought, sighed, and spoke - "Can we get something from Billy Dee's?"

And that mode of thought dominated Hannah's treatment of Claire. She felt horrible - she had encouraged Claire to exercise, and now she had suffered a horrible injury as a result - her friend deserved whatever would make her comfortable. Unfortunately, what made her comfortable was food - and plenty of it. Hannah's kind nature was being used to enable Claire's gluttony. Slowly but surely, the instruments that had fattened Claire began returning - pizza, Billy Dee's, fattening homecooked meals made by Hannah.

The result was that the twenty pounds came back on by the end of the next month. With no way to move, Claire could not burn almost a single calorie consumed, and her BMR was not up to the task of burning the thousands and thousands of calories Hannah was letting her consume. Claire's weight began to balloon as the months rolled on, and her drive to lose weight was gone.
1253311211111211.title: Stumbling backward.

choices: Claire gets back on the wagon - Hannah is still eating herself fatter.
12533112111112111.content:
The weight loss that had begun the year became more and more a distant memory as Claire ate away at her frustrations and filled her days with food.

Every meal was a binge that drowned her anger at being unable to lose the weight that was threatening her life and keeping her a husk of a person. Bacon, pastries, and other fattening foods in the morning - Hannah drank at her large mug of coffee, she frequently had to wake up early to cook these big breakfasts for Claire. But she was happy to do it - her friend was on the tail-end of healing her leg. Finally she turned about, her arms jiggled as she carried the tray.

Hannah's access to the food she was using to help make Claire feel better wasn't without its own effects. Her previously slim body was growing fatter - the bacon, the eggs, the lunches out at work, the fattening food she shared with Claire, it began to show on her body. Her arms had grown from slender little things to being broader and softer, her waist had increased by some five inches - a little belly accompanied by the beginnings of love handles began to emerge where once was a slim torso. Her thin legs now blossomed outward into chubby thighs. She was, of course, far from Claire's increased size.

Claire's gut, already huge, had rolled out exponentially. At her normal seated position, it now easily overran her mid-thighs and approached her knees, a great wave of fat that encircled and coated every inch of her torso. Her breasts rolled out and sat atop of her great, obese gut, heaving constantly with shallow breaths kept down by her ever-soaring weight. She frequently rubbed at her chest nowadays, which she did before speaking to Hannah, "Thanks, Han." Her chest pains had been coming back in a bad way after the end of her diet and exercise program. It wasn't helped by constant, salty meals such as this. The grease of the bacon slid down her throat, chased by salty potatoes and eggs, and pastries that, strictly speaking, weren't supposed to be eaten by a diabetic like her. It was obvious that her weight was exploding at an unprecedented rate.

When the meal finished, Claire spoke up as she injected her insulin into her stomach and took her pills, "My cast is due to come off soon." Hannah spoke up, "Good! It'll help you get around easier." She got up, prepared for her workday. "I've got to go to work. Take care!" Claire waved a hefty arm at Hannah, "G'bye! Take care!" Something in the back of Hannah's mind was telling her that this was wrong - but her sympathy was beginning to be replaced by an apathy - If she wants to lose the weight, she'd tell me. Besides, I haven't eaten this good in a while. Hannah had taken care of her finances - her car was paid, her insurance was going well, and she had a hefty warchest. She figured she could indulge for a little while.

Claire's weight, however, had ballooned at a runaway rate as a result of this relative hedonism on Hannah's part. Her daily calorie intake easily exceeded 6000 each day, and over the past four months, she had blown up like a human balloon. She had given up on either actively gaining or actively losing weight, just accepting what was happening to her. She was less eating for the morbid sexual pleasure that she previously got, and now more eating to kill time.

Time was certainly starting to run out. Her next doctor's appointment made that clear. The georgian was gobsmacked, "Claire, you have not been keeping up with your diet. If you had stayed on it over the course of your injury, you should be easily at 500, but you're at the entire opposite end. She stepped on the cattle scale. It flashed a stunning number - 622 pounds. Her blood pressure was up to a near constant 159, and her medicine wasn't high enough in dosage. "You are out-eating our medicine, your cholesterol is reaching dangerous numbers. So, I'm sorry." Claire was confused, "What?" The doctor continued, "I'm sorry, but if you do not listen to our medical advice and continue eating yourself to death, I am going to have to drop you as a patient. I can't bear to keep seeing you come here, bigger, fatter, unhealthier each time. The next time I see you, you're going to be on a metal slab, and you're going to be dead from a heart attack."

Claire reacted as usual - by eating her emotions. How she reacted next would decide her life.
12533112111112111.title: Hannah the Enable, Claire the Enabled.

choices: Claire's meals start coming back up - her stomach is burning all the time.
Claire's diabetes is bucking its insulin - she starts losing feeling in her leg.
125331121111121111.content:
Claire had already judged that she was too fat to lose weight. The Georgian dropping her as a patient was the last straw, and Claire's binge didn't just go on that night - it carried on for days afterward. Pizza, fried chicken, pasta, masses of junk - some days, all of them in a procession of gut-busting, clothes-ripping furor. She ate and ate as her mind figured, If I'm a dead woman, I might as well enjoy myself. I'm hopeless. She felt herself getting fatter, felt her gut rolling further outward with each meal, her stomach seemed to expand with each one. Her binges seemed to increase by at least one plate each week. Her days devolved into endless stretches of eating herself silly, broken up only by insulin injections that, at times, didn't feel like enough - sometimes her vision was still blurry, and of course she sated the tiredness by simply passing out.

At dinner, one night, Hannah sat down across from her. Claire looked at her, disheartened, "Han, don't." Hannah shrugged and spoke, "Why not? I figure binges can be social activities." The two of them on a table packed to every single centimeter with dishes and plates. Hannah ate, but couldn't keep up with the rate and volume of Claire's consumption. After one mere party plate of General Tso's and one box of chinese donuts. She rubbed her taut gut, which developed more into a belly - her love handles began to mature across her sides, her arms went from ever so slightly chubby to being full-on fat, just short of having bingo wing folds of fat drape from below her arms. "Ouwwww..." Claire giggled through her limited lung capacity, "You got a ways to go, girl." Hannah seemed to pass out into a food coma right there, while Claire kept on eating. At that point, Hannah had ordered too much food - she had larger eyes than her stomach could support. Even Claire struggled to finish, and her gut stuck out tautly over her knees. She could barely bring herself to inject her insulin, and couldn't even take her pills before she passed out.

She woke up with her heart continuously pounding as her body struggled to process the weight of food. She laid there in terror for a long time - was this it? Did her gluttony finally do her in? She didn't feel the telltale tingle - nor did she feel dizzy. Her heart kept on pounding, and she rubbed at her pained chest - but she didn't feel it getting any worse. It must have been okay - for now. She chided herself internally - I'm such a fucking whale, I've eaten myself into this position, what the hell is wrong with me? But she reminded herself, I'm too fat to lose this weight. I'm doomed, only thing left to do is to try to enjoy myself. She began to feel a simple pleasure in expanding her capacity to eat. It was the joy of painting a fence - in a more self-destructive manner.

And the fence was surely being painted. Not only did her stomach expand itself, but the rest of her seemed to flood outward in a flood of fat. Her binging took her to easily at least 2000 calories a meal. Three times a day, with another 1500 in snacks, meant that she was easily putting on some 11 pounds a week - and with Hannah attempting to keep pace, she was easily putting on some 6 herself. By the end of the month, Claire had put on some 40 extra pounds. Of course, Claire's health only began to get worse from there.

She began to feel the after-effects of her relentless eating as she felt a burning chest pain after nearly every meal. But she could barely move now - and she was certain no other doctor would accept a patient like her - she was, after all, too fat to be treated. She ate through the pain - every session of burning chest pain being accompanied by Claire awaiting a tingle in the arm - which seemed not to come, not yet. It seemed as though the anticipation of the thing was going to be worse than the actual instance.

While Claire waited for her heart to give out, other things began to give out.
125331121111121111.title: Two ballooning women.

choices: "You could sneak me some real food."
1253311211111211112.content:
*Note: This chapter is very morbid, and they will continue getting morbid from here.*

Something that so many people take for granted is the functionality of a nerve.

It is a simple thing, the functioning of a cord of sensation. At times, it can play tricks on a person. Sensation drives people, in many ways.

It is the lack of sensation that can be particularly unsettling. And it unsettled Claire more and more that her right leg had been tingling and numb for a while now. She remembered the tingling of her leg as one of the first warning signs of her diabetic symptoms. But she could only get so much insulin - and her doctors had dropped her - it would be a while before she could get more.

It started one day when she was feeling quite tired after a binge - normal, food comas were one of her favorite things about eating. She began to pull a blanket up - but it felt strangely heavy on her right leg - almost as if it was weighted to keep the leg pressed to the floor. She felt her right leg tingle all over - she figured it would go away. But ignoring the problem only led to it getting worse.

The great pillar of folds, fat, and lard that was Clarie Spittz's right leg had dark folds in between - a natural consequence of her diabetic skin issues. However, more and more, Hannah gazed at this leg with growing concern. She had tried to wash the leg, but one particular spot continued getting worse. "Claire, is your right leg alright?" Claire shrugged and spoke, "Uh, I think so. It doesn't hurt." Hannah examined the leg closer - especially this problem spot of eternally dark skin. One of her folds around her knees stank to the high heavens - Hannah gagged, physically repelled. Claire's heart sped up - faster than normal, which was an already exhausting tempo, as she realized this was more than a temporary issue.

"Claire, this isn't good," spoke Hannah. "We need to go to the emergency room. I think something's REALLY wrong with your leg." Claire had, once again, to be lifted up onto a gurney - a double-wide one - and wheeled out of the apartment. Even on this double-wide gurney, Claire looked packed into the wheeled bed. The already - generous belt, stretched by the hands of the paramedics, strained - "Jan, get me the extender, please?" Claire could only lay there and think, My god, I've gotten nearly too fat even for the fucking gurney.

The ride to the hospital was one of an endless attempt at sanitization of the fold. The blonde paramedic woman spoke, "Rob, how much antiseptic to we have? This might be gangrenous, or really close to it." The man came over and examined Claire's leg closely. He asked, "Are you a diabetic, ma'am?" She nodded, her face as pale as death. Her breath became more and more shallow - she felt a tell-tale tingle in her right arm. Her chest pain got worse - her heart felt like a belt was stretching around it - "We've got Blue, get the defib," shouted the man. Almost immediately the blonde had the whining paddles in her hands. "Clear!" she shouted, and the corrective shock calmed Claire's heart - forcing it out out of its panicked tremor.

At the hospital, Claire faced the face-masked surgeon. "Ma'am, it's gangrenous. I deeply apologize - but it has to go." Claire trembled weakly in recognition of what this meant. She took a look at her great, lardy, filthy right leg. "M-My leg? M... M..." She began sobbing. The surgeon nodded, "I'm sorry, I really am, but it's this, or you die very, very slowly and painfully from the gangrene. We can't let it spread - it's thankfully just the ankle that will go - it's literally minutes otherwise. We have to cut now." Claire sloppily signed the paper - she laid back and let the anesthesia do its work. "One.. Two..."

Blackness. What felt like a bare moment.

As she came to, she heard more talk - and felt EKG monitors on her chest. "Procedure went well.. Keep her on the EKG, just in case - she's had one, and Infarctions like to come in groups." Claire's eyes turned to her right leg. It felt un-earthly that, below her slabs of meat that were her thighs, no longer were there folds of fat.

In fact, there was now nothing below her right knee. As the surgeon had said, the lower leg was gone. "Ah. You're awake. Everything went well - surgery went fine, we're going to keep you under monitoring for any more heart attacks. We'll be keeping you on a liquid diet for a while - and we'll be transitioning you to an appropriate diet afterwards."

These words were like death to Claire. She had JUST been eating literally anything she'd wanted. Now she was being put on a diet by force - she had to physically repress a groan. "I know, it's no fun," said the doctor, "But it's necessary."

Hannah came to visit her shortly afterward. "Hey, girl. You feeling alright?" Claire shook her head, "I don't have a fucking right foot anymore, Han. I feel like shit." Hannah shook her head and patted Claire on her shoulder. "Is there anything I can do to make you feel better?"
1253311211111211112.title: An unexpected turn.

choices: Hannah has to work overtime - and Claire doesn't know how to cook.
Claire has to get a real job - less walking, more convenience food.
1253311211111212.content:
The vast ocean of fat that covered Claire's body, for the first time in the woman's 25 years of life, had begun to recede.

Her jiggling, fat arms no longer shook as much - the draping folds of fat receded upward toward the muscle and bone. Her legs took firmer shape and had begun to shrink backward - her thighs were still crowded with fat, but she could feel them move easier.

Most encouragingly, her great ocean-like gut, while still heavy with fat, had finally begun to recede backward by inches. More of the world directly below her became visible - she was more easily able to see where she was walking, objects she was at risk of stepping on - more helpful with the increased mobility that her fat loss brought with it. It was an interesting kind of momentum - she had finally been able to break her long lethargy on her weight. It was no longer some vast beast that held her down in one place, that trapped her and suffocated her. She was fighting back and it gave her a special kind of empowerment.

Hannah had taken notice and regularly showed her pride in Claire's progress, shown as one day she put on her green workout shirt - managing to actually stretch it over her lessened gut, "Wow, holy shit, it fits you now!" Claire beamed with pride, "Yeah... We're makin' some headway, girl, I won't let that damn thing kill me." Hannah patted her shoulder. "I know what this calls for!" Claire rolled her shoulders - they hurt far less now, and her walking had improved her posture. She stood up straighter now - and her back was hurting less and less with each pound lost. "What's that?" She asked, turning to see Hannah get something out of the refrigerator. It was brownie batter, "Sugar-free brownie time!" Claire bounced with joy, "Eee! Yes! You know how to treat a girl right!"

Hannah soon was pulling a tray of brownies out. Part of her thought that this might encourage a bad streak in Claire - over-'rewarding' herself - but she fought this. She's doing well, Hannah thought. If I don't reward that, she'll stop losing weight. She cut the brownies up as Claire began the process of standing - a far shorter thing now than it was when she was heavier. She was ever-more ready and happy to see her next weigh-in as she waddled towards the brownie pan. Hannah had just finished when she looked over - "Oh my god, you're up." Claire strutted comically - "I can walk now, bi-atch! Flexing on 'em!" She formed a check-mark with her left arm and ducked her head into it - Hannah sighed at the dabbing woman, "Oh my god, Clarie." The woman chuckled as she picked up a brownie, munching on it.

God, this was good! The sugar-free ones seemed to be even sweeter than the sugar-made brownies. The chocolate was rich, the flour was thick - it was so delicious. A deeper part of her hoped for such 'rewards' more frequently, but her reigning reason-focused part of her brain slapped down the idea - I'm just now beginning to lose the weight, I can't go back on myself now.

The next morning, Hannah called in Claire, "Claire, it's time - let's check how well you've done." The still blubbery woman stepped onto the scale, anxious for the numbers that would come up. How much had she lost in the span of four months, the winter having turned into spring?

"Four Hundred and Ninety Eight Pounds," read out the voice of the scale.

Claire could scarcely believe it - she had managed to lose over fifty pounds! Granted, some twenty of that was water weight - but the rest was real fat, she was below 500 for the first time in recent years.

Whether she could stay below 500, however, would be seen, as a roadblock would come before the shrinking woman.
1253311211111212.title: Claire's turnaround!

choices: Claire has some issues in the office with her weight - and Jean nags at her.
Dana starts packing on some pounds as well by lunching with Claire.
12533112111112122.content:
Left. Right. Left. Right.

Claire was breaking new ground - she was now rounding a second block on her daily walk. She kept her eyes on her path, walking to the beats created by her earbuds. She felt prouder of herself than ever, more confident - she was still sweating like a hog in a desert, but she would have literally dropped dead had she attempted this a few months before.

Her shrinking stomach no longer impeded her movement to the degree it did before - holding perkily above her now more versatile thighs, which were still considerably bloated with fat - but were shrinking with each passing week. Her face even began to feel less fat - her cheeks began to retreat from her view, her fold of neck fat climbed back towards her chin. She felt the weight coming off, and it made her feel alive - not to mention how the diet and exercise had improved her health to a point she could feel and measure.

Her next medical appointment showed drastically reduced numbers - her blood pressure was normal, her blood sugar was in a good range, her cholesterol was lowering, and she could feel her overall health improving beyond these numbers. Her chest no longer had random pains, she no longer felt randomly faint - her posture had improved.

Of course, she had also gotten a letter a few weeks back that her disability was being revoked due to her marked weight loss - and she would have to find employment. Her job hunt had carried her to various interviews - including to this fairly bog-standard Doranko printing company, a squat one-story building that had the logo placard out front - the name of the company on a half orange-half royal blue background, the orange pointing upward towards the sun under which Claire waddled at a moderate pace, dressed in a black button-down shirt.

She made sure it was tucked into her pants - leaving it fairly tight, the buttons twisting slightly to the side in their struggle to hold back the still-considerable bulk of Claire, which at last weigh-in was somewhere still around 488. She entered the glory of the air-conditioned building with its businesspeople hustling and bustling about. The carpeted patterns led her forward to the desk, where a short, thin, mid-aged woman with brown haired- bob-cut and a wrinkled face looked at her up and down - she had applied online and recieved an e-mail, but it was obvious that the morbidly obese form of Claire was not what she was expecting.

She spoke with a falsetto of her normally mid-to-low ranged voice, "Hiii! You must be miss Spittz, right?" Claire nodded and spoke, "Yes ma'am, that's me, I applied for that assistant printer position." The woman extended her hand and spoke, "Well, I'm Jean Grondon, nice to meet you miss Spittz," she then looked curtly about and spoke, "Uh, go ahead and follow me into my office." Claire followed her as she opened the wooden waist-high gate that Claire walked towards. She was thankful for her weight loss - it was hard to squeeze through, even at her reduced size - her large hips chafed against the posts. Mrs. Grondon took note, as her face had grown slightly less welcoming and a bit unsettled by something - asking, "Do you need help?" Claire, red-faced, spoke, "Uh - no, I'm good."

They wandered into the office, and Jean sat in her office chair - Claire took a seat in her chair, but it was horrifically constricting - it felt like the wood closed in on every single inch of her ass, and the armrests choked her torso in place. "So, what motivates you to work here for Doranko?" Claire spoke, taking a breath through the choking constraint of wood, "Uh, mainly, I've just recently lost my disability - I was disabled from working, by, uh.." she awkwardly paused, and spoke up, "My weight, I was too heavy to work - I've started to lose weight, I lost my disability, and I'm looking for some gainful employment." It was prophetic that she would pick that phrase. The rest of the interview panned out - she could work a full work-week of 5 days a week, 8 hours a day. "Well, thank you, miss Spittz, I'll let you know about my decision within the next two weeks. She stood up and extended her hand. Most awkwardly, Claire stood up with the chair still stuck to her, shaking the woman's hand.

Claire, thankfully, managed to get the job - a speedy reply was hers by the next two days, and she had her uniform of a white button-down, special ordered in her size - 4XL, and it fit her just perfectly - not too loose, not too tight. It was a point of pride - what was not was the daily fight with the tightness of the employee gate. Her co-workers stood about and greeted her - a tall, lanky teenager with blonde hair and white, tanned skin. "Hey," he said, "You're the new employee? I'm Rick." Alongside him stood a brunette woman with some weight to her about Claire's height - some 160 pounds, with a slight gut, arms padded by fat, and thick thighs. "Hey, Claire - I'm Dana."

They showed her the ropes of the trade. The main work areas were the central area behind the front desk, the worker's offices were in a room behind this area with a window's view of customers, and the main printing room to the right from the perspective of the customer. Claire had expected a fair amount of walking with this job - walking papers back and forth, ensuring covers were correctly put on, binding books. However, the three managed to share work fairly well - Rick would frequently be managing tasks in the central area, and Dana was usually at the front desk. It was Claire's job to make sure that print jobs ran correctly - and for this, she had to sit in front of the printer.

That first workday's lunchtime came shortly, and Dana turned to Claire - "Hey, Claire, I'm gonna run to Zheng's for lunch. Want anything?" Claire thought. She didn't want to be that person, so she spoke, "Eh, get me the Chicken Lo Mein and a side order of Crab Rangoon." It was her old stand-by from Zheng's. Dana nodded, "Sure thing. I'll grab myself one while I'm at it. Want anything, Rick?" Rick shrugged and spoke up in his usual nonchalant tone, "Eh, already got my lunch packed. Thanks though."

The food came in the hands of chubby Dana, she set them in the back in the common table. Jean came out and spoke up, "You guys taking your lunch? I can cover." Claire spoke up, "Yep, thanks, miss Grondon!" The group sat down and munched on their chinese - and Rick ate his leftover pasta. Dana spoke through a mouthful of Rangoon, "You came in clutch with the suggestion, Claire, I love the rangoon, but I usually stay away from them." Claire chuckled, "Yeah, they're so good, right?" Dana spoke up, "Mm. Oh. By the way, if you want some dessert after this, the snacks don't bring much in - we've got some snack stuff back there, it's allotted right to us, so it's free," she gestured behind her to a table with an array of candy bars, salty snacks, cookies, and a coffee machine. "Ooh!" Exclaimed Claire, "Thanks," she said, reaching over and grabbing a candy bar. Dana waved it off, "No problem. I need someone to remove the temptation for me - I'm trying to chill out on that stuff."

As lunch wrapped up, Claire injected her insulin, grabbed some chips, and watched the jobs print. She had little better to do.

And so, Claire's exercise dropped from what was, for her, a record to damn near nothing. However, routines are stubborn things - and Hannah did not think to adjust Claire's calorie intake. Her semi-active nature had formerly kept her weight off - burning some 500-800, sometimes even 1000 extra calories a day - calories that were compensated for by her snack allotment at home. But her change of routine had forced Hannah to change up - switch out to simpler, high-calorie ingredient breakfasts that were quicker to prepare. Claire's lunches were once again packed with high-calorie, cheap, fast food, and she idly snacked at more sweets.

The effects slowly became apparent. Her work clothes became tighter and tighter, Hannah had less time to help her monitor her weight, and work for Hannah began picking up at the same time - and so more and more nights, Hannah ordered in. The dominoes were falling to crush Claire's diet dead, and her receding gut began its descent once more, creeping back into the path of her more and more unused thighs, which themselves were growing outwards. Her hips were growing wider, and each day she had a harder and harder struggle with the employee gate, each time deriving a longer stare from Jean.
12533112111112122.title: Back to Work - back to snacking.

choices: Dana keeps enabling Claire - she keeps gaining, while Hannah loses weight.
For once, Claire is the one losing weight - Hannah is the one gaining it.
125331121111121221.content:
Claire's gains, though slow, had begun to affect her office life. Her gains were slow, at least, compared to her intentional gains during her camgirl days. She was putting on some one, one and a half pounds a week - over the past two months, she had put on nearly ten pounds, and it began to show that she was nearly back to 500. Her blue uniform was straining, nearly skin-tight. When she particularly gorged herself with Dana at lunch, gaps of flesh could be seen poking through the struggling, side-turning buttons which were on the verge of constantly snapping out, leaving her half-naked in the printing office.

Dana herself had not been immune to the fattening food she ate with Claire. The obese woman's bad habits were spreading to the impressionable young brunette, and she had been made to request an upsize - she officially now wore an XL shirt. "Claire, girl, you're making me into a pig - if I have to go to 2XL, it's on you." Claire giggled and oinked jokingly. By the way Jean was staring at her, though, she thought it wasn't a joke.

Fairly frequently, Claire could feel eyes on her in the office due to her increasing size, including Jean. The mid-aged woman was always giving her a stare-down, especially when Claire was having a nice, big lunch, or snacking on the job. It was the classic, you're getting fat and you know you should be eating a salad instead, type of stare.

Often, Claire had approached the gate with the idea that it was too small - until she was able to squeeze through it, albeit with some effort. She assumed the same was true today.

She waddled forward, stepped up, and pushed the gate forward - opening it. She stepped forward, felt the familiar squeeze of the wood. But today was different. The squeeze had become increasingly tight, but today she tried to continue forward - and simply could not force her way through the normally temporary halt. She tried to pull herself backward for another attempt, but her love handles were wedged too firmly in. A wave of embarrassment struck her, and she felt the eyes of the whole building on her.

She waved over at Dana, "Hey, girl, mind helping?" Dana waddled over - her step had become more impeded by her increasing thigh fat - and awkwardly pulled herself over the front desk. Puffing from this athletic exertion, she shoved on Claire's great back fat, a wall that was lodged in the entry gate. She shoved and heaved, but to no avail. "Jean! Claire's stuck, I'm gonna need some help!" Jean came out, and she had one of the sourest looks that Claire had ever seen her with.

She hopped the thin wooden wall next to the gate and shoved with Dana, and spoke up, "After this, I'm gonna need to talk to you in my office, Claire." Claire could only think what would be said - but there was no escaping it, the strength of the two were able to free the great mass of whale-like blubber from the trap. Dana stepped aside and took a breath - the very pudgy woman was red-faced and sweaty from the exertion, leaving Jean's dagger-like nails shoving Claire through her office door. There was a brief moment of being lodged, but Jean pushed again and stopped Claire from being stuck again.

Claire pulled herself into a chair dragged from the corner. It was not dissimilar to some of the disabled chairs she had been made to sit in due to her larger size. Jean sat herself across from Claire as she shut the door, and glared at her for a moment. It was the kind of no-nonsense look a parent practices at a child who has annoyed them. She opened her mouth and spoke, "Claire, to be frank, you've been dedicated to your work here, but it's been hindered lately." She took a moment and let her finished sentence hang in the air, resuming, "Your weight gain has been noticeable. Your standard issue uniform is already in the largest size we issue, and you are on the verge of busting out of it. Jean poked a finger through an exposed flesh gap in the already-struggling shirt, Hannah had been able to cook a big breakfast this morning, and Claire had indulged herself. She now regretted it as Jean spoke up, "And as far as that gate incident is concerned, it should be a wake-up call. It should be a wake-up call that every time, you're barely able to squeeze through. But I've seen you eating yourself silly every lunch-time, and I'm getting concerned about you." Jean looked down her nose at Claire. Claire didn't dare to speak up as Jean resumed, "Your physical when you started said you already have high blood pressure, diabetes, the beginnings of heart disease. I hired you under the impression that I wouldn't have to up-size much, as you've been on a weight-loss streak before this. I don't want to have to up-size this whole office just for you - so either lose some weight, or the improvements are coming out of your pay."

Claire felt powerless at the might of this domineering woman. It was like she was back in middle school, and all she could say was, "Yes ma'am." She stood up from the humiliatingly huge chair.

Hannah herself was becoming more aware of Claire's returning gains. "You're fallin' off the wagon, girlie," she said that evening as Claire ate into a dish of pasta. "You're the one orderin' the takeout," said Claire. It was true, and it was showing on Hannah as well. She was beginning to look like a slightly smaller Dana - her trim, slim torso had thickened - just so, to the point just before she developed a potbelly. She was thick - and dangerously close to fat, just lacking the gut by a few pounds. "I know - I guess I wasn't in a wagon to fall off of - so I guess that makes the two of us that ought to cut this out."

That weekend, Claire renewed her commitment to lose weight - but Hannah spoke, "I'll start Monday, I swear."
125331121111121221.title: Claire's Office Struggles.

choices: The pattern holds for the next few months, until the holidays.
Dana starts getting resentful of Claire's weight loss. She tries sabotage.
1253311211111212212.content:
After that immense humiliation, Claire got right back onto the wagon. She swapped out with Rick - the skinny teen was happy to get her lazy position, and Jean seemed to nod with approval at this.

Dana, of course, kept on gaining. The next three months brought a bigger and bigger Dana - she had blown up to somewhere over 200 pounds, and her XL was looking more and more pressed to keep up its position. "Claire, come on, I'm packin' on the pounds here. Help me get rid of some of this temptation," Dana would exhort at lunchtime. But Claire held her ground, "Nah, I'm trying to not get stuck in the gate again. Besides, you're nowhere near as big as I am. You've got some wiggle room." Jean began taking Dana's place in helping to supply Claire some meals - she would occasionally find a granola bar to snack on, a caesar salad with a "Keep up the Good Work" sticky note attached. Some month ago, this would have been an annoying, passive-aggressive assault. Now, it was a genuine, helpful measure.

Day by day, there was less of a fight to get through the wooden gate. Her gut receded towards its former position at the start of her job - her shirt breathed easier as the jiggling gut jiggled further back - further than at the start of her job some months ago. The shirt even began to seem baggy on some days. Claire felt proud of herself - she was ignoring temptation! She was actively choosing now to vary up her food consumption - more vegetable-based suppers, more salad lunches provided by helpful Jean.

The same could certainly not be said of Hannah. Claire's already - engorging - friend continued getting nearly exponentially larger over the next few months. She seemed to keep pace with Dana - eating fattening, big, supper after fattening, big, supper. The formerly thin friend was now blowing up above her zaftig form, her thighs and breasts taking a dutiful amount of the weight before it inevitably turned her pudgy belly into an outright gut with full-blown love - handles. Claire didn't dare say anything, though - she knew Hannah wouldn't nag Claire about what she ate unless it was becoming a real problem. And it wasn't a problem with Hannah, so far as Claire knew. She was just enjoying herself.

Claire's weight kept falling by the month - some 9 pounds the first month, then another 10, then, another 9 - it was stunning for Claire to be dropping so much weight, some 30 pounds backing her away from 500 again, and lowering her down to some 465 pounds. She still wore her 4X button-up - but she had to request for a down-size in her pants, and Jean was noticing. "Girl, you're doing so great! You're losing so much weight, how much are you down to right now?" Claire hummed and spoke, "Uh, four-sixty-five." Jean gave her a high-five, "YESS! Girrl, you're doing so great!" It was somewhat jarring to have a woman that was sounding her death knell a few months ago now trumpeting her as the picture of health.

The mounting momentum was huge. Claire was able to keep herself full on a diet - something she had never thought possible, and she still fit in her favorite foods. An occasional slice of pizza - some mac and cheese - some dessert. Her blood sugar numbers had been normal for a while, and her heart no longer pounded out of her chest. She had the hope that, if she kept this up, her Diabetes might go into outright remission - she was making a physical impact not just on her waistline, but on her health.

The sheer amount of control that she now had over herself was stunning, even to her some days. She had even gotten back into gaming - she used the energy she normally used to snack to focus on the game. Damn, though, was she rusty. Shit, She should have been able to dodge that one! It had that extra amount of joy, though - it was like the first time, all over again. She still did snack occasionally - but she began focusing on lighter, lower-calorie snacks - small granola bars, small fruits - nuts - hardly over 250 calories a day on snacks.

All in all, Claire Spittz was seeing that weight loss, for her, was about getting into a pattern. And that pattern was starting to be set in stone. It would take a serious obstacle to overcome the momentum she was building.
1253311211111212212.title: An interesting reversal.

choices: Claire catches herself and weighs in - she has a rough time correcting the gain.
Claire continues "rewarding" herself for the whole month of January.
12533112111112122121.content:
"Claire, you want any of this cheesecake," inquired Dana.

Claire pondered it for a moment. Her office friend had been ballooning up another fifteen pounds and it was becoming increasingly noticed by both her and Jean. "Uh, sure," she said, breaking her usual rule to not accept her fattening treats. For the past few months, Claire had kept up her momentum and even began experimenting with recipes that balanced filling and healthy - seeing how much she could fill herself for as few calories as possible. It had a positive effect on her waist, being able to get herself below some 2,500 calories a day. Her weight had kept its steady decline from 465 to, now, 440. Her shirts finally began to decrease in size, back down to a somewhat tight but workable 3X.

However, the month was now almost November, and Halloween had passed. With November came the glut of unbought store candies, and Dana could not eat all of them. And so, Claire began eating a few more sweets here and there - rarely more than 100 calories' worth at first. But then Jean began complaining.

"There's just so much damn candy around, and I hate waste. Feel free to help yourself, Claire," she had said just a day before this incident.

Claire thought little of it, but the cheesecakes and holiday sweets built up a good 500 calories. On top of it, as November rolled along, Jean had begun ordering in more catered lunches. "Our productivity has never been higher and Corporate has graciously provided this catered buffet lunch." Claire's slim 500 deficit was now annihilated, and her snacking only increased during the holidays. In the back of her mind, she felt a voice saying, "This isn't right. You'll put all the weight back on."

But she silenced this voice - "Oh, come on, don't be such a food nazi. It's just for the holidays."

And so, through november, she had a steady 500 calorie surplus going - one that increased as Christmas approached. She stopped weighing herself - she'd assess the damage after the holidays anyhow. The pounds built back up, and she switched back into her 4x for comfort. And at this junction, Dana indulged her worst excesses - ordering in for pizza and fast food for the whole office frequently, and Claire was more than happy to oblige. It was a treat! She was doing really well! On top of this, the sugar-free sweets accumulated from gifts from Jean, gifts from Dana (generous ones) and gifts from Hannah. 500 calories became quickly some 1,500 calories each week, leading up to Christmas.

Jean had begun to put on some weight also - her slim figure began to build, among other curves, a bulge at her waist. Rick was bulking up a bit, though he looked less fat and more muscular. Dana was getting outright fat, and her weight had gone from the low 200's towards the mid 200's. Her button-up was getting tighter and her pants were falling down, shoved downward by her middle-heavy bulk, no longer a pot-belly but rapidly evolving into a thicker slab of fat. Claire's own belly was returning to a prior prominence she hadn't seen since September.

Christmas, the whole week and the week of New Years', was the week of wanton indulgence. Claire, especially, ate ravenously. God, I needed this, she thought as she scarfed down entire pizzas for lunch, Dana trying to keep pace. Hannah cooked rich, calorie-high meals as holiday treats, her own thicker waistline turning into an increasing potbelly. Everyone seemed to be fattening for the winter. With this regime of increased, indulgent eating, Claire returned to her old regime of snacking. Easily going over 2,500 calorie surpluses daily, her 4X was frequently tight with an over-stuffed potbelly.

New Years' Eve saw Claire and Hannah drinking the night away at the apartment. Hannah drunkenly spoke to Claire, "Y'kn'w... Claire... I've been gettin' pretty FAT recently. My resolution is... t...." She gurgled as she hummed, then spoke, "T'get fatter." The two cackled in their state. Claire spoke up, "Same here... I ... I've gotten fat again... guess I"m just, going back, back, to, uh, five million or where'v'r I was.."

Hannah's eyes could catch the sheer damage the holidays had done on Claire's figure. While Hannah had gotten a little chubby over the holidays, Claire was getting outright FAT. From November to New Years', she had put on some 30 pounds with her overindulgence. Her gut was looking at her old levels, if a few inches shorter. Her 4X was looking packed to bursting in the apartment, and she was wearing one of her old pairs of pants.

Hannah drunkenly thought, Man, she really is getting fat. She then thought, So am I. What if I let go too? For Hannah, this was a drunken thought forgotten by the morning's hangover. The reality of Claire's immense setback was still very tangible in every pound she had put back on.
12533112111112122121.title: Slimming hits a stump.

choices: Claire and Hannah both lose weight at a slower pace.
Claire and Hannah both try to diet, but fail miserably over January.
125331121111121221211.content:
That next morning, Claire's whole body ached. She could barely get out of bed from the pounding in her head, her eyes nearly too bleary to percieve the whitewashed ceiling above her. It was a damned hard night she had on New Year's, and her morning was equally hard on her body. She tried to shut her eyes and go to sleep, but the migraine resulting from the night of debauchery kept her awake.

This led to her trying to do anything to keep her mind off her aching head, and this led to a stark realization. For the first time in months, she had a good, long time to look at herself in bed. It was January 1st, the day of renewed resolutions, that famous jumping-off point for weight loss. And Claire Spittz recognized something - her gut, laying down, stood a lot taller and a lot thicker than she remembered. That drove her out of bed, to her bathroom. Oh, fuck, it didn't go away. Her whole body shook and jiggled with fat.

How far have I gone, thought the woman, as she stood on the cold metal of the scale. The numbers drifted. 469, then 478 - a flash that made her heart drop - then a thankful sink in numbers.

It wasn't far enough. It stopped at 473.6. She had put on over 30 pounds in the span of 2 months, and was under two short months away from being right back where she started.

She cradled her immensity. How the hell could a person let go that hard? She must have lost her mind, though she remembered that she ate far more that holiday season than she normally did. The road back was simple enough to her.

Hannah was still asleep - taking the day off as a hangover cure. But Claire figured that if she stayed in, she'd just eat the day away in boredom. She couldn't risk that. She had to be at work. She hadn't packed a lunch the night before, and she had no time to make one - she ate a container of yogurt and drank a cup of coffee.

And so her walk began. God almighty, this was a lot harder than she remembered. Her fat jiggled with intensity as she thundered along the sidewalk. Her thunder thighs rebelled against the tightness of her work pants, and her previously slimming torso now even partially filled up her 4X, revealing the lower part of her gut near her pants. Her heart raced at the unexpected exertion, pumping through the accumulated plaque of years of bodily neglect.

By the time she got to work, she approached the dreaded gate. Thud, thud, thud. "Hey, Claire," spoke Jean. "Thanks for coming in. Dana is taking a "sick day," she put in air quotes, "and Rick has school. You've got the ship." By her gaze, it was clear to Claire that she was approaching the size of the metaphorical ship. Ever closer to the gate, and Claire forgot to suck in her gut. She felt the tightness of the wood, and felt wedged as she approached the exit. She swore under her labored breath and gripped the two sides, shoving and sucking as she popped free. Jean's foot tapped against the carpet - a clear sign of dissaproval. "Guess I'm not the only one who put it on over the holidays, huh?" Claire giggled nervously, "Uh, yeah, heh. I've put a lot on over the holidays. I'm gonna try to get some of it off over this next year." Jean nodded. "Yep. I feel you. I've put a lot on myself, and I've gotta tame this gut." She poked her own meager bulge, but it was obviously a dig at Claire.

Claire was easily active during the office day, and worked up a good sweat regularly. Of course, it was with unexpected tasks - walking from her office to the front desk, from the front desk to the printer, then formatting - doing the work of the whole office got her heart racing, and got her to sweat up a fair bit.

By the time lunch came around and she got some food at a nearby burger place, she couldn't help but recognize that she still had a hard time eating "clean." Her triple-patty burger and fries were far from a "diet friendly meal" but she was hungry, damnit. The paradoxical thing is that from all the binging over the holidays, by the time she got back to the office, her stomach requested some tribute again, grumbling. She was appalled at her own gluttony. What, you still want food?

She held off as she could. Truly, she did. But the spare snacks called to her. Jean was off running an errand, or more likely, off buying wine and going home for the day. Nobody was around, the later afternoon was always something of a slow period at this store. Just a small bite would do it.
