A small bite turned into finishing the remaining pretzel bites in the waste inventory, and the licorice, and the caramel bites. A good 1000 calories later, she waddled out of the store, having clocked out.

Arriving home,drenched in sweat, Hannah turned to her. "Girl, you still went to work today?" Claire nodded breathlessly. Hannah shook her head. "I know I don't have a lot of ground to stand on," she patted her own potbelly, "But I think you overdid it on the holidays. We've got to kick this stuff." Claire nodded. "Got anything healthy for dinner, then?" She changed into her casual clothes. "Uh... would it be a bad example if I told you I already ordered from Rico's Tacos?"

Claire cackled and then sighed. "Well, looks like I won't be the only one getting fat."
125331121111121221211.title: Long road to the wagon.

choices: Claire manages to curb her gains—for once, she's the only one slimming down!
Claire gives up—she slowly starts to balloon back up
1253311211111212212112.content:
Over the course of January, Claire continued to battle against the habits that she'd relearned during the holidays with middling results.

On the one hand she was very much aware of what was happening, in the sense that she knew that she was backsliding on her diet. She would begin every day with a set goal of staying within her 2500 calorie goal, with a reasonable 500 calorie buffer to help ease her back into her healthy habits. She had known going in that getting back into the groove of her diet was going to be hard, but the simple fact of the matter was that her meals didn't satisfy her like they used to. After incrementally increasing her daily caloric intake, even if she never piqued her old heights, it had become hard to convince herself that she was full from her diet-approved planned meals. It almost felt like there was no way that she was ever going to stop after a salad ever again!

Claire tried to be good, she really did! But her whatever willpower she'd accrued during her initial slimming had been kneecapped by Hannah cooking all that rich food over the holiday, or Jean and her new habit of keeping candy around the workplace, or Dana and her ability to guilt Claire into sitting down for a nice big lunch...

Who was she kidding—Claire knew it was her own fault.

Nobody was going to lose her weight for her, and she had to stop blaming other people for her own inability to stand up to temptation!

It was just... after putting on another fifteen pounds in a month was a lot. She was back up to 492lbs after having done so good in her weight loss journey. It was hard for her to accept that she'd slid back so far...

"Claire, this is the third time that I've warned you this week." Jean raised her eyebrows imperatively, "The dress code around here is not optional."

"Yes ma'am." Claire huffed, her head rolling, "I'm sorry."

Claire had officially gotten too fat for one of her cutest button-ups. It was pastel blue with pretty flowers on it, and she'd been so excited that she could squeeze into it back when she had been losing weight. She had hoped that in wearing it she could subconsciously psyche herself out from eating too much today, but no. One wrong move and not only had a button flown off of her thick slab of fupa cut into deep by her bottoms, but it had also ripped along the shoulders. Now her fleshy back meat was on display as it baked over her tank top like bread over twine. What was supposed to be a slimming tip had just shown anyone that got behind her just how fucking big her back boobs were.

"I'm going to let it slide one last time, Claire." Jean warned with an authoritative finger-point, "Next time it's going in the logbook."

Ugh, not the logbook. Fuck that stupid binder.

"Okay, I'll..." try not to be so fucking fat that I pop out of my clothes, "...do my best."

"Okay then, I'll see you on the floor."

Jean said it with a forced, managerial smile that creased a little less than it used to. The added weight in her face had smoothed out the wrinkles some. As January came to a close she'd yet to lose any weight either and had in fact looked to have put on a couple of pounds since the year started. It wasn't much, but Claire at least felt a little vindicated in knowing that she wasn't the only one with dietary troubles.

***


To contrast, Claire was often too wrapped up in her own dietary issues to concern herself too much with Hannah's. Why should she have been? Her own weight problem was far more pressing, and in fact potentially life-threatening. Her roommate's slow crawl up the scale had only dawned upon Claire in small doses, usually when getting good looks at her chubbing physique.

Since her declaration of kicking junk food out of her life, directly citing it as a delayed New Year's Resolution, Hannah had managed to accomplish very little in that regard.

Claire would often come home to find her roommate hastily throwing out paper baggies and wrappers from burger joints and cheap Tex Mex restaurants, eager to pretend like she hadn't spent most of her time at home sitting on the couch and ordering food to the house.

The truth was that Hannah had been skinny for almost all of her life—she'd never really had to diet, though she had exercised moderately regularly until recently. In a similar situation to Claire's, it was just hard going back to eating rabbit food. She was happy to support her roommate's slimming regimen though, for all the good it seemed to do. Even though she wanted to slim down, her desire proved impotent in the face of the new habits she'd built up over the course of the past few months. Add onto that, now she was sneaking food.

"Hi Claire!" Hannah said breathlessly as she trash can lid still teetered on its axis, "Good day at work?"

"Why don't you tell me?"

Claire began to toddle in a circle until her vast, exposed canvas of backfat faced her roommate. She had been forced to endure her whole day like that—the jacket that Jean had promised her was far too fucking small to fit over her meaty forearms, let alone her broad fleshy shoulders.

"Oh no, I'm sorry hun."

"It just fucking figures." Claire grumbled as she toddled towards the couch, "Look, fuck my diet, I could really use some fucking pizza. And booze. And then probably some more pizza. Are you down?"

"Pizza?"

Hannah touched her stomach tentatively, still fit to burst after a monster-sized burrito from Rico's Tacos that she had literally just polished off. She had pledged to be a good, responsible friend to Claire in hopes of helping her slim back down, so how in the world could she have told her that she just got done shotgunning a burrito as thick around as her arm?

"Uh... sure, Claire." Hannah smiled awkwardly, "I mean... one cheat day a month isn't gonna kill you, right?"

Shit, Hannah swore inwardly, poor choice of words.

"Ugh, you're right..." Claire said after a moment's hesitation, completely mistaking Hannah's guilty dismissal as advice, "I shouldn't."

"R-Right..." Hannah veered back on track, "Because... something something, can't control how people act—"

"But I can control how I react to them."

Claire plopped down on the couch, making the whole apartment quake. She leaned her head back on the back of the couch, bemoaning that she had even brought it up. Now she couldn't order pizza without looking like a quitter. She fucking knew that she shouldn't, but goddammit her life was a living hell! She'd been trying to lose weight, and she was almost back up to five hundred fucking pounds!

"Dieting sucks."

"Tell me about it."

Hannah plunked down next to her roommate, hand on her full belly as it pooched outwards.
1253311211111212212112.title: Jumbo January

choices: As Claire corrects, Hannah reverses—one loses while the other gains
12533112111112122121121.content:
As Winter led into Spring, Claire was finding some success in her efforts to slim down—though it was still a long road ahead of her, she was well on her way to being back down to where she was before the holidays.

She had started to shrink down her meals, just barely managing to keep them under the three thousand calorie limit that she'd set for herself. She had had every intention of getting back under twenty five hundred eventually, but making the transition permanently meant giving up a series of small yogurts that helped get her through the day. She had done her best to enjoy a walk once or twice a week (occasionally bi-weekly) to pile on top of the little bits of walking that left her exhausted after work. Spooked by her slip back towards the big five-double-oh, a tiny seven pounds and some change before she hit 500, it had helped her to ease back into the healthy lifestyle that she'd been cultivating before the marathon run that had been Halloween, Thanksgiving, and Christmas... plus pretty much all of January.

Claire had managed to drag herself back down to 470 over the Spring, kicking and screaming the whole way down. It wasn't quite where she was in September, but it was still an impressive loss. More than twenty-five pounds over the course of three months added up to just a little over eight pounds a month! Was it a little disheartening to know that it had taken her three months to get rid of what she'd gained over January? Yes. But it had come with an extra ten pounds off and put her below where she was at the start of the year by three pounds.

Which meant that, for the first time in a long time, she was probably the only one in her small social circle who could say that she was skinnier than she was when this year began.

"Ugh, how do you manage to lose any weight around here?" Dana asked, scrunching her face at Claire's smaller figure, "I'm dyinggggg to lose weight over here and it's just falling off you, girl!"

Claire really, really didn't want to point out that for all of Dana's whining about her weight, she still brought big, fattening lunches with rich desserts. Presumably, by the rate of her gain and the spread of her butt across her office chair, Dana didn't just eat like this at work. On the few occasions that the two of them had ventured out together to a restaurant after hours, Dana always ordered and ate like a pig. It was no wonder that she had only continued to pack it on roughly at the speed with which Claire was slimming down.

"Come on, you know if it's here I'm gonna eat it..." Dana laid a hand on her thick slab of stomach, bigger and heavier after another three months of indulgence, "And I'm soooo full..."

Claire never really thought that she'd ever get to a place in her life where the thought of cheesecake wouldn't tempt her. Who didn't get tempted? But, as her diet instructor and her doctors had told her, it wasn't that we experienced temptation, it was that we faced it. And Claire had gotten pretty good at turning down temptation!

"Sorry hun." Claire said proudly, much to Dana's disgruntlement, "I've been real good lately, and I don't want to risk it."

"Uuuuugh you're no fun." Dana groaned, "Maybe I can pawn it off on the boss lady..."

Another groan as she braced herself to stand up from her office chaire.

"I'm never gonna lose this weight."

"You know, you could start by not bringing so much food to lunch?" Claire offered in a way that probably came across as a little snotty, "It'd be a good start?"

"I mean... I guess..."

It was then that Jean's office door closed, the sight of their pot-bellied boss came into Dana's peripheral. As the year had gone on, Jean hadn't managed to lose any weight either. Little notes of encouragement and granola bars had slowly disappeared, though her excitement towards Claire's renewed weight loss had returned even in the midst of her budding unhealthy habits and her own chubbing physique.

***


Hannah wadded up the burger paper and tossed it into the bin, missing by a country mile as the little wax ball joined the others around the base of the trash can. A monster belch shook their flat as Hannah nestled back sleepily into her seat on the couch.

Since the year had started, her company had rolled out a new remote workstation initiative. It was supposed to be so that they could create more jobs without crowding their workspace, but the results were pretty janky at best. Hannah experienced plenty of site crashes and communication errors, and her bosses didn't have much to tell her other than "hang in there, we're working on it". It was frustrating for sure, but Hannah had found ways to manage. It sure as hell beat going into the office every day.

On the upside, this meant that Hannah could lay around in her pajamas all day. She had reduced her commute by a full half an hour, making it the time it took to roll out of bed, brush her teeth, and plop down on the couch with her company-provided laptop. Occasionally she'd make breakfast, but lately she'd gotten into the habit of ordering in—a little note in the memo line that said "SEND TEXT. DON'T BUZZ. AT WORK."

To contrast Claire's impressive (if small) bounce back, Hannah had only gotten lazier since January. All throughout February and March she had been failing against her own impulses to cook and eat huge rich dishes, unable to stop herself from ordering takeout on those days when she couldn't quite muster up the energy to cook for herself, and she hadn't so much as set foot in the gym since last year. All throughout April though, she'd become a real homebody; when given the option to lay around in sweatpants and comfy clothes, Hannah practically jumped at the chance!

But beneath those flop clothes, Hannah's figure was quickly fattening up. Her stomach was spreading wider, nestling in the plushness of her thighs as they thickened with every bite. Her chubby arms and chest were starting to ripen, her double chin now a permanent fixture on her increasingly round face.

It's not like I have a problem or anything.

It's just a little holiday weight. I'll shake it off.

At least I'm not as big as Claire...

Hannah had made a habit of justifying her indulgences; it had started coming without prompt now, even as she loosened the drawstring on her comfiest pair of sweats. Even as her weight climbed nearer by the day to two hundred. With a playfully dismissive squeeze of her fleshy white tum, she told herself that it was nothing that she couldn't work off, and continued to snack her way through the workday.

After all, as long as she picked up her mess before Claire got home, nobody would know.
12533112111112122121121.title: Claire manages to curb her gains—for once, sh...

choices: Claire focuses on trying to get the girls to shed some weight.
Claire focuses in on herself, but becomes more alone.
125331121111121221211211.content:
The summer had come and gone - no longer schoolgirls, it was spent like many working people spent their summers - passing the time at work.

For Claire, it was an odd experience - she began going beyond sticking to her routine and began branching out, trying healthy foods she hadn't thought she would like. Chinese, barbecue, southwestern dishes that kept her palette varied and her waistline shrinking. Low-calorie and high-flavor, and it kept her stomach satisfied. She found that the real secret, however, was to satisfy her cravings when she did crave fatty food- and when it was sated, to get back on board. She planned around this, in fact, and it grew to improve her weight loss. She had gone from 470 at the outset of June to some 430 pounds - she could scarcely believe how small she was getting. She dreamt some days that she could see her toes without leaning, in brief glimpses that were VERY encouraging to her.

On top of this, she had finally begun to reach a weight where movement became easier, and she began to move more. The massive mounds of jiggling fat ever so slowly began to recede, and her pastel-blue button-up had not only come back, but it had begun to become genuinely loose. "Girl, that thing's getting baggy on you. You gotta get it downsized." Claire smiled slightly, but she could see that Dana had continued to balloon up. Jean's normal nagging, however, was laxing as the mid-aged woman grew fatter alongside Dana, her thighs taking the next round of blows and her arms getting softer. Dana's form, however, had done all it could to distribute its fat evenly and it was inevitable that the next round of gains would impact her gut. Her red blouse grew tighter and tighter, and it rose and fell with Dana's shallow breath as her lungs became oppressed by the layers of fat that now surrounded her no longer chubby, but genuninely obese form.

"Thanks, hon! You know, I've found that it's all about calories in, calories out." Dana took the hint and sighed, "I hate calorie counting, girl. And I can't do any of that fad diet shit either - I tried keto for, like, a day before I broke down and ate a bunch of cake." Dana's sweet tooth seemed to have some warning signs attached to it - she became thirstier and thirstier, and not reading the warning flags, Dana slaked her thirst with sweet drinks. Claire had been the victim of Diabetes for a little while now, and she hated to see Dana start to go down the same road. "You got to watch out, girlie. I'm a diabetic too, and I don't want to see you go the same way." Dana frowned. "Girl, you're getting so judgey. I know, I shouldn't be drinking all this soda, but it's my business." Claire felt ashamed, and apologized - "Sorry, sorry. I know, I don't mean to be a bitch. I worry about you."

Hannah also grew at home, with less of Claire's judgement. She ordered more and more take-out, and cooked less and less. The task, when necessary, began falling to Claire, who felt that it was her job. Claire did what she could to make overtures to Hannah. "I'm gonna make some pasta, want some,Han?" Hannah frequently shook her head, "Nah. Already ordered a pizza for myself." Claire spoke a neutral, "A'ight. Where from?" "Mama Noon's, that place on Sheridan." Claire cooed, "Ooh! I love their calzones."

Claire began to feel mentally worn down. While she was making this journey, nobody was joining her. Everyone around her was putting on weight, not losing it. She felt somewhat out of place as she slimmed down. This was the last barrier to what she felt could be a major breakthrough, one that could carry her down to a level of slimness she had never been to, but being isolated in her goals was dragging her down. Either she had to accept this or try to change her situation.
125331121111121221211211.title: A change in the order.

choices: Claire confronts Hannah about both her weight and eating habits.
Hannah changes the subject, and the matter is dropped for now.
1253311211111212212112112.content:
The Autumn season brought upon a time of renewed introspection for Claire as she struggled to stay motivated.

In sticking with her diet, Claire had managed to shed an additional twenty pounds in the two months that had passed since August. Averaging around ten pounds lost in a month, her results were impressive for someone who had two years ago been waddling down a diabetic death row. Her doctors were proud of her, her parents (when they spoke, which was rarely) were proud of her and, most importantly, Claire was proud of herself! Her uphill battle with weight loss had begun to level—she had lost fifteen pounds over the course of September, putting her at a positively svelte (for her) four hundred and five pounds.

And while the results were impressive, her chest swelling with pride every time her digital scale's readout was heard, Claire had never felt less supported since this whole endeavor had started.

"Good for you—Walnut milk is supposed to be super great for you."

"So why did you get whole?"

Hannah's lips wrapped around the little green straw, slurping up the thick mixture inside. Ever since Pumpkin Spice had come back into season at Starbucks, Hannah had been ordering it constantly either to the apartment or during her "field trips" to the coffee shop during her working hours. The Trenta cup sloshed with rich frappuccino blend, easily as tall as Hannah's head and dwarfing her hands.

"I just think it tastes better is all." Hannah responded absently, "Besides, it's just one coffee."

"That thing's the size of your head." Claire laughed cautiously, "That's like... six coffees."

"You're right, next time I'll just get soy." Hannah's answer was placative and denial-laden, "But it's really smarter for me to get the big size... you know, with how often I come here."

Claire sucked through her teeth as Hannah wobbled ahead to claim their seat. Even beneath her new winter wardrobe, it was clear that Hannah had put on a worrying amount of weight since this time last year. Claire sucked at numbers (having weighed nearly six hundred pounds at one point, Claire's sense of scale was way off for "normal" sizes) but she could say confidently that Hannah had passed two hundred pounds at some point not too long ago. The thick milky love handles that bulged over her sides, blending and rolling into a fleshy gut that bulged over the waistbands of every bottom, pants, or pair of jeans that she squeezed herself into were testament enough to that.

What's more, Hannah's daily amounts of exercise had fallen to abysmal levels ever since they had assigned her to the remote position that she so adamantly enjoyed. She sat down in the seat across from Claire with a heavy, appreciative sigh as if she had been the one lugging around all of Claire's extra padding. Her winter hairstyle and the roundness of her cheeks, combined with the pale shade that she had lightened to as she'd settled into her zero-commute lifestyle, really put the nails into the coffin for Claire...

"Hey, I was thinking about going to the gym tomorrow after work?" Claire said rather abruptly, letting her single grande latte cool in her hands, "Do you maybe want to come with?"

"My membership ran out." Hannah made a face as she slurped on her high-calorie concoction, "Besides, I've got work tomorrow."

"I said after work." Claire said in a way that she hoped wasn't too short, "You know, around six, seven?"

Hannah slurped her drink a little longer than last time, as if she were biding her time in order to come up with a good excuse. She had never been negative regarding Claire's weight loss even as her own steadily rose and rose, but as she'd gotten lazier and more accustomed to eating what she wanted and whenever she wanted it, Hannah had become far less passionate about being an actual member of Claire's weight loss support circle. She had been content to be a cheerleader, but when it came time to take Claire up on her requests for physical support, she had been content to sit on the sidelines and slurp. And munch. And chew. And swallow and scarf.

"Yeah, maybe." Hannah said weakly...
1253311211111212212112112.title: Pumpkin Spice Season

choices: Claire's workspace is getting crowded—Dana and Claire are almost the same size.
Lacking a support circle, Claire reaches out—she joins Over-Eaters Anonymous.
12533112111112122121121122.content:
"Yeah, maybe." Hannah said weakly before abruptly changing the subject, "Hey, what time does the movie start?"

"In... oh shit, forty-five minutes."

"We'd better get going then." Hannah took a long, long sip on her frappe, barely bringing it down to a quarter-way gone, "I mean, you know, if you want to get good seats."

Claire piled into the passenger seat (she was officially small enough to ride up front in Hannah's silver Honda civic again, something that she had been immensely happy about) and they drove to the movie theatre. Upon arrival, Claire just sort of sighed as Hannah's attention was drawn immediately to the smorgasbord of snacks offered behind the counter. She had asked, without realizing it, if Claire had wanted any popcorn, before quickly adding "...you know, no butter, no salt, all that crap.", almost as an afterthought.

To be truthful, Claire had been thinking about it. But upon hearing Hannah's blatantly self-interested proposal, her feelings had been too hurt to take her friend up on her offer. "All that crap" was serious business to Claire, and hearing it said so dismissively stung more than a little.

"No thanks." Claire said simply, sternly, before continuing her trek forward, "I'm gonna go get us seats."

"O-Okay! Are you sure?" Hannah's voice was twinged with desperation, "My treat? Something small maybe?"

"Hannah, if you want something, get something." Claire said with a small shake of her head, "Just because I'm not eating doesn't mean that you can't get something."

"If you're hungry." she quickly added as a deliberate, not all that subtle jab at Hannah's expense.

Claire's doctors had spent so much time coaching her about knowing the difference between being hungry and wanting food. It was something that she struggled with even now. Years of glutting herself shamelessly had instilled in her a desire to eat almost constantly. It had been tamed, but not done away with entirely. Even after extensive coaching, she still fought the urge to eat her boredom away, and her self-control got dangerously melty in the face of her favorite foods. Somehow she suspected that Hannah could use a refresher course on when to know if she was actually hungry or not.

All that being said, it fell flat on Hannah.

The smell of popcorn in the air, the bubbling fizz of the soda jerk, and the plunk-plunk of candy being shaken in cardboard boxes—why wouldn't she have been hungry?

"I'm just gonna get something small." Hannah could tell that she had stepped in it somewhere throughout this conversation, but she wasn't quite sure how or in what way, "Get us good seats?"

Claire sighed.

"Yeah, sure."
12533112111112122121121122.title: Let's All Go to the Lobby

choices: Claire and Dana ignore the distraction and hit the gym.
Dana gets distracted - and Claire with her. They gorge at Horstie's.
125331121111121221211211221.content:
That next day, Claire got back to work after an enjoyable night out with Hannah. That entire time walking to her job, it had been an ordeal of worrying about Hannah's ever-increasing gain. Hannah had to be approaching, what, 250 pounds? Compared to the thin woman she knew this time last year, Hannah had truly blown up at a dizzying pace. Claire always thought that on this kind of a journey, Hannah would be the support column, when now she was the foil to Claire's gains.

Granted, Claire still occasionally indulged with Hannah on a dine-out meal now and then. She just kept to her routine otherwise. At times, she thought about how much she'd enjoy gorging with Hannah, but she checked herself - she also thought about how reliant she was on her meds, even while losing weight. Granted, her dosages had been moved downward and downward. These thoughts were what occupied her head as she walked through the wooden gate with little struggle - still a hint of it, but barely a milisecond of pulling herself through the posts that used to damn-near trap her.

Ahead of her, already eating her first "snack" was Dana. Replacing her normal joyous expression at her normal attitude was a face of pressure and stress, scrunched eyebrows and tight shoulders. Claire could tell this was her stress-eating, a rare occurrance that warranted an approach, with a concerned, "What's wrong, girl?" Dana swallowed, her blubbery cheeks previously full of pretzel. Her second chin had been replaced in recent months by a familiar neck flap, thick with fat. Dana's arms and legs were swallowing her already-upsized shirt and pants, but the true terror of her shirt was her ever-increasing breasts and belly, racing outwards. Dana, at around 400 pounds, couldn't help but look at her and think, My god, she's almost my size. Almost 400 pounds or somewhere in the high 300's, compared to the 160 or so when Claire had joined the workplace around 2 or 1 and a half years ago.

Dana replied, her eyes full of anxiety. "Claire, I saw the doc the other day... Apparently, I'm, uh... I'm diabetic now.." She exhaled and inhaled. "They've got me on the Metformin..." Claire patted Dana on the shoulder as she comforted herself in the tools of her own destruction. Claire had started to develop a sense - none of her lectures or voiced concerns got results from Hannah. Perhaps if she tried to support her coworker, she could get closer with Dana again - and hopefully, get her to drop some pounds. "Girl, I'm on that same issue. I've been on insulin for a little bit now, I know how it feels. Feels like your body's rotting before its time." Dana looked up with an expression of sympathetic connection. "Yeah... That's exactly how it feels.." She sniffled.

Claire thought for a moment how to approach the situation. Words could only do so much, but a gesture could do a lot to reproach her to Dana. If it was something like inviting her to the gym, it might come off as another lecture - something Dana would brush off. She knew of one main language with which to communicate with Dana. "Tell you what, want me to grab lunch today?" Dana smiled and nodded. "That'd be great."

As Claire got on with the workday, glancing Jean as she did so - viewing Jean's expanded form gave her some catharsis. She remembered the hell that her boss had given her for her weight, and karma was being a real bitch to Jean. She wasn't quite where Dana was that summer, but she was getting more than a little overweight. Her nice button-ups grew tighter, and she moved less - meaning less screaming and lectures, most fortunately for Dana.

As Claire took a break around 11:30 to go grab something, she thought about how best to get Dana something she'd love. A salad was out of the question - it'd come off like trying to force her on a diet that might paint Claire as the aggressor. Instead, Claire thought it best to get something for Dana that she'd love. After some deliberation, she came back through the door with some styrofoam containers. Dana perked up at what she saw when she opened up the box.

"Sushi! Oh, Claire, you're a saint!" Claire hugged her back while putting down another third container between the two, "Aaaand, the crab rangoon." Dana kissed Claire's still considerable and blubbery cheeks. "Oh, bless you, bless you. You're great." The two enjoyed the sushi and crab rangoon, connecting over the meal. It was a nice indulgence for Claire. It was at about this point, however, that Claire recognized that she was planning on joining Hannah in her cheat meal that night - and only God knew how many calories that would be. Thankfully, she was figuring the gym would help with burning the excess calories - she was thankful for including that in her routine tonight.

"Hey, Dana, I'm hitting the Gym after work tonight. Want to join me?" Dana pondered for a moment and spoke up, "I never thought I'd say this, but sure." Claire smiled, big. "Great! And don't worry about being left in the dust - it's my first time in a gym since college, the last time I didn't risk breaking any of the machines." Even in college, her visit to the gym was a one-time occurrance. Claire was hopeful that her experience here would stick easier.

After work wrapped up, all that temporarily delayed the two was a brief fight with the gate. Dana spoke up, "Hey, Claire, mind if we take my car?" Claire spoke up, "Oh, sure!" They waddled towards Dana's sedan, parked in employee parking. It had a black paintjob, with specks of paint hanging off. "Sorry about the paintjob... I've gotta get it repainted at some point, here." Claire chuckled, "That's why I'm happy I never bothered with cars. Been too big for a while to fit in them, anyways. Kind of a treat for me to ride in anything." There was, of course, the requisite pile of junk food wrapperes in Dana's car. "Lemme clear off the passenger side for ya," the woman spoke. Brushing the trash into the foot of the backseat, Claire sat her gym bag in the back and rolled herself into the passenger seat. Despite her weight loss, she was still 400 pounds. She struggled with the seatbelt, trying and struggling to pull the buckle over her still rotund gut. It was a few inches away. Dana spoke up, "Oh, crap, uh, I can look for a second extender." Claire spoke up, her voice wavering due to her effort, "No, It's fine..." She sucked in her gut as best as she could, but still could not manage. Mercifully, Dana handed her a secondary extender - "Here you go." Claire took it, but it bruised her ego - she had hoped she could buckle it without an extender. "Thanks," Claire said.

The car continued along its path down the 2-lane side of the decently-sized highway. Dana got into the right-hand lane, a bit too close to someone else's bumper for Claire's liking, but Claire held her tongue, unconsciously gripping the hand-grip above and to the right of her. Dana glanced over to the right and pointed, "Oooh! Captain Horstie's! That's the best seafood buffet in town!" Claire looked eagerly at the blue-sided building pointed out, with a tall lobster marking the building. She had always seen it in the distance, but eaten there only once or twice. "Ooh. I think I remember that place. They have GREAT fried oysters." At that moment, Claire had a weakness - if Dana so chose, she could exploit this to divert Claire from her fitness-related goal of the night.
125331121111121221211211221.title: Dana's Big Problems.

choices: Hannah wants to make up with Claire - she leaves food around.
Hannah's doctor isn't happy with her that spring.
1253311211111212212112112211.content:
Mercifully for Claire, Dana didn’t turn on her turn signal - continuing forward to the next intersection. At that point, Claire came back to herself - and was quietly thankful that Dana didn’t take them to the buffet. Claire knew that it would have been impossible to control herself at a place like that - with unlimited access to food, she always savaged a buffet whenever she visited one. She was a MASTER of piling food on her plate. Her mouth still watered slightly as they carried past the great lobster.

They arrived at a fairly hip-looking building with a great two-way window on the front, tinted to protect the privacy of the clientele, and a slanting roof above the windows that glinted in the dying sunlight. The two waddled in, Dana panting from the short walk. Claire guided the two into the building, to the thin Indian man standing at the receptionist’s counter. “Helloo,” he said in a somewhat thick Minnesotan accent, “What can I do fer ya?” Claire spoke up, “Uh, one guest pass. I’m just checking in.” The man spoke up, “Ookay, what’s the name on yer account?” “Spittz, Claire Spittz. I opened it online yesterday.” The man scrolled, his face focusing on the screen. Finally, he nodded in affirmation, “Ahhh. Okay, yeah. Want me to just take it from that card?” Claire nodded, Dana spoke up, “Thanks, Claire.” Claire turned to her, speaking. “No prob!”

The two carried on into the Locker room, past a trio of muscular men bragging about their deadlift weights. They carried on into the women’s locker room. There were mercifully a select few in the room, a thin pony-tailed bookish looking girl, a chubbier-looking teenage girl who was putting her hoodie on, and a muscular mid-aged woman. The bookish girl briefly glanced at the two, but looked away. The chubbier teen obviously wanted to get out, but had to wait for the 800 pounds of fat to clear the doorway. The muscular-looking old woman and the chubby teen both looked at the pair, and they both, for a moment, wore an expression of awe, their eyes wide for a moment. The muscular woman, however, looked back to ensuring her workout shake was mixed, while the chubby teen girl squeezed past as soon as the big pair had cleared the way. Her expression was more unforgiving, as if staring at the fattest women she had ever seen.

Claire and Dana stripped down to their underwear as they changed into workout clothes, Claire lending Dana a turquoise pair of leggings and a black tank while Claire herself wore a blue tank and some white leggings. Claire didn’t like them, but they were all that were available for her still-large size. They made her legs look enormous - partially because they were, but that didn’t make them feel any better. Claire’s body out of her clothes was a sight to behold - even having lost nearly 100 pounds, she was still mass of fat, a butterball of a woman. It intimidated and partially scared Claire that Dana was barely any skinnier - her arms jiggled with each movement, her great belly rose and fell from the exertion of changing clothes.

The two carried on to Cardio, first the elliptical. Claire examined the machine, with a ramp and footpedals linked to two sticks that stood freely of the machine. Her and Dana mounted the machine. She kept the resistance low - with her still underlying health conditions, she didn’t want to tempt fate by pushing herself too hard. She focused on the simple motion - forward, backwards, push, pull, shifting the sticks back and forth. She struggled a bit, but she checked on Dana. Dana was sluggishly, limply pushing on the sticks - struggling with the baseline resistance and height. “You can, uh… Bring the resistance down… Lower…” said Claire. Dana nodded, sweat collecting rapidly on her forehead and dripping down. They tried to keep their faces clear of sweat, but it was difficult.

While the fat women focused on their machines, a pair of thin mid-aged women gawked from behind them, watching their back-fat jiggle and bounce as their upper backs rose and fell with the exertion of breathe. They couldn’t help but gawk, “Gawd, how do you let yourself get that fat?” Others around them looked angrily at the ‘Karens’ with their short, bob haircuts. Yes, these two were horrifically fat, but they were doing something about it.

Dana and Claire could hear none of the humiliating remarks, but they felt watched. They felt eyes on them, but they were too damned tired to care. They went fifteen minutes, and by the end of it, they were drenched in sweat, their chests and guts rising and falling with shallow breaths. Claire’s lungs burned, and Dana felt like she was about to die from the exertion. “Ohgod… Ohgod…” The two cut off their workouts simultaneously, and wiped down the machines with the last of their strength. They waddled breathlessly over to the nearby benches and sat. The benches groaned - Claire thought she heard a ‘pop,’ but thankfully, the bench held. The two sat with their guts peeking through the bottoms of the workout tanks, their fat arms drenched in sweat like the rest of them.

After a bit of recovery, Claire turned to Dana, “You want to… Uh… Try to lift a bit?” Dana turned to Claire, nodding faintly. “Uh.. I’m beat...Mind if we… head out?” Claire was fine with that - she had just enough breath to waddle back to the car. By the time she got back to the apartment with Hannah’s bulky form, she was happy to partake in the calzone and cannolis that her roomie had bought. She enjoyed her second cheat meal of the day, and was happy that this was not the potentially THIRD cheat meal of the day it could have been.

By the next day, Dana had begun cutting down on her snacks and eating home-packed lunches of healthier fare, mixed in with occasional lunches out that she enjoyed with Claire. The two grew closer with their bond of mutual weight loss.
1253311211111212212112112211.title: Claire and Dana’s Sweatfest

choices: Claire comes home and sees the beer—understanding Hannah's intention
Claire comes home and doesn't get it—she and Hannah continue to drift
12533112111112122121121122111.content:
Hannah and Claire had been friends for a long, long time.

Hell, Hannah had known Claire back when she was skinny. They had known each other since high school, and had been friendly for a while before moving in together. Granted, the two of them hadn't always been on the best of terms. When Claire started to get really bad, before her weight loss kick, she got to be this lazy brat who just sort of mooched off of Hannah and sat on the couch all day playing video games.But ever since, for about three years, Claire had been working on herself. She'd gotten a job, lost a lot of weight, and started contributing a lot more around the apartment. A lot had changed for Claire and, in her mind, Hannah had been nothing but supportive.

So why did it feel like they were just roommates now instead of friends?

Hannah exhaled deeply, stomach flattening into a squishy hill of pale white chub. Grunting and wriggling in her overly reclined seat on the couch, she didn't break eye contact with her Hulu queue to grab the Chips Ahoy! that she'd forgotten to eat with lunch. Settling back down, stomach slowly wobbling to a halt, Hannah sighed again from mild exertion.

Maybe it was because it was the holiday season. For all of the benefits that came with working from home, Hannah actually missed those stupid office parties that they used to throw for her. The food was always great, and her boss usually let them have a little bit to drink if it didn't get too rowdy. Doing insurance stuff over the phone was a lot less fun than when she had friends in the booths across and next to her. It wasn't that she didn't enjoy working from home, it was just...

Ugh, she was lonely.

She hadn't talked to any of her coworkers in weeks; some of them months. None of Hannah's family lived in the same state as she did. She didn't really know where she could go to meet new people or... do anything, and none of her pants fit right anymore and she hadn't gone shopping because... because, okay? She had other shit to do. And she wasn't begrudging Claire for going to the gym, but... you know, fuck the gym. She and Hannah had been friends for a long time, and Claire didn't even ask if she wanted to go with her anymore.

Hannah's thick fingers peeled back the cellophane that hid the first few cookies on the second row. Grabbing three at a time, she washed it down with some beer—the good kind. She had forgotten how much she liked beer. Claire had turned into kind of a food nazi lately, so she had to keep it in her room or she'd make that face.

At least if Claire were here though, they could watch TV like they used to. Now she was out with her coworker, Dana. Get a fucking room already. For all the shit Claire used to have to say about Dana "needing to be careful" and "starting to worry her", the fact that they were all buddy-buddy now had started to rub Hannah the wrong way. The beer didn't help.

Another handful of cookies, a big swig from the can. A monster belch that pierced through the apartment. Hannah pat her fat stomach absently, a chuckle on her breath as she reclined a little further into the couch.

Whenever she and Claire used to have a fight, back before Claire had gotten a job and spent all day on the couch, they would leave these out for each other. Little aluminum apologies. They were both headstrong and stubborn chicks, even back then, so you could bet that neither of them was actually going to say the words "I'm sorry". It didn't always work, but more often than not, Hannah (because of course it was Hannah who got apologized to the most) would crack open the cold one and sit down on the couch next to Claire and they'd co-op whatever game she'd been playing for a match or two.

Of course, that had been back when they were in their early twenties. Now they were both in their mid twenties. That was back when Hannah had been working at the office and before Claire had even gotten a job. Back before she was so hung up on this weight loss stuff...

Good times.

Maybe it was time for a little aluminum apology? A little throwback to show that Hannah was sorry for... whatever it was that had gotten between them.

In her hazy recollection, two rows of cookies and half a case into the night, it seemed like a good idea...

"Here'sto frenship." Hannah chuckled thickly as she slammed the can down on the mail catch, "Drinkup, girlie."
12533112111112122121121122111.title: Aluminum Apology

choices: Claire and Hannah are on opposite sides of 300—and the gap is narrowing
Claire or Dana gets lazy and backslides—threatening the other's progress
125331121111121221211211221112.content:
"Ughhhh how the fuck are you losing so much weight."

Claire and Dana had continued their efforts to curb their respective waistlines. Every other weekday, Monday Wednesday and Friday, plus alternating Saturdays and Sundays, they tried to go to the gym and do something "healthy". Sometimes it was going to walk around their town's dying mall, sometimes it was a light lunch, and other times it was just going over to Dana's house so that they avoided everything unhealthy.

They weren't always successful, of course. Claire had enough trouble keeping her own appetite under control, and Dana didn't have the experience of having lost one hundred and fifty pounds to taper her more greedy tendencies. They were both big girls who liked to eat, and getting them together wasn't always conducive to a healthy lifestyle, but they managed to continue a steady shrinking between them and that was all that mattered. The nights spent pigging out or skipping a day at the gym were vastly outnumbered by the nights that they stayed true to their diet plans.

The Holidays had stalled their weight loss some. Halloween had seen Jean succumbing to hiding "tricks and treats" around the office to boost morale, and both had been edible. Dana's mother (a big woman herself, though nowhere near the size of her daughter) had invited them over for Thanksgiving and Christmas. New Year's with Hannah had meant that they had gotten plenty drunk and went on a binge and a bender in the same night. The time of the year that everyone ate the most wasn't lost on two big eaters like Claire and Dana, but the damage had thankfully been minimal.

"I'm so jealous." Dana said longingly, watching Claire do a clumsy turn in her new pink button-up, "It's not fair."

Claire had managed to drop down to 370 at the beginning of the year, evening out at around 375 after a small backslide in February. For the first time in far, far too long, Claire was well under 400 pounds.

Her efforts at losing weight had finally started to show in her face. No longer chubby-cheeked and jowly, Claire had gotten back down to merely round-faced and double-chinned. Her blonde hair tied back in a ponytail, you could see her ears from head-on now, instead of them being eclipsed by the fullness of her face. It was this that she was most proud of, after Jean pointed it out offhandedly, but the rest of her losses weren't to be ignored.

Claire had receded on the x and z axis, her stomach shrinking further back into her figure. Her ass had, unfortunately, not lost at the same rate that her breasts had, but her upper arms were getting smaller! She was experiencing things that she hadn't thought about, like her fingers getting less stubby and the fat around her feet slimming enough to put her in a different shoe size. Every day, Claire felt a difference as she maneuvered her steadily shrinking body with a growing deft and ease.The gate had even stopped giving her trouble!

"Oh, come on, don't be like that." Claire tut-tutted, "You're back under 400!"

"Yeah, but I'm still at like 390." Dana rolled her eyes and shifted (loudly) in her seat, "How did you wind up as the skinny one?"

"Because I don't take extra cheat days." Claire stuck her tongue out, "You've gotta start cleaning out your car if you don't want me to catch on."

"Hey, I drive right by like six fast food places on my way home." Dana harrumphed, "Let's see you turn down a Cheesy Gordita Crunch seven days in a row."

The two of them laughed, only to hush themselves like schoolgirls when they saw Jean's office door open. The sight of their fat-bottomed boss waddling out onto the floor brought out further giggling between them, no matter how hard they tried to suppress it. As much as Claire was all about losing weight, the amount of pleasure that she had taken in her boss steadily blowing up over the years had increased as she had become increasingly pearshaped. Jean's saddlebag thighs and fat legs filled the bottom half of her pantsuit to capacity with squishy seas of subcutaneous fat, jutting out behind her like a tray as she wobbled belly-first into the office at large was a guilty pleasure if Claire had ever known one. Some days, when she'd felt that Jean was being especially bitchy, she looked forward to this part of lunch more than the actual meal part.

"Ladies." she said curtly, nodding her head (double chin creasing noticeably)

"Enjoy your lunch, bosslady!" Dana called out with just a hint of wickedness, "We'll be here when you get back!"

The older woman smirked at her employee's barely innocuous comment. Any and all encouragement and criticism that Claire had faced about her weight had slowly begun to disappear as her formerly fit boss had learned what life was like on the other side of plus-size, plumping up to what had to have been at least two hundred and fifty pounds since Claire had started working under her just a few short years ago. Claire would have been lying if she said that she didn't appreciate the irony.

"But will all of her buttons be?" Dana snickered as soon as she was out of earshot, "That's the question!"

"You're horrible." Claire laughed, swatting at her friend's pillowy arm fat, "Don't be like that."

"Like you weren't thinking the exact same thing."

"I mean..."

Claire and Dana continued to gossip and giggle over their mild lunches, packed (mostly) in accordance with their weight loss plans. It was hard work losing weight, but between the two of them, they were having more success than just about anyone else that they knew...
125331121111121221211211221112.title: Diet Triumphant

choices: "Nah. Actually, I was wondering if you wanted to hit that pizza buffet?"
1253311211111212212112112211121.content:
At first, Claire thought it was a fluke. She thought it was a trick of the angle.

But as she leaned back, she figured she could properly see the tips of her toes over her increasingly shrunken belly which by the day she could barely believe was her own. Her old clothes with so many X’s in the XL’s that you could barely count were far too baggy to consider wearing even as comfy shirts. She was approaching the point where even her clothes from the first of her weight loss, in the mid-to-lower 400’s were starting to reach that point.

She took a moment to walk towards the bathroom - her thighs were starting to slim to the point where her trademark waddle, though still present to a degree, was starting to lessen to a walk. She stood on her scale and listened for the readout. With how busy her schedule had been, she hadn’t weighed in for a few weeks, but she felt herself losing weight.

“Three Hundred and Forty Nine Pounds,” the monotone scale announced.

She was beside herself - she was in the lower end of the three hundred range for the first time since high school. She was starting to feel movement become a comparative breeze - she felt herself lighten in her everyday movements, how fast it was to get up now that she was sub-350.

The same could not be said for Hannah. She had been on the couch for a while now. She was eating another breakfast of cereal and a cinnamon bun… plus a cookie to go with her coffee. It seemed that every bit of mobility Claire had been losing, Hannah had been gaining. It was inconceivable that barely a few years ago, she had been the slim, healthy one in the apartment. Her gut extended further and further out, her limbs becoming burdened with seemingly every pound that Claire was losing.
Hannah had truly become just another roommate - she almost never spoke with Claire these days except on odd occasions where they ate together, and it was usually for small, everyday topics - what was in the fridge, how work was going, how their love lives were going. The former friends were now live-in strangers.

The new weight made Hannah’s life harder in everyday scenarios - climbing up the stairs to their apartment became damn near unbearable. The older building had no elevator- something that forced slimming Claire to adapt and gave Hannah great consternation. More and more, Hannah ordered from grocery-delivery services, and she moved even less than she formerly had to - responding to the results of her lethargy with more lethargy.

Claire grew more startled as the weeks went by - Hannah was officially fatter than her, and she had NEVER not been the fattest one in nearly any room. It was an odd experience, psychologically, to recognize that Hannah was now the ‘fatter’ one in the apartment.

Hannah’s ever-soaring weight would push her to endeavor for new friends. She had thought that Claire would be her friend as she gained weight - who would have thought that the fat cow that was Claire Spittz would actually stick with a diet? Who would have thought that the woman who had literally zero willpower would have actually developed the will to resist binging on food every day, 24 hours a day, who would have thought that she would have, at the same time Hannah had chosen to let go, made a life-changing decision to lose weight? It would be blatantly wrong to state that, mentally, Hannah grew more

Alternatively, she thought of trying to join Claire on her weight loss. She felt herself getting more sluggish and heavier and more immense by the day, every hour was one spent getting fatter than Claire. Hannah could prove that she was superior in willpower. Though more friendly about it in earlier days, she increasingly fantasized about these earlier days - where she was the thin, slim, healthy one issuing the lectures to obese, on-the-verge-of-death Claire. She partially wanted to restore this - to bring Claire back to where she should be, if this endeavour failed.

But then again, why not just focus on that NOW? If it was the issue of restoring balance to her world, it was important enough to expend the effort to try to correct her universe - to make Claire the fat, lazy cow she envisioned her to be.
1253311211111212212112112211121.title: Hannah's hefty issues.

choices: Hannah drowns her bitterness in food. Claire asks her what's up.
Hannah fattens up Dana to get back at Claire.
12533112111112122121121122111211.content:
Hannah's car hummed along as she spoke up, "So, what are we gonna do here at the gym?" Claire thought, and spoke, "Uh, I was thinking some cardio, some lifting. You good with that?" Hannah shrugged and spoke, "Uh, yeah, sounds good. Take it easy on the cardio - I'm a little out of form." Claire wanted to jab there, but she had figured that her just-renewing relationship with Hannah was not something to test this early.

The conversation itself had been something of a shock to Claire - she offered it as the usual courtesy, "Hey, heading to the gym - want to come?" It was a happy surprise that Hannah was coming. She was hopeful that on her healthy journey, she'd take her friends with her. Lonesomeness had nearly been the death of her diet and a danger to her health.

Hannah, herself, had been hopeful she would be able to better her health. Walking through the lobby to the locker room, she felt ready to hopefully burn out her bitterness through the motions of exercise, along with her newfound pounds. Her great legs shook and jiggled in comparison to the now slightly smaller Claire, her gut shook and swayed. Hannah noticed her mass as she pulled on her impromptu exercise clothes - some grey sweatpants drawn up tight and a loose black shirt. She couldn't help but balefully notice that Claire wore well-fitting leggings and a nice tank top that complemented her still obese, but shrinking form.

What inane power decided that Claire should be the one to lose weight, and for Hannah to gain it? For HER to get this fat? She knew it was wrong to be so angry - her internal monologue continued as Claire led them to the ellipticals. Pull the sticks, push them, pull the sticks, push them - then another bout - That stuck-up whale, she thinks she's in control. She thinks she's better than me. She's flaunting her success and my failure.

At the same time, Hannah attempted to expel her bitterness - Claire's getting healthy. I've wanted this for years, I just stumbled. It's a common journey, her nicer side said. God, her overall consciousness thought, this elliptical makes my lungs burn! She was so out of breath! God, had it even been five minutes? Her cellulite-ridden blubber flew like sails packed with butter in a hurricane, jiggling and billowing! She glanced at Claire - the fat woman was still struggling, but far less - her lungs were getting used to the exertion, if Hannah's eyes weren't lying to her, she was jiggling less than her - firmness was starting to sprout in the midst of her movement.

Come on. Keep going. You can beat that fat whale, her bitterness rasped. Her lungs had a different opinion on the matter entirely, and her legs were aching from the intense action. Her esophagus seared with heat and she felt her stomach turning over from the exertion, it took all the control in her body to stop herself from vomiting. She slowed to a crawl to gain her breath back - she could not stop or she'd be admitting defeat to the one who ought to be fatter than her.

At least Dana was doing about as badly as her. Dana was slowing, slowing, slowing - no, she was just raising the elevation on her elliptical. Damn it. It was too much to hope that the newcomer would be as out-of-shape as Hannah. If anything, though, Hannah was just barely smaller than Dana. That gave her some solace. The pig was getting too much self-control - maybe this one would be an easier target if Hannah wanted to get back at Claire?

At last, Claire and Dana stepped off their treadmills. They had worked FAR more intensely than Hannah, that could not be denied, but Hannah claimed it as a mental victory.

The blubbery trio stopped at the water fountain, gulping down the soothing clear fluid as they sat on a bench. "So, uh, Hannah, you did pretty...good back there," said Dana. Hannah put on a smile as Dana spoke, "Awwh! Thanks, I'm amazed I didn't pass out, it's been a while since i've been in a gym." Dana replied, "Yeah - before Claire started taking me, I hadn't gone to a gym since high school." I can see how that went, thought Hannah as she considered Dana's still immense form.

Then they moved to squats. "Jah, das glutes," spoke Claire in a cheesy German accent. She mounted the bar on her still fat-padded shoulders. A considerable 120 was on the bars as she stepped back from the rack and brought her butt down inches from her heels, then rose. Two more repetitions and her form began to shake, sending her still - blubbery thighs jiggling, her stomach quivered after a few more repetitions, when she finally put the bar back up. "Hooh. Wow, your turn, Dana," she said as she stepped back, gulping from her water bottle. Ten reps, I can beat that fatass, thought Hannah. Dana repeated the motions, but lowered the weight to 90 - her form was shaking from the second rep, and she jiggled far more than Claire - still softer of form, and at only eight reps, she put the bar back up. "Good job, girlie. Get them buns," called Claire as she smacked Dana's ass, Dana returning the sisterly gesture.

Hannah stepped up. This was her moment of truth. No need to lower the weight. Claire inquired, "You know how to do it?" Hannah gave her a dismissive wave, "Ah, I used to lift, I'm fine." Hannah prayed that she still had SOME of her old muscle.

Thankfully, her prayers were answered - her form didn't shake. Another rep, her form didn't shake. She felt the weight of the bar press down into her back and transfer down into her gluteus. Come on, she couldn't shake yet. She had to prove she was BETTER. She held her form strong into her third rep. Her fourth rep. God, it burned. But she still had some muscle memory of her old lifting phase just out of college - she kept firm until the sixth rep. She pressed on, eight, nine, ten. Her ass screamed for reprieve and her massive gut, her legs, her arms, jiggled and swung in the force of her action.

No fucking way I'm giving up, she thought. She pressed on. Eleven. Twelve. She could do no more - she put the bar back up. "Ohh. Huh. Still got it, baby!" A celebratory round of ass-slaps was shared by the three, sending their weary bottoms jiggling along with the tops of their cellulite-filled thighs.

They left that night weary as all sin, exhausted, but exhilarated. Hannah was proud of herself, as was Claire proud of her. "Girlie, you did so well tonight! You're makin' me jealous." Hannah strutted her stuff as best as she could but stumbled - leg day was HELL on her ability to walk. Her legs felt like pure Jell-O, gelatin jiggling and swaying as she barely caught herself on Dana's fat arm. "Thanks...Yeah, I still got it."

In part, she felt proud of herself, but she knew she wouldn't be able to beat her bitterness this easily. It was a consistent thing, and if not drowned out, it would manifest itself. She was certainly proud of her progress at the gym, but it wasn't enough alone to drown her bitterness. She kept up her workouts, but the bitterness continued - it either needed to express itself, or she needed to drown it.
12533112111112122121121122111211.title: Hannah's Hardships

choices: She pours it all out for Claire, who helps her cope with both issues and weight.
She keeps it pent up - and her weight continues exploding.
125331121111121221211211221112111.content:
Hannah's mental conflict came to a boiling point as she sat in the apartment living room. Even looking at Claire working on washing dishes, not getting breathless at all, still provoked the unwelcome outburst of bitterness in her mind - God, look at that fat whale. She's putting on an act, she actually can barely breathe. How can she do it- God, at times, she could barely stand herself! As she became more aware of her own bitterness, she thought counter-thoughts constantly - No, she can breathe just fine. She's getting fit - something I should work harder at. It wasn't enough, the intrusive thoughts were deafening - Even if that's true, the stupid cow has no right to be smaller than me. I'm the thin one. She's the fat one. She's -

No. Enough. Hannah went to the only thing she could think of to do - she went to her snack stash and shut herself away in her room - she would silence these thoughts over the sound of digestion. Family-sized bags of chips that would normally form two snacks made the first part of an epic binge - she consumed it, a whole pack of snickers' candy bars - six bars, gone like the wind - she felt herself filling up, but it wasn't enough. She had to shut it up for the rest of the day - she filled her mouth with more salty snacks, and only truly stopped at the end of this bag when she felt the results almost coming back up. There it was - now she could focus on keeping her food down - swallowing gulps of saliva to quell the incoming nausea.

Claire couldn't help but notice the trend - although Hannah's dedication pushed her harder at the gym, she continued to set herself back - while she and Dana grew thinner, Hannah continued to grow in size - her gut increased in size in massive strides - despite the hundreds of calories burned at the gym, she binged back each one and thousands more. It didn't take a genius either to notice the massive food intake or the results. Hannah's weight absolutely exploded over that week - it seemed impossible but she was putting on nearly 2 pounds every day. Her gut was constantly engorged, she was almost constantly nauseous, and even her

It was impossible for Claire to not say anything, but she had long since figured out that food nazi-ing people didn't work. She spoke to Hannah from the couch as she blew through a party bag of barbecue chips, speaking softly - "Girl, are you okay?" Hannah stopped for a moment, looking up at Claire. She sighed and put aside the bag of chips, "Uh.. Just..eating." Claire spoke up, "I know, and I'm not trying to be an asshole, but... you're kind of.. binging, really hard, and it's been going on for a week, and you're not letting up. What's eating you?" Hannah held back - "Oh, just, uh... issues. I'll be fine. I just need to eat a bit more." Claire spoke up, pulling her still considerable body to a seat next to the nearly 400 pound woman, "I don't think you will - the food won't kill whatever you're trying to kill, just bury it. Trust me. I tried that."

It re-connected with Hannah. She had almost forgotten that Claire had to have blown up to that size. Part of Hannah's problem was that she couldn't simply imagine Claire as being thinner - it was almost to that bitter part of her mind that the woman was dropped onto the earth as a massive blob. "I guess... It's just, it's something hard to talk about, and eating to cover it up's easier." Claire pushed on - "Well, if you tell me what it is that's bothering you, I can help you out." Hannah sighed. "I... It's..." She couldn't find the words. How do you open up to someone that part of you is bitter that they're getting healthy? How can you just open a door of insecurity, already heavy with psychological weight, and expose something that might be so harmful?
125331121111121221211211221112111.title: Gym and Gorging.

choices: The girls are thirty and thin, and staying that way!
The girls make the bar a bit of a habit - and the pounds come creeping back.
1253311211111212212112112211121111.content:
Hannah sighed. This would be awkward - but it was the only productive path forward. She respected Claire enough to be honest with her - and she wanted her old friend to help her, if she could. "It's just, some dark, bitter part of myself couldn't accept that I was getting fatter than you, and it was just so bitter... All I could do to shut it up was to binge, to eat, and shut it up with food." Claire smiled and gave her a hug. "Well, you're recognizing that the bitterness is wrong - and that's all that matters!" Hannah looked, happily, "So - you're not angry with me?" Claire smiled - "No, not at all. If anything, I'm more than happy enough to help you through this!"

And with those words, the residual bitterness, already assaulted by the deeper recognition of Claire's pre-existing struggles, was banished by Claire's forgiving nature - Claire's willingness to embrace friendship over grudge-holding and anger.

It was a real task to focus on the gym and eating better - and it was a genuine struggle for a woman who had gotten used to stuffing her face, 24/7. She struggled with reducing her food intake to reasonable levels - and she had more than one relapse - but her friends were there for her.

The workout sessions got more intense - more difficult, more rigorous, but the three tackled the task with a new diligence found in their rise from sloth and gluttony. Dana and Hannah had more than a few temporary relapses in terms of dieting, but Claire was there to help them get back on track without judgement and without anger.

It turns out, some kindness can go a long way in aiding weight loss when the world only confronted one with demand for endless rigor and shaming failure - the group's cellulite-pumped bodies shrunk week by week, month by month, and year by year as the trio pumped iron - even got into running. Claire was the running champion of the group, while Hannah beat all three in weight-lifting. Dana was always more into bodyweight exercises, which even with a slimming form, Claire struggled with.

They shrunk to 300, then 200 - then the 100's. After spending months and years of their lives in obesity, they were thin again. For Claire, it was one hell of a mountain she had climbed - and it made her all the more proud of herself and what her body had accomplished. She had gotten off her meds - her body had healed from most of the cumulative damage done to it over years of feasting and gorging. After four long years, Claire's thirties were rung in at 140 pounds.

Their work ethic in the gym carried over into the office - in no time at all, they rose through the ranks - reaching the regional office. Their stories were one of those uplifting favorites in the office - ones that made their more blubbery co-workers, who, though barely in the 180's, a bit bashful regarding their own efforts. Hannah's own office work got her a nice corner office and a corporate position - with all three making some cash, they bid farewell to the apartment that was the scene of so much binging and so much gluttony.

Their new houses were gorgeous - Hannah and Claire moved into a two-story blue-sided house in a cozy neighborhood, nestled off a secondary road, close to their jobs. Meanwhile, Dana lived just down the street in a one-story, but still comfortable green-sided ranch-style house. They regularly alternated between each other's homes, but Claire and Hannah's house was good for when they were all sauced and needed a place to stay.

One night, they opted to go to Jessica's Bar and Grill instead of the gym. They had all gotten fairly slim - though Claire's belly still had a slight pooch near her belly-button, while Hannah's thighs still carried a hint more fat than Claire's. Dana still carried a slim margin of fat across her body. By no means was any of them fat in any sense of the word anymore, however - they were not even half of their former size.

Claire sighed contentedly as she sipped from her beer - "Man, it's so crazy. New pads, new jobs, and basically new bodies." Dana slurred - "Issa glow-up." Hannah toasted her shot - "Amen to that," and downed her shot.
1253311211111212212112112211121111.title: Friends help each other out.

12533112111112122121121122111211111.content:
That next day in the regional office for the printing company, Claire and Dana walked into the break room with their usual smoothies and grilled chicken sandwiches - Dana had splurged a bit today, and gotten hers fried.

Watching the two, Sara, their cottage-pale coworker couldn't believe they were eating rabbit food like that for lunch. Then again, Sara's usual lunch was a greasy bag of fries and a large burger that contented her large stomach - which grew by the day towards her knees. She asked, "Had a good day so far?" Claire nodded happily - "Mm-hmm, though we've got big plans for tonight." Dana chuckled, "She thinks she can beat my planking record." Sara waved a hand, dismissively, "Ah, all that rabbit food and working out was never for me. I don't know how you guys can do it."

Claire, in what was a new strain of thought for her, thought, Well, I don't know how I could shove grease down my throat, but there you are. She held it back and quietly chastised herself for thinking that - but it really wasn't Sara's place to comment on what she was eating. "Well, it takes some dedication," said Dana. Claire hummed after swallowing a gulp of chicken - "You know, the working out part is actually pretty fun. You ought to join us." Sara shook her head, "Ah, I'm too fat to work out."

Claire intoned - "You know, Dana and I used to be over 400 pounds." Sara thought and then spoke, "I'd heard, but I just kinda...can't believe it, looking at you now. Like, it sounds like a different set of people." Dana and Claire couldn't help but feel proud. "Well, believe it or not, we did it. There's nothing that stops you from doing the same thing."

Sara shrugged - "You know what? I just planned to sit around anyways, why not." She chided herself for starting this by making fun of the two's lunch, but she figured that going and doing something with her co-workers would be better than sitting around.

Claire and Dana happily walked out of the office that day, hoping they'd won themselves another convert to the same journey that had taken them so far. That night, they met Sara, whose 50+ inch gut jiggled with each step atop her rotund thighs.

As the workout began, she struggled to keep up with Dana's directions - she was out of breath from jumping up and down, her jiggling blubber ached. It couldn't be any more different than how Dana felt - her limbs felt so nimble, she almost began to take it for granted, but deep down, she acknowledged how light she felt when performing the exercises. Burpees especially were her pride - even while she was good at running, Claire was still out of breath a bit faster than her on those. She looked over, almost forgetting poor, fat Sara - who laid on the floor, panting, heaving. "Oh. Shit." She paused her music. The obese woman was on her belly, panting and struggling. "Yeahhh, Claire, we might wanna do more basics."

Sara would be one of those they couldn't quite convert - remaining obese to her dying day years ahead of time, a fate that Dana, Hannah, and Claire had avoided by their effort and willpower, not to mention their friendship. They found love in their own time, and they even had children in thinner bodies that expanded slightly - though none of them ever even got above 200, Dana only briefly getting back up to 210 after her second child.

They spent many years on Earth and spent them happily, and although they'd occasionally put on a few pounds here and there, never again would they achieve the life-threatening heights of gluttony they achieved in their 20's.
12533112111112122121121122111211111.title: Thirty and Thin

choices: Their lunches become more fattening - their co-workers comment on it.
Hannah wakes up to her gains, and tries to warn the others. They don't listen.
12533112111112122121121122111211112.content:
The weekend came after another week at work, another week of spreadsheets and phone calls and e-mails. They met at Jessica's sitting at their "usual" spot, attended to by the southern bartender. "Hey, the gang's all here. I'll get you them three beers, and yer food orders when I get baick with 'em." Hannah nodded, "Thanks, Mae."

The bartender leaving the trio alone, Dana smiled, turning to Hannah. "So, ready for me to top your squatting record at the gym next week?" Hannah chuckled, "Depends. Ready to lose your burpee record?" Claire shook her head, "You ain't beating the burpee record!" Hannah smirked, replying, "Watch me, I'll do it." Claire sighed, "I'd order the grilled chicken, but this week, I need a treat." Dana nodded, "I'm with you, girl. I'm thinking the Cheetos burger myself." Hannah raised her brows, "You're actually doing it this time? No joke?" Dana shook her head, "No joke, I'm getting it." Hannah shrugged and spoke, "Cause if we're getting the yumms, I'm thinking wings, but you're weird." Claire chuckled and spoke, "Shit, we knew that about Dana for a while."

The three laughed heartily as their beers arrived, and they placed their food orders. The bartender avoided commenting on their food - she wasn't the thinnest woman in the world, and god knows, she hated it when people commented about what she ate. She couldn't help but notice this was a bit more 'lax' than these three normally got.

Of course, it was no skin off her bones if this became their regular order.

They sat, drinking their beers and chatting. Just before the food arrived, Hannah sighed, "Man, Monday's gonna suck. Our department's behind on a deadline that's due then, and we're due for a chewing-out." Dana groaned, "Oh, don't remind me of our own. We're behind on our networking, and we're supposed to have this memo to Haradane by Thursday, and we haven't even compiled shit for it yet."

They comisserated over their stresses over the fries and burgers. The juicy, greasy treats were delicious to the throats of these much-reduced women. They consumed them with an old ardor that once drove them to obesity, and the bartender saw it. Damn, she thought, I see them much more around here, they'll get to be the size of a house.

The alcohol made them lose their inhibitions. More alcohol tended to make them think their stomachs were bottomless - and after a few more beers came a round of appetizers. Drunk and stuffed to the brim, with their previously slim stomachs now bulging with alcohol and food. The rest of Claire's belly came out to meet her remnant spare tire for the moment, and her belly poked out just that much further than anyone else's.

The stress of the workplace did a number on their dedication to come back to the gym. The next night, they came back. They didn't visit the bar EVERY night, but on select week-nights and as a regular destination on the weekends. Over the next few weeks, the Bartender began to see her prediction come true. Claire's shirt got tighter at the belly again, Dana's body in general began to pad with fat, In general, the group began to grow in size.

The office began to give them odd glances when they weren't looking - and the gossip machine exploded in the breakroom when they were out. "Dude - Claire's getting pretty chunky again," said their co-worker Haley in a quiet voice as she parted her bleach-blonde hair at the table. The tan latina, Veronica, leaned in and nodded. "Mm-hmm. She's going to have to bump up to a bigger shirt, and soon. Her buttons are screaming every time I see her." Anna confusedly shook her small, brown-haired head, "Like, I don't get it. I thought they were big on fitness." Haley sipped her coffee, speaking, "Not anymore, I don't think."

The trio were still somewhat unaware of their own gains. Claire attributed her gains to bad laundry days, and the classic excuse - "It shrunk in the laundry," she'd mumble to herself. She couldn't be getting fat again. Hannah had her suspicions, but she didn't pay much attention to it - it was just bloating, and it would blow over - she hoped. Dana was just too focused on keeping up with her workload and enjoying herself on the weekends - she was blissfully ignorant of her clothes growing ever more snug and ever more tight.

Thus, this weekend routine, as weeks became a month, and a month became two, led the three to grow increasingly fat. After two months, they had put on quite a few pounds. It was only a matter of time before someone noticed their gains.
12533112111112122121121122111211112.title: Old friends, new pounds.

choices: "Well, obviously you haven't, honey, 'cos you've put on some pounds."
"I guess you're right. Just watch out, Those pounds can creep on you."
125331121111121221211211221112111121.content:
Thursday had come for the trio, who walked into the office ready to knuckle under on the deadlines. They had made admirable progress, and Hannah's had been tackled - which is why she was entrusted with an important task for Dana and Claire.

While Dana and Claire finalized the drafting of the Memo, Hannah was driving to grab some drive-in burgers. Thankfully, she hadn't put on so much weight that she was having issues buckling her seatbelt - but she remembered it coming up a bit shorter than usual. Her suspicion was quieted by the sheer idiocy of the people on the road while she drove to pick up the food. "SIGNAL NEXT TIME YOU CUT ME OFF, YOU FUCKING DICK-WIT!" she shouted out the window, receiving a proud middle-finger from the driver.

She remembered the order as Dana and Claire described it, and repeated the order to the voice-box: "Yeah - can I get two large Double-Burgers with bacon and cheese, and a large Chicken Sandwich?" Somehow, her subconscious connected the order to her weight - she knew in the back of her mind that the 'treats' were becoming a habit, first with the bars, and if they weren't careful, so would these fast food visits. However, she felt like she just needed to relax after a stressful week. Sure, she was making plenty of dough, but the office's deadlines made one find coping mechanisms.

For a while, it was the gym - but as gym visits began to be increasingly replaced by bar visits, and alcohol calories piled onto the women's waistlines, it was more and more focusing on Jessica's and food.
